Amherst has taken a leadership role among highly selective liberal arts colleges and universities in successfully diversifying the racial, socio-economic, and geographic profile of its student body. The College is similarly committed to enriching its educational experience and its culture through the diversity of its faculty, administration and staff.
Job Description:
Amherst College invites applications for the Business Analyst position. The Business Analyst is a full-time, year-round position, starting at $85,000 per year - commensurate with experience. Given Amherst’s distinction as one of the most diverse liberal arts colleges in the country, the successful candidate will demonstrate the ways in which they bring value to and will work towards supporting a broadly diverse community.
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Business Analyst to join our Enterprise Applications team. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and documenting business processes, identifying opportunities for improvement, and providing support for the implementation and maintenance of Workday and other Enterprise Applications. While Workday experience is not required, it would be considered a valuable asset. Additionally, IT experience in higher education is preferred.
Summary of Responsibilities:
Requirements Gathering: Engage with internal stakeholders to understand business needs and requirements. Analyze and translate these requirements into clear and concise user stories, workflows, process maps, and specifications.
Implementation Support: Collaborate with functional area leads and technical teams to implement solutions that align with business objectives. Provide guidance on system configuration, security, and business process workflows.
Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop and execute test plans for new functionality and updates. Ensure the quality and accuracy of the system by identifying and resolving issues in a timely manner.
Communication: Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams. Communicate changes, updates, and known issues to relevant parties. Provide training and support to end-users as needed.
Documentation: Create and maintain technical and end-user documentation. Document business processes, data flows, and reporting requirements to support system enhancements and changes.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor the performance and adoption of Workday and other Enterprise solutions. Identify opportunities for optimization and enhancement, recommending and implementing improvement plans.
Technical Support: Provide Level three support for escalated inquiries, troubleshooting complex issues, and coordinating with other IT teams as needed.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with at least 1 year of hands-on experience working with an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) or Student Information System (SIS).
Experience in requirements gathering, documentation, and system implementation in a functional or technical context.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to investigate and resolve technical issues.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with excellent time management and organizational skills.
Commitment to or experience working with diverse communities.
Preferred:
IT experience in higher education.
Familiarity with testing techniques and software.
Strong understanding of Workday modules such as HCM, Finance, and/or Student.
Experience in higher education environments, especially in a technology role.
Business acumen coupled with the ability to acquire technical knowledge.
Knowledge of Accounting, Human Resources, and Payroll policies and procedures, including reporting to the federal government.
Familiarity with Workday report writer software.
Project management experience, taking a concept from ideation through execution alongside other team members.

Note: While Workday experience is preferred, it is not required for this role, making it a good fit for candidates with strong Business Analyst skills and a background in IT in higher education.

The Harvard Medical School Student Information Systems Team supports the students, faculty, staff, and alumni of Harvard Medical School, inclusive of the Program in Medical Education (PME), the Graduate Programs, and the PHD programs in Integrated Life Sciences. Incumbent will independently analyze, identify, develop and communicate technical solutions. Devise and/or modify procedures to solve complex technical problems.

Responsibilities of the Business Systems Analyst include:
Use deep knowledge of Student/Faculty business processes, technology, analytical and organizational skills, problem solving skills, and outreach with constituents to develop better tools, systems, and administrative processes.

Project manage one or more new business process or technological initiatives.

Work with the technical team to make sure that requirements are well understood as part of the software development lifecycle;
Perform user acceptance testing for student information systems and other processes.
Work independently to document, configure and test enhancements and fixes.
Identifies and documents comprehensive test cases;
Assist with user training, documentation, and business process workflow design.

Minimum of two years’ post-secondary education or relevant work experience

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or similar field
Master's degree preferred
5+ years of IT experience with 2 – 4 years in business analysis
Experience with Student Information Systems, Slate admissions, Blue Course evaluations
PeopleSoft, SQL, PL/SQL or other data/reporting languages/software experience

Familiarity with the agile methodology and experienced working with agile frameworks and tools

Job Overview

Tufts Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI) (www.tuftsctsi.org), one of more than 60 organizations supported by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Clinical and Translational Science Awards (CTSAs), was established in 2008 to transform the biomedical research process through education, promoting collaboration, and the provision of research infrastructure and support services. Tufts CTSI accelerates the translation of laboratory research into clinical use, medical practice, and health policy. In addition to its work with Tufts University, Tufts Medical Center, and other partner organizations, Tufts CTSI contributes to the national CTSA Consortium.

The Tufts CTSI Application Analyst is an opportunity for the right applicant to make an impact by providing support to Tufts CTSI staff and research investigators by developing and managing tools for data collection, management of Tufts CTSI’s REDCap and Salesforce applications, including managing updates, customer messaging, development of new projects and extensions, and data management.

If you are an analyst who takes initiative, is collaborative, has great customer service skills, and enjoys working independently and as part of a team, apply today!


Job Description

Minimum Qualifications:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field.

2. Appropriate certifications or obtain certifications within a reasonable timeline.

3. Four (4) years of healthcare business analyst/IT experience.


Preferred Qualifications:

1. Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field.

2. Five (5) years of healthcare business analyst/IT experience.

3. Experience using EPIC.

4. Experience using databases and building queries (SQL)


Duties and Responsibilities: The duties and responsibilities listed below are intended to describe the general nature of work and are not intended to be an all-inclusive list. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.


1. Serves as an experienced business specialist and technology generalist responsible for aligning technology solutions with business needs per the strategic direction set forth by leadership and key stakeholders.

2. Serves as an intermediary between internal groups and third-party solutions or vendors to ensure the integrity and optimization of the technical build or solution is optimal.

3. Supports build-related and issue research/resolution tasks

4. Provides both local service area team support as well as, direct user support by correlating user needs with process design and improvement.

5. Secures sufficient and thorough system testing consistent with protocols established by the organizations governance committees required to approve the migration of updates into the production environment.

6. Develops and maintains standard technical and operational documentation for all implemented efforts to support sustainability and end-user education/ experience/ results.

7. Supports small and medium sized projects.

8. Actively seeks on-going education and understanding of current/ available system functionality, benefits, and implementation requirements to ensure competence as a subject matter expert (“SME”) in areas of assigned focus.

9. Engages continuously with operational teams to gain context and an understanding of pertinent business processes and workflows.

10. Promotes and champions a technology enabled, data-driven operations across the health system; aims to establish formal measures of performance for all initiatives, implemented workflow, and as determine fitting to quantify other efforts/ output.

11. As assigned, conducts research and analyses sufficient to vet the application of technologies with potential to enhance business processes/ performance. Presents findings aligned with measurable optimization to leaders/ applicable decision makers for consideration.

12. Seeks technical and professional guidance from experienced team members to promote strong team dynamics and ensure the quality of the work output.

14. Promotes a culture of continuous learning and knowledge share across the team, workgroup, department, and other key stakeholder groups.

15. Collaborates with others to support the continuous alignment of systems, process, analytics, and education to promote technical adoption and utilization.

16. Collaborates with teammates to support the monitoring, and adjustment of work plans through successful completion.


Physical Requirements:

1. Mental requirements will be intense at times with involvement in many concurrent multi-faceted projects.

2. Requires manual dexterity using fine hand manipulation to operate a computer keyboard or related equipment.

3. Requires ability to see computer screen, monitoring equipment and reports.


Skills & Abilities:

1. Ability to use Microsoft Office Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio.

2. Ability to gain additional competence using Microsoft Access, Project Management software.

3. Strong technical, analytical, problem-solving, project management skills.

4. Knowledge of organization and project management methodologies.

5. Ability to influence others to prioritize and complete tasks, through completion by established deliverable dates.

6. Ability and willingness to learn new technical applications and information quickly and utilize application tools and information to meet end-user/ operational requirement.

7. High degree of professionalism and integrity is required.

8. Effective team player.

9. Strong written and verbal communication with excellent customer service orientation.

10. Ability to understand and explain complex, technical information to a non-technical user.

11. Ability to be agile and navigate through uncertainty; support team members ability to do the same.

12. Ability to interpret data and identify meaningful patterns.

13. Ability to be resourceful in gathering pertinent information to inform decision-making.

14. Ability to manage and balance multiple priorities simultaneously. Organize work effectively; seek timely guidance as requires in order to complete all assigned work by established deliverable date.




Tufts Medicine is a leading integrated health system bringing together the best of academic and community healthcare to deliver exceptional, connected and accessible care experiences to consumers across Massachusetts. Comprised of Tufts Medical Center, Lowell General Hospital, MelroseWakefield Hospital, Lawrence Memorial Hospital of Medford, Care at Home - an expansive home care network, and large integrated physician network. Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Supplier Advertising & Merchandising Services
Job Description:
Supplier Advertising & Merchandising Services (SAMS) is responsible for the strategy and sales of self-service sponsored listings (Wayfair Sponsored Products, WSP), on-site and off-site display ads (Display), Wayfair Sponsored Shops (WSS), and Supplier-funded marketing (SFM, comprising event sponsorships, email, print catalog, etc.). Our mission is to drive commercial and operational excellence across a suite of advertising offerings and advise suppliers how to use these effectively to grow their businesses on our sites.

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to offer data-driven solutions to problems posed by stakeholders across the company, and provide insights informing Wayfair’s supplier advertising strategies. Our work is technically challenging, high-impact, and heavily relied upon for strategic decision-making. This role provides significant exposure to senior leadership and opportunities to work with a variety of cross-functional partners across Commercial and Technology organizations. A successful Senior Analyst is driven, flexible, able to think on their feet and solve ambiguous problems creatively. They have demonstrated skill with technical tools and processes through data analysis, data visualization, or other similar experience. Senior Analysts must be detail-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.

What You'll Do


Conduct rigorous analyses, generate data-driven, strategic insights, craft high-impact solutions, and deliver accurate results to stakeholders and leadership
Communicate findings with a clear point of view and compelling visualizations so your insights can be used to help drive product strategy
Develop, distribute, and maintain scalable self-service tools and dashboards that align with broader departmental goals, allowing cross-functional partners to access data and identify meaningful insights
Serve as a thought partner with Product, Engineering, and Design teams to identify areas of opportunity, define / execute tracking plans for the toolset, and influence prioritization decisions with data
Mentor departmental team members on analytics best practices, technical skills, and on evolutions in our company’s data architecture
What You'll Need


Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative and technically-rigorous field required
2+ years of work experience in a relevant field, ideally in business analytics, strategy, startup/tech, and/or advertising
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to tailor communication style based on the audience
Strong technical aptitude with demonstrated experience leveraging data from a multitude of sources to solve complex problems, tell a story, and impact overarching strategy
Proficient knowledge of SQL / Eden, Google Cloud Platform, and Excel / Google Sheets
Familiarity with visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, or similar
Knowledge of Python / Git is preferred, but not required

As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. Position Description

Harvard University Information Technology (HUIT) is a community of Information Technology professionals committed to delivering service and technological solutions in support of teaching, learning, research and administration. We are recruiting an IT workforce that has both breadth in their ability to collaborate and innovate across disciplines – and depth in specific areas of expertise. HUIT offers opportunities for IT professionals to learn and work in a unique technology landscape and service-focused environment. If you are a technically proficient, nimble, user-focused, and accountable IT professional who also connects with the importance of collaborating well in a team environment, we are looking for you!

We are unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship.

This is a fully benefited, full-time Harvard University position that has been funded through June 30, 2025. There is the possibility of renewal, contingent on funding, university priorities and satisfactory job performance.

Identity and Access Management (IAM) Services at Harvard delivers technologies and processes that enable access for students, faculty, staff, alumni, and affiliates while safeguarding University resources and users. The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting a range of offerings essential for delivering IAM services. The ideal candidate enjoys working in a dynamic, collaborative team, engaging stakeholders to understand their needs, learning and supporting a variety of technologies, and continuously expanding their knowledge as tools and technologies change.

Job Specific Duties:
Partner with product managers and service owners to gather, discuss, and document requirements
Translate business requirements and user research into conceptual process models, functional specifications and user stories to support application development, revisiting and revising previously-gathered requirements as needed.
Capture and document service/product enhancement requests and defects.
Assume product owner responsibilities for one or more IAM applications or tools, including needs analysis and product support
Collaborate on complex solution design including business process and policy matters
Create and maintain knowledge resources and rollout materials in conjunction with product and service owners, and support team
Support quality assurance activities and user acceptance testing
Identify opportunities for process and/or system improvements. Make suggestions to implement those changes.
Serve as first point of contact for production support issues in assigned service areas
Prepare and present materials to foster internal team knowledge transfer and alignment
Facilitate communication with stakeholders and partner customers
Perform data analysis using database query tools, spreadsheets and reports

Basic Qualifications

Minimum of two years’ post-secondary education or relevant work experience

Additional Qualifications and Skills

The following Additional Qualifications are strongly preferred. If you meet some, but not all, you are still encouraged to apply; we value employees with a willingness to learn.
Proven ability to establish and cultivate relationships with colleagues and stakeholders at all levels
Strong communication skills, including the ability to engage with technical and non-technical stakeholders to understand their business and operations requirements
Excellent critical thinking skills and a flexible approach to problem solving
Highly adaptable to a changing environment and priorities
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Basic SQL query and reporting knowledge

Certificates and Licenses

Completion of Harvard IT Academy specified foundational courses (or external equivalent) preferred

Working Conditions

Work is performed in an office setting

Additional Information

Please provide a cover letter with your application.

Please note:

Harvard University requires pre-employment reference and background screening.
We are unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship.
This position has a 180-day orientation and review period.

The health of our workforce is a priority for Harvard University. With that in mind, we strongly encourage all employees to be up-to-date on CDC-recommended vaccines.

Accessibility:

Harvard University welcomes individuals with disabilities to apply for positions and participate in its programs and activities. If you would like to request an accommodation or have questions about the physical access provided, please contact our University Disability Resources Department.

Work Format Details

HUIT actively supports hybrid work where business needs allow. This position has been designated as a primarily remote position. While this position is primarily remote, travel to campus may be necessary based on business needs and the nature of work. Examples include bi-annual or quarterly Town Halls, critical business meetings or other work events. Additional details will be discussed during the interview process. All remote work must be performed within one of the Harvard Registered Payroll States, which currently includes Massachusetts, Connecticut, Maine, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, Vermont, Georgia, Illinois, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Virginia, Washington, and California (CA for exempt positions only). Certain visa types and funding sources may limit work location. Individuals must meet work location sponsorship requirements prior to employment.

About Us

More about HUIT:

Harvard University Information Technology (HUIT) is responsible for the strategy, planning, and delivery of information technology across the University. Our mission is to assure Harvard’s leadership in IT. We strive to make it easier for faculty, students, and staff to teach, research, learn and work through the effective use of information technology. HUIT’s core values are User Focused, Collaborative, Innovative and Open.

HUIT’s core values are:

User-focused
Collaborative
Innovative

IT Academy (designed for IT Staff):

HUIT’s IT Academy aims to enable each IT staff person to grow professionally and become a trusted partner to her or his team. The IT Academy is built on the belief that every IT staff member across the University (including technology employees at each school and campus) can grow in her or his area of expertise as well as building strong people and project management skills. Learn more here: https://itacademy.harvard.edu/

Benefits

We invite you to visit Harvard's Total Rewards website (https://hr.harvard.edu/totalrewards) to learn more about our outstanding benefits package, which may include:
Paid Time Off: 3-4 weeks of accrued vacation time per year (3 weeks for support staff and 4 weeks for administrative/professional staff), 12 accrued sick days per year, 12.5 holidays plus a Winter Recess in December/January, 3 personal days per year (prorated based on date of hire), and up to 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents who are primary care givers.
Health and Welfare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits, disability and life insurance programs, along with voluntary benefits. Most coverage begins as of your start date.
Work/Life and Wellness: Child and elder/adult care resources including on campus childcare centers, Employee Assistance Program, and wellness programs related to stress management, nutrition, meditation, and more.
Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service.
Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive program including $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and reduced tuition through other participating Harvard graduate schools.
Tuition Reimbursement: Program that provides 75% to 90% reimbursement up to $5,250 per calendar year for eligible courses taken at other accredited institutions.
Professional Development: Programs and classes at little or no cost, including through the Harvard Center for Workplace Development and LinkedIn Learning.
Commuting and Transportation: Various commuter options handled through the Parking Office, including discounted parking, half-priced public transportation passes and pre-tax transit passes, biking benefits, and more.
Harvard Facilities Access, Discounts and Perks: Access to Harvard athletic and fitness facilities, libraries, campus events, credit union, and more, as well as discounts to various types of services (legal, financial, etc.) and cultural and leisure activities throughout metro-Boston.

Completes data requests from the management division and builds reports in the EMS, Kronos systems, and other departmental and district software.

Seeking a Global Financial Business Analyst responsible for using analytic techniques to support sourcing and procurement projects. Establish and maintain communication channels with leadership, key team members, and internal business units for data gathering/analysis and to support their business requirements. Initial focus will be MathWorks Source to Pay (S2P) workflow. S2P is the end-to-end workflow used by procurement for expenditures such as capital improvements, furniture & fixtures, equipment, software, etc. Source to Pay is the process that starts with analyzing the business need, sourcing, negotiating with, and contracting the supplier of goods, tax assessment and finishes with payment.

In addition, review business processes and workflows to optimize operational effectiveness. The goal is to support the identification of potential transformation opportunities and to create value.

MathWorks nurtures growth, appreciates diversity, encourages initiative, values teamwork, shares success, and rewards excellence.




Business Analysis and Data Analytics

Provide financial and operational business analysis to support workflows and proposed expenditures.
Consolidate data analysis into “usable business lenses”. Perform analysis and benchmarks such as usage, cost per user, total cost of ownership, etc.
Present findings and problem solve issues with relevant business managers.
Using the yearly budget data, create a detailed funnel of annual expenditures to be prioritized.
Manage capital planning process
Develop the necessary metrics to measure the effectiveness of the S2P workflow.
Become a focal point of reference for the S2P workflow. Coordinate activities with the Finance Management team including prioritizing projects, design reviews, and pro-active analysis.

Project Management/Process Improvement

Maintain project plans to collect and provide transparency to sourcing initiatives.
Build working relationships with cross-functional team members and management. Learn and apply project management methodologies and tools (Agile, Confluence, etc.)
Apply business process improvement tools to improve S2P workflows (project charters, problem statements, root cause analysis, etc.)
Lead and manage assigned cross-functional teams to implement process improvement opportunities.
Identify and document core business processes (current state and future state).
Publish an annual Sourcing Planning Calendar with coordination from affected Departments.


MBA preferred with a finance, business, or systems concentration.
+15 years’ experience working within Finance, Operations, or IT
High business acumen with proficient critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Negotiations skills and the ability to deal with difficult conversations
Ability to work in a cross-functional and consensus-based decision organizational structure
Familiarity with purchasing procedures and workflows a plus
Strong analytical and presentation skills


A bachelor's degree and 6 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 3 years of professional work experience, or equivalent experience) is required.
Visa sponsorship will not be provided for this position.
Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer without restriction.

This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position)

Do you like distilling complex problems into actionable solutions? Are you able to quantify costs, understand their business impact, and communicate the tradeoffs? Do you want to use data to identify key opportunities and drive multi-million dollar investment decisions for Wayfair’s supply chain business? If so, then you would be a perfect fit for the Positioning team within Strategic Operations Finance (SOF).

Wayfair is seeking an Analyst to join the Strategic Operations Finance (SOF) network team within its rapidly growing logistics arm - CastleGate. The goal of the Positioning SOF team is to provide financial support to the Network & Operations teams as we look to refine our inventory distribution & warehouse footprint across North America. This role will work cross-functionally with our stakeholders to ensure that we are accurately modeling the financial implications and aggregate impact of our positioning operations. Analysts on our team will have direct exposure to senior leadership through various key projects and initiatives. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, hard-working, and able to provide concise solutions to complex problems.

What you’ll do:

Build financial models to understand long term cash flow impact and ROI on positioning decisions
Create opportunity cost analyses to identify optimal course of action
Draft business proposals for tactical recommendations
Present findings to operations leaders
Work across various teams to develop new processes to streamline future decision making
What you’ll need:

Bachelor's degree and at least 1 year of experience in finance, operations, or a strategy/consulting role
Ability to thrive in a high growth and entrepreneurial environment where juggling multiple priorities is a must
Experience working with large datasets and passionate about solving complex business problems, even when organized and/or complete information is not available
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with stakeholders
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results
Excel modeling capability: experience in SQL/GBQ is a plus

The Opportunity

The Senior Business Analyst works with users to understand complex clinical and business workflows, define functional requirements, convey requirements to colleagues engaged in software design and configuration activities, execute test scripts and user acceptance testing, and provide software support services. Responsible for evaluating and documenting existing business processes and recommending optimization efforts to re-engineer processes accordingly

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Support and educate users of on the use of clinical and complementary applications. Prepare end-user training materials.
Identify and resolve complex issues, escalating as needed for timely resolution.
Provide high quality service to users, according to defined service level agreements.
Create and run reports as needed using tools such as Epic Reporting Workbench.
Document and analyze complex business processes and workflows to drive business process improvements and ensure accurate system configuration. Identify opportunities for process improvement.
Understand user requirements; translate them into functional requirements, help define business value, and assist users with submission for software updates.
Develop and execute user acceptance testing plans including creation of test cases.
Communicate status of various team efforts to leadership and stakeholders, including preparing presentations.
Participate in team meetings to discuss team and project activities, issues, changes, and communications.
Motivate junior team members for success and give recognition for results.
Identify and recommend best practices for business analysis, training, and end user support functions.
Use recognized project management tools and methodologies
Use/s the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions, and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration
Other duties as assigned.



About Us

As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care, and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions, and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

At Mass General Brigham Digital, we pride ourselves on our ability to create maximum strategic, clinical, and operational value from established and emergent technologies for our patients, care teams, researchers, and employees. Digital health will not only enhance the equity and efficiency of healthcare delivery, but it will also help make medicine more personalized and precise.

Eight or more years of healthcare information technology experience with knowledge of clinical systems
Epic Certification desired or must obtain Epic training as outlined by program requirement

Skills, Abilities and Competencies

Experience providing training and support to end users, preferably in a healthcare setting
Deep knowledge and understanding of clinical workflows
Exceptional problem-solving, workflow analysis and workflow improvement skills
Ability to effectively translate business requirements to functional requirements
Possess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with staff at all levels of the organization including both technical and non-technical staff
Ability to effectively conduct large meetings and working sessions, both formal and informal including department and clinical staff.
Self-motivated, independent and possesses the ability to learn quickly.
Strong written and verbal communication skills including facilitation and presentation
Knowledge of Microsoft Office365 and other popular office productivity solutions

Position Description




The Business/Systems Analyst will study the business and information needs of specific customer groups and of the Laboratory as a whole to develop information systems solutions. As the key liaison between the business areas and the Information Services Department, the Analyst is responsible for identifying and defining issues and gaps, then gathering and documenting business requirements and translating them into functional system design specifications that can be successfully executed in a manner that consistently meets or exceeds business and user requirements. The Business/Systems Analyst will develop and configure solutions and processes that address business requirements and are in line with Lincoln Laboratory standards.




Primary Duties:
Human Resources Operational Support and Continuous Improvement



Maintains high level of proficiency and current knowledge of assigned applications including SAP HR functions, including personnel actions
Monitors the health of critical interfaces between SAP HR at Lincoln Laboratory and other systems such as MIT Main Campus
Maintains advanced proficiency of SAP HR master data, transaction data and table structures to support reporting, specification development and troubleshooting
Maintains an understanding of Lincoln Laboratory’s HR reporting requirements within the core SAP ERP system
Maintains an understanding of the HR reporting requirements of the Lab as they pertain to the data warehouse including the HR data extractors for the reporting system. Identifies technical and process changes that will require reporting changes
Maintains an understanding of HR-related authorization roles
Identifies, analyzes, and documents business requirements
Manages assigned projects by applying basic project management skills, coordinating activities of resources across ISD and business teams
Along with development teams, coordinates and documents overall solution design, which may include UI, processing logic, batch jobs, reports, interfaces, conversions, workflows, etc
Develops and communicates functional specifications for any required programming or reporting tasks, serves as primary QA tester for solutions requiring in-house development
Tests functionality, changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet customer and Laboratory requirements and data standards
Identifies issues and potential improvements to existing business processes and related information systems and prepares solutions to address these issues
Performs complex troubleshooting and analysis for issue correction, root cause determination and to identify continuous improvement opportunities
Tests changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet customer requirements
Serves as a secondary support resource on the IT systems and business processes for assigned customer area
Revises existing systems and tests functionality of the system to correct deficiencies and maintain more effective data handling, data integrity, conversion, input/output requirements, and storage
Collaborates with the Human Resources Department and other business areas to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Acts as the Human Resources Department’s advocate to IT in order to ensure that problems are resolved effectively and expeditiously



Systems Upgrade and Implementation



In collaboration with the LL Human Resources Department, maintains a set of regression test scenarios/scripts, performs testing, and coordinates business participation in regression testing
Identifies and documents impacts to end user processes and any required mitigations resulting from implementation of system updates or upgrades
Documents all testing and results due to maintenance of system upgrade, modifications, and configurations



Communication, Collaboration and Training



Documents and communicates ongoing work and design changes to IT and Business
Collaborates across teams to ensure standard system functionality is identified and used in all relevant situations
Develops, publishes, and maintains documentation according to department standards
In collaboration with the ISD Training team, develops and delivers training on applications capabilities to increase user acceptance
This position is under the general supervision of the Enterprise Applications Service Management Sector Manager
This position interacts frequently with vendors to keep abreast of roadmaps and directions
This position routinely interacts with MIT-LL users

Required




Bachelor's degree plus a minimum of four years of experience OR a master's degree and a minimum two years of experience OR equivalent
4+ years of SAP HR experience in requirements gathering, deployment and support
4+ years of experience with SAP ERP business processes design, implementation and support
Working knowledge of the software lifecycle and methodologies
Strong and in-depth knowledge of SAP HR. Understanding and broad application of technical standards, principles, theories, concepts, and techniques
Ability to work independently under limited supervision. Participates in determining objectives of assignment
Ability to work analytically in a problem-solving environment
Skill in analyzing process and data flows
Skill in requirements collection and analysis to identify needs
Skill in building consensus among stakeholders and colleagues
Excellent customer service skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent business, functional, technical acumen
Project management skills to succeed in matrixed environment
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance



Preferred




Working knowledge of other SAP ERP related modules
Working knowledge of the Cross Application Time Sheet
Working Knowledge of SAP Success Factors
Familiarity with SAP FIORI transactions
Working knowledge of SAP BW and Business Objects reporting



Working knowledge of change management tools for software life cycle development

Newburyport Bank and Pentucket Bank are pleased to announce they have received formal regulatory approval for the establishment of River Run Bancorp, MHC as the singular, joint mutual holding company under which both banks will operate as separate, independent community banks.

River Run will manage the shared services organization supporting both Newburyport Bank and Pentucket Bank. While both Banks maintain their independent, mutual community bank status, working in tandem under River Run provides scale to the organization. Working together under River Run provides greater opportunities for advanced products and services and operational efficiencies. This will establish River Run as a dominant, sustainable, independent, and full service mutual community banking partnership in the Northeastern Massachusetts and Southern New Hampshire markets.

The role of Business Systems Analyst at River Run Bancorp, MJC will provide support on various projects to implement new applications or improve existing processes. He/She is expected to understand and collect business requirements to support recommendations of new technologies and/or changes to existing policies and use of systems.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following; however, other duties may be assigned as dictated by business need:

1. Works directly with applicable stakeholders to identify and recommend process improvements and/or automation opportunities to enhance the productivity and operation efficiency of the business.

2. Researches solutions and makes recommendations based on industry trends and professional business knowledge.

3. Assists in systems reviews to establish business requirements, risk mitigation, cost justification, and network compatibility to support project activities, process improvements and/or systems development.

4. Contributes to project management and initiatives as a subject matter expert by representing the business, establishing scope, estimating project efforts, meeting all deliverables/milestones for project under management and identifies risks and if necessary, recommends mitigation measures.

Configures and documents system settings during implementation of new applications to ensure business needs are met.

Identifies requirements for testing, develops test plans and scripts along with execution of the scripts.

Assists in the development of procedures and/or training plans during implementation of new systems, features, and/or business initiatives.

Performs ongoing maintenance of user access for select applications as needed.

Under direction of management, analyzes the feasibility and impact of new initiatives, process improvements, technical solutions, and/or products/features.

Solve problems, exercise sound judgement, and identify alternative procedures and efficiencies.

Periodically write reports and business correspondence that include items such as: cost-benefit analysis, risk assessment, product roadmaps, and current and future states of the product when required.

Function as part of a team in a collaborative environment.

14. Demonstrates understanding of and commitment to the Bank’s ongoing mission, vision and core values.

15. Demonstrates understanding and compliance with Bank policies and procedures as well as regulatory guidelines as applicable to the position.

16. Performs additional duties as requested or assigned.

· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Operations or equivalent combination of training and experience.

· Able to work in a fast-paced environment with experience in balancing conflicting priorities and handling conflict.

· Flexible approach to adapt to changing deadlines and priorities.

· Must regularly interface with management, end-users, and vendors applying a high degree of independent business judgement and discretion.

· Strong interpersonal oral and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization and with vendors.

· Must be well organized and detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills.

About the Company

With more than 60 years of success in the food equipment industry, Reiser is recognized worldwide for its high-quality equipment, innovative engineering, and outstanding service and support. Total commitment to our customers is at the core of who we are, making Reiser the one supplier that food manufacturers can trust for better, smarter food processing and food packaging solutions and equipment.

We take great pride in providing the resources our customers need to ensure their success. Our team of talented and passionate professionals works hard, embraces challenges and is wholeheartedly dedicated to the success of our customers. This customer centric focus has led to extraordinary growth, and we are now seeking a Business Systems Analyst to assist in the design and implementation of a CRM and ERP systems that will be the backbone of our sales operations. If you are a dynamic and confident Business Systems Analyst with prior CRM or ERP experience, we want to hear from you! Our ideal candidate is smart, energetic, hardworking and likes to have FUN!

Business Systems Analyst Job Description

We are currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst. In this position, you will report to the VP of IT and work closely with business stakeholders to ensure our application and information systems are aligned with current and future business requirements. As an analyst, you will identify and document business requirements, describe and diagram business processes, and then assist in the formulation, scoping and development of overall technical/business solution. The position requires significant analytical thinking and at times involves being able to take a broader perspective to question and challenge existing ways of doing things in order to develop the best overall solution. The business system analyst will be expected to obtain a deep business process knowledge of Reiser’s business-sales, service, operations, and finance. The candidate must have the ability to interact effectively with all business end users, grasp both technical and business needs quickly and possess outstanding verbal, writing, presentation, and flow-charting skills. You will partner closely with other members of the team including the CRM Administrator and Application Support Engineer.

Qualifications and Experience

BA or BS in Information Systems, Information Technology, or Computer Science
At least five years Business System Analyst experience
Must possess ability to communicate and interact effectively at both technical and business level
Must possess excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills
Must possess outstanding skills in use of flow charting software (Visio, Smart Draw etc.) and presentation software (Power Power etc.)
At least five years of experience in manufacturing and distribution environment
Experience working with CRM Systems (Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Sales Force etc) and/or experience with ERP systems such as IFS, Oracle, SAP, Microsoft Dynamics.
Experience with data analysis and BI/Reporting Platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, Excel Power Pivot a plus

Technical Skills/Experience

Must have passion for business systems analysis
Must possess ability to communicate and interact effectively at both technical and business level
Self-starter with strong work ethic
Strong team player with proven ability to work effectively cross-functionally
Excellent customer service skills
Strong organizational, multi-tasking and project management skills
Ability to learn and comprehend new systems and business processes quickly
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Strong desire to improve and grow continuously

Personal and Professional Attributes

Teamwork is essential for this role.
Ability to manage multiple projects
Attention to detail
Strong problem-solving/root cause analysis skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to think and work methodically and independently to resolve problems
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment
Must possess ability to communicate and interact effectively at both technical and business level

Job Description:

The Opportunity:
We’re seeking a highly motivated, intellectually curious, data-driven, and business-oriented Senior Analyst to join us at the center of strategy & analytics within Workhuman. The Business Analytics team sits inside our central Strategic Planning & Business Analytics function at the intersection of data, strategy, planning, and decision-making inside the core of Workhuman’s organization. In this role, you will dive deep into the weeds of our data infrastructure, build production-grade data pipelines and self-serve dashboards, and analyze trends to surface actionable insights and recommendations. The Senior Analyst will be responsible for B2B digital marketing and web optimization analytics, partnering with these respective teams inside of our marketing organization to maximize ROI of our spend across channels and optimize the conversion rate on our website.
The experience we can offer you:
In conjunction with cross-functional stakeholders and your manager, jointly generate a point-of-view on how we should view business health & performance for your designated area. Iterate on requirement gathering and dashboard prototyping to maximize the value of insights generated
Build, own, and maintain a large and complex system of data pipelines, transforming raw data all the way into aggregated tables that feed into dashboards
Design metrics and production dashboards using data visualization tools to create visibility into company health
Maintain and iterate on your dashboards to continue to drive increased value through additional business insights
Evangelize and enable self-serve data access & decision-making with your direct stakeholders
Monitor business health and deep-dive trends to surface actionable insights & recommendations and then measure results once plans are implemented
Interface with cross-functional stakeholders to thought partner on data-informed strategic decision-making
The skills/experience you will bring:
4+ years in highly technical business/product-oriented analytics roles within technology organizations
Demonstrated experience in digital marketing and/or web funnel optimization analytics
Expertise in querying, analyzing, and visualizing big datasets via a combination of writing SQL and building dashboards using data visualization tools
Demonstrated history of building production-grade data pipelines that power dashboards and live technology solutions
Strong communication & project management skills and a highly collaborative approach to problem-solving
Ability to simultaneously understand the business while focusing deeply on technological and analytical details
Strong business intuition with a bias towards action
BA/BS in a quantitative discipline preferred

At Cambridge Savings Bank, our purpose is to have a positive impact on our customers, employees, and community's financial well-being. We are committed to exceeding expectations and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Key Result Areas:

With Minimal Manager Oversight:

Brings together disparate data sources and addresses any underlying data issues or nuances in advance of analyses. Creates complex, thoroughly vetted, and robust datasets that support multiple dashboards, thus ensuring consistent outcomes. Performs deep analysis and investigation to identify trends and patterns in the data, suggests new and compelling metrics for our stakeholders, and finds new and/or improved data visualization techniques in a self-driven manner.
Thinks critically about the processes and defines and pushes forward new process improvement opportunities for the team and/or the organization.
Question everything’ mentality, to ensure the quality of reporting via extensive testing and checks with existing reporting and/or SMEs. Is the ‘go to’ person for support from the team due to the level of expertise and technical skills, knowledge of the data, and thoroughness of the analyses performed.
Works independently, drives outcomes, and is proactive in ensuring the solutions meet the needs of potentially multiple different business units, and ensures that the team is focused on the correct priorities for the organizational goals and objectives. Combines strong business knowledge, by creating a partnership with stakeholders, with the technical expertise to add value to all analyses and data visualizations.
Communicates clearly, at just the right level of detail, to present findings to stakeholders and top executives in a way that fosters understanding, collaboration, and enables decision making.
Thoughtfully engages with members of the organization regularly to drive requirements gathering, resolve issues, and perform data investigation.
Completes ad hoc requests and performs additional duties as needed, such as interviewing, onboarding, training, supporting new hires, and mentoring new members of the team.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree with 3+ years of proven work experience as a Data Analyst creating, maintaining, and testing complex datasets, as well as performing data analyses and investigation. 2+ years’ advanced experience with data visualization tools (i.e., Tableau).
Strong people management and project management skills with the ability to translate the business needs into clear requirements, ask more in-depth questions, and find more robust solutions for multiple business units of the organization. Demonstrated experience working with internal clients to understand their goals and to drive consensus building for organizational metrics.
Curiosity and drive to research improved methods of data visualization to keep CSB on the cutting edge of data-driven insights. Champions change to support these new methods.
Advanced technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, data visualization, and testing/QC. An expert at creating compelling dashboards and providing KPIs and key insights for the organization.
Critical thinking skills to go beyond the request, to understand the question being asked or the issue being addressed.
Knows when to escalate and how to prioritize, based on knowledge of the data available and the direction of the organization.
Self-driven and takes ownership to independently prioritize and drive progress on multiple, highly visible projects under tight timelines.
Tenacity to find a solution to the most complex problems.
Proven ability to work with executive leadership on data visualizations and provide the highest level of analysis and insights to support strategic decision making.

The above description covers the most significant responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

Job Description:

The Sr Business Analyst is responsible for supporting business leadership across multiple product lines by developing and delivering data-driven insights. This role will need to intimately understand the nuance of their product lines (via both analysis of data and stakeholder interviews) and be able to distill the most meaningful insights for an executive audience. This role requires strong SQL capabilities, critical thinking, and business acumen. The ideal candidate will have experience not just working closely with data engineers and other analysts but also in interfacing with business leaders and operations teams to generate requirements and validate results. You will become the "go-to" person for insights generation in your supported product lines and be a crucial partner to business teams looking to better understand and improve their lines of business.

Key Outcomes:

Build and maintain a suite of dashboards that answer your stakeholder's most important questions in an easily digestible way
Develop a deep understanding of both your line of business and the underpinning data needed to measure and understand it
Build strong rapport with your stakeholders such that you become their "one-stop-shop" for understanding their piece of the business

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with business leaders to understand their needs and develop data products to answer their questions
Build and maintain SQL queries to analyze data and generate reports
Distill insights and communicate them effectively with the proper supporting documentation
Collaborate with data engineers and other data analysts to ensure that your data products are of high quality and meet the needs of business users.

Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in a similar analytical role.
Strong technical proficiency in SQL
Experience with data visualization / BI tools (we use Sigma)
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact with stakeholders across all levels of the organization
Motivated to understand the nuances of data and its impact on the business.
Demonstrated project management and financial aptitude. A creative problem-solver with a passion for producing quality deliverables.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Previous automotive related experience is a plus.

Success Metrics:

Business leadership trusts the data products that have been built to answer the question, "how is my product line performing?"
Data products are of high quality and meet the needs of business users.
Data presentations are clear, concise, and actionable.

BASIC PURPOSE:

Works with business unit staff to understand business processes, document and prioritize user requirements and functional specifications for systems, and to translate technical specifications into laypersons language understood by all audiences. Serves as the liaison between the Business Systems Analysis team and MWRA departments.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED:

Works under the general supervision of the Business Relationship Manager. On specific IT projects may be functionally supervised a Business Systems Analyst III or IT Project Manager III.

SUPERVISION EXERCISED:

None

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Uses proven business analysis methodologies and requirement gathering techniques to:
Collect and document business, functional and technical requirements from business leaders, end-users, and vendors for new and upgraded software applications (in-house and third party software).
Document project scope and vision documents.
Supports Quality Assurance/Quality Control activities including developing functional and user test acceptance test plans in conjunction with MIS and user stakeholders.
Researches new approaches to improve business and system processes and develop reports and/or proposals for new or enhanced solutions including costs.
Identifies and documents gaps between the current "as-is" and recommended "to-be" processes.
Collaborates with MIS Department contractors and vendors to support development of technical specifications for appropriate system infrastructure hardware and software.
Researches, designs, and tests interfaces between existing and new system applications and platforms to produce seamless integration that complies with business requirements.
Maintains professional interaction with the MIS staff and user community to ensure adequate system functionality, promotes team participation and encourages user confidence in the applications staff quality of service.
Develops and maintains design documentation, report requirements, and test plans of applications throughout the design process.
Supports user acceptance testing and release management activities.
Coordinates vendor access and resources as assigned.
Documents and communicates issues and risks.
Develops and maintains Business Systems Analysis functional unit's business continuity documentation.

SECONDARY DUTIES:

Performs related duties as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

A Bachelor's degree in management science, engineering management, computer science, data science, library science, communications, or related field; and
At least two (2) years of information technology or electronic content management experience, preferably gathering functional requirements, analyzing and accurately documenting requirements specifications, workflow diagrams, data flow diagrams, etc. to effectively communicate needs to internal and external development teams and/or developing and testing prototypes; or
Any equivalent combination of education or experience.

Necessary Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge of business and systems analysis techniques within the information technology discipline.
Analytical and interpersonal skills
Written and oral communication skills.
Knowledge of the following is desirable: MS Project, MS Visio, OpenText, Infor Cloud Suite MS.Net, J2EE, Crystal Reporting, ORACLE, SQL Server and PL/SQL.
Familiarity with the full Microsoft Office Suite.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess a valid Massachusetts Motor Vehicle Class D Operator's license to travel between worksites.

Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation Certification is required or the ability to obtain within 12 months.

TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT USED:

Office equipment as normally associated with the use of telephone, personal computers including word processing and other software, copy and fax machines.

It is imperative to drive the company sales policy through sales lead distribution and other commercial initiatives such as trade lane, vertical, and product promotions disseminated by Commercial Heads.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Understand the commercial company objectives and utilize industry tools to find and qualify sales leads
Utilize company CRM Tool to create and optimize more effective sales processes
The Commercial Business Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis, and reporting of sales-related data to their Commercial Operations management to increase overall sales productivity, efficiency, and profitability.
Data analysis: Must be able to gather and analyze sales business intelligence information using a variety of internal IT systems and applications, mostly the company CRM
Presentation communication skills: Communicate key finding and best practices to business unit and site leaders across the organization.
Perform additional analysis as required in support of mission-critical business decisions.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
No supervisory responsibility is required

QUALIFICATIONS:
Analytical writing ability: Must be able to understand complex business operations and disseminate that information to management; providing recommendations on areas of improvement and identifying best practices.
Presentation creation skills: Must be able to independently create effective and professional PowerPoint presentations with inputs from Sales leadership members.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office suite, Excel
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent written and verbal skills
Detail oriented, able to multitask and meet deadlines
Self-motivated, able to work in a team and independently
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
High school diploma or GED required
College degree or equivalent experience preferred
Prior work experience in sales or market analysis role
3 to 5 years’ experience with multinational companies and additional languages are preferred.
ENVIRONMENT:
100% performed in climate-controlled internal office environment working under normal office conditions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; stand; walk; use hands and finger to feel and handle; reach with arms and hands; talk and hear. While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, and crouch; lift weight or exert a force up to a maximum of 25 pounds.
Follow the Company HR Policy, the Code of Business Conduct and all subsidiary and department policies and procedures, including protecting confidential company information, attending work punctually and regularly, and following good safety practices in all activities.
The responsibilities associated with this job will change from time to time in accordance with the Company’s business needs. More specifically, the incumbent may be required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those set forth above.
The above declarations are not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be such a listing of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job.
Management retains discretion to add or change duties of this position at any time.

Description:

Newburyport Bank and Pentucket Bank have received formal regulatory approval for the establishment of River Run Services, LLC as the singular, joint mutual holding company under which both banks will operate as separate, independent community banks. River Run will manage the shared services organization supporting both Newburyport Bank and Pentucket Bank. While both Banks maintain their independent, mutual community bank status, working in tandem under River Run will provide scale to the organizations.

The Business Systems Analyst will initially be based at Newburyport Bank, with the expectation that this role will eventually transition over to River Run to provide support on various projects, implement new applications, and improve existing processes. The Business Systems Analyst will be expected to understand and collect business requirements to support recommendations of new technologies and/or changes to existing policies and use of systems.

Requirements:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Works directly with applicable stakeholders to identify and recommend process improvements and/or automation opportunities to enhance the productivity and operation efficiency of the business.
Researches solutions and makes recommendations based on industry trends and professional business knowledge.
Assists in systems reviews to establish business requirements, risk mitigation, cost justification, and network compatibility to support project activities, process improvements and/or systems development.
Contributes to project management and initiatives as a subject matter expert by representing the business, establishing scope, estimating project efforts, meeting all deliverables/milestones for project under management and identifies risks and if necessary, recommends mitigation measures.
Configures and documents system settings during implementation of new applications to ensure business needs are met.
Identifies requirements for testing, develops test plans and scripts along with execution of the scripts.
Assists in the development of procedures and/or training plans during implementation of new systems, features, and/or business initiatives.
Manages system integrations, ensuring mapping is updated as new products and/or features are introduced.
Performs ongoing maintenance of user access for select applications as needed.
Under direction of management, analyzes the feasibility and impact of new initiatives, process improvements, technical solutions, and/or products/features.
Solve problems, exercise sound judgement, and identify alternative procedures and efficiencies.
Periodically write reports and business correspondence that include items such as: cost-benefit analysis, risk assessment, product roadmaps, and current and future states of the product when required.
Function as part of a team in a collaborative environment.
Demonstrates understanding of and commitment to the Bank’s ongoing mission, vision and core values.
Demonstrates understanding and compliance with Bank policies and procedures as well as regulatory guidelines as applicable to the position.
Performs additional duties as requested or assigned.

Experience and Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Operations or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Previous Project Management experience is preferred.
Preferred two years banking experience with knowledge of banking/financial industry and applications.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment with experience in balancing conflicting priorities and handling conflict.
Flexible approach to adapt to changing deadlines and priorities.
Must regularly interface with management, end-users, and vendors applying a high degree of independent business judgement and discretion.
Strong interpersonal oral and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization and with vendors.
Knowledge of database structures and technology infrastructure is preferred.
Working knowledge of analytical tools, such as R, Tableau, Minitab, and Spotfire.
Must be well organized and detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills.
Must have excellent analytical skills with proven ability to comprehend business requirements and translate into functional specifications.
Professional demeanor and professional maturity required for working closely with customers, employees, and vendors.

Physical Requirements

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

Newburyport Bank is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing or service in the military.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, you may contact Candela Borracci at cborracci@newburyportbank.com or call 978-225-8757.

Overview:The HR/IT Business Systems Analyst serves as a bridge between the Human Resources and Information Technology departments, ensuring the seamless integration and optimization of HR systems, processes and data. This role involves analyzing HR operational needs, translating them into technical requirements, collaborating with IT for system enhancements, managing HR system implementations, and providing training and support to end users.
Responsibilities:HR/IT Business Systems Analyst Responsiblities:

System Analysis and Implementation:

Optimize internal HR systems and applications.
Analyze, design, and configure HRIS systems to meet HR and business needs.
Lead or participate in the implementation of new platforms or upgrades.
Ensure that HR systems are set up and maintained in accordance with both internal requirements and regulatory compliance.

Integration and Support:

Collaborate with IT to integrate HR systems with other business systems.
Provide technical support for HR applications, troubleshooting, and resolving system issues.
Assist with end-user training and creation of user documentation.

Data Analytics and Reporting:

Develop, run, and maintain reports using Tableau, Power BI, and other analytics tools.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance in HR systems.
Aid HR leaders in strategic decision-making by providing data-driven insights.
Drive process improvements and system redesigns.

Vendor Relationship Management:

Manage relationships with HR technology vendors.
Review and recommend system enhancements, considering future HR and business needs.

Project Management:

Lead or participate in cross-functional projects to enhance HR systems and processes.
Develop test plans and scripts in order to execute testing to ensure bug free solutions are delivered.
Document project requirements, timelines, and outcomes.
Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure project goals and timelines are met.

Qualifications:HR/IT Business Systems Analyst Qualifications:

*
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in MIS, HR or analytics. Associate degree with 3-5 years of experience will be considered.

3-5 years of relevant human resources experience or combination of education and experience in process design and technology support.
Experience with at least one or more of the following is preferred: iCIMS, iSOLVED, E-Pay, Docebo, Tableau or PowerBI.
Experience working with computer based human resources systems.
Experience in project management, systems implementation, and continuous improvement programs.
Continuous improvement and learning mindset to stay updated on HRIS advancements and industry best practices.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Employee discount
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Referral program
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
