The Supply Chain Business Analyst role is responsible for evaluating and recommending solutions related to logistics activities, including but not limited to, transportation service performance, carrier management, and other Supply Chain expenditures. This position is responsible for improving the overall operating efficiencies in these areas. The Supply Chain Business Analyst will collaborate with the Merchandise Teams, Technology, Distribution, and Store Operations frequently. The position will report directly to the Director of Supply Chain & Logistics.

Competencies:

Adaptability: Demonstrates flexibility and resilience in new or challenging situations. Successfully navigates through multiple tasks, assignments, and projects.
Professionalism: Maintains a professional and positive manner, under evolving conditions. Works well with a wide range of individuals.
Personal Development: Displays self-awareness, a high level of energy, persistence, and a positive outlook. Continuously seeks ways to improve, to cultivate new skills, and learns from mistakes and constructive feedback.
Problem-Solving: Identifies, diagnoses, and resolves issues with composure and collaboration with all stakeholders.
Communication: Conveys information professionally and succinctly through writing and speaking with all levels of the organization and external partners.
Organization: Meets goals and deadlines by planning for the efficient use of resources, including people, supplies, and time.
Building relationships: Develops working relationships with all stakeholders that are mutually beneficial and contributes to the success of the business.
Collaboration: works with other people to achieve a common goal through open-mindedness, listening to understand, contributing ideas, and respecting the opinions of others.
Business Acumen: Utilizes business and experience to anticipate and plan for challenges to the organization and makes quick, effective decisions to navigate unexpected situations using tact, accuracy, and insight.
Drive for Results: Is motivated by success and is passionate about achieving higher results and exceeding expectations. Maintains optimism in the face of challenges and encourages others to overcome them. Champions the efforts to achieve goals and course-corrects as necessary.
Project Management: Establishes timebound, measurable milestones to ensure the project remains on course for completion.
Innovation: Does not accept the status quo or allow complacency to overtake creativity of thought, instead seeks to find new and better ways to execute. Embraces change and articulates the need for change to encourage buy-in and excitement.
Analytical Thinking: Continuously evaluates operations and strives to improve overall efficiency.


Responsibilities:

Analyze and use Operations information for reporting of logistics activities in the areas of transportation service performance, carrier management, and Supply Chain expenditures.
Support outgoing RFP’s and execute carrier bids, looking at optimum cost, offset with efficient and reliable transportation service providers.
Support in the preparation of presentations and quarterly carrier management reviews.
Help in the development of a Vendor Freight Conversion Program by working closely with the merchandise teams.
Assist in the selection and administer the set up and operation of a Transportation Management System (TMS) to execute carrier management activities.
Audit and review invoicing and ancillary charges from freight activity identifying opportunities to optimize and reduce expenses.
Identify carriers, brokers, mode types, and other options to assist the business in growing and refining Supply Chain services as the needs develop.
Help identify and resolve related service, costs, rates, and freight payment issues through candidates’ analytic capabilities.
Engaged in setting and analyzing Supply Chain budgets.
Develop & maintain carrier and vendor scorecards which include agreed-to performance measures.
Work with carriers, on a tactical level, to solve issues that come up daily and help to create strategic solutions that improve service and operating efficiency.
Mentor future supply chain analysts; help them to understand TPS supply chain operations and succeed in their roles; develop both yourself and peers for future development opportunities
Complete all other tasks assigned by management within the allotted timeframe

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree with concentrations in Finance, Economics or Logistics/Supply Chain, preferred but not required.
3+ years of professional experience in the areas of Supply Chain and Logistics.
3+ years of direct or indirect Retail experience, required.
General understanding of and experience in Supply Chain fundamentals and freight forecasting.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications including an advanced understanding of Excel and PowerPoint.
Proficiency with databases including SQL, Access, and Power BI, among others.
Proficiency with Supply Chain software applications, such as a TMS, Forecasting, Order Management, Warehouse Management, and Allocation and Replenishment tools.
Self-starter who takes ownership of their work and has strong attention to detail. Demonstrated analytical and quantitative abilities.
Experience in project management and/or prioritization is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to simplify complex projects and present summary details and conclusions.
Ability to commute to Corporate Office, in Acton, MA, 3+ days a week.

Facilitate and drive requirements clarification via standard techniques such as lean driven task/workflow analysis to identify epics and decomposing them into User Stories sized appropriately for the iteration

A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Information System or an equivalent degree

Strong technical skills and Ability to set and meet deadlines

Job Description:

Overview

We are looking for someone to come on board at Sun Life to help drive our API digital experience solution. This role will focus on Implementation and Production Support for APIs in our Digital Services organization.

Digital connections are in demand and changes are happening all the time. Sun Life wants to deliver solutions quickly and accurately for our Group clients.

We’re looking for someone who embraces technology and has prior experience with APIs. Do you have experience with operationalizing the implementation process as well as ongoing production support processes of APIs? Are you an experienced Business Analyst with a flair for documentation and process?

We work in a fast-paced Agile digital growth environment and our team is ready to add a dedicated API process enablement guru. In your job as a Business Analyst (API), you will build, and continuously improve, our API solution documentation and process framework. Come join our collaborative and supportive team!

Responsibilities

The Business Analyst, API Process Enablement will act as the central focal point to gather and document requirements for API implementation and ongoing production support. This person will work closely with collaborators across the organization to understand current processes and how they will be impacted by the introduction of API technology within their respective areas. As a result, this role will strengthen documentation and evolve business process. As an API Business Analyst Process Owner you will play a critical role in overseeing the processes and strategies related to our API products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to ensure the successful planning, development, and delivery of APIs that meet our customers' needs.

Impact Analysis:

Perform process impact analysis. Document and communicate changes in business workflow that will change as we implement technology enhancements and/or new API connections.

Business Process Analysis:

Conduct interviews, workshops and analyze current documentation to maintain an accurate process with aligned documentation.

Review, design and implement processes and procedures to manage the asset to ensure that full lifecycle management is in place with all mandatory attributes populated for each endpoint, closing any gaps.

Technical Writing:

Review current API process to document changes, opportunities, and variations in workflow. Create and maintain detailed documentation, including data flow diagrams, and process maps, to ensure clarity and consistency.

Collaboration:

Collaborate with development teams and business owners to identify business needs and where IT deliverables and Business strategy execution meet. The ability to question, gather, assimilate, and document this information is critical to this role.

Collaborate with team members across Digital Services, for each digital connection type, to ensure there is standardization across each area for processes and data capture.

User Acceptance Testing:

Participate in user acceptance testing. Provide timely feedback to ensure a strong product is delivered for a good client experience.

Quality Assurance:

Collaborate with the QA team to define test plans, test cases, and test data for API testing. The BA ensures that the API functions correctly, handles errors appropriately, and performs optimally under different scenarios.

Change Management:

Assist in change management processes related to the API, including impact analysis, change requests, and version control. The BA helps manage changes to the API design, functionality, and deployment process, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruptions.

Post-Implementation Support:

Provide support during the post-implementation phase, addressing user queries, troubleshooting issues, and facilitating continuous improvement of the API based on user feedback.

Requirements to be successful in this role you will need to be:

Highly motivated and disciplined.
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong negotiation and decision-making skills.
Strong stakeholder management skills
Keen understanding of the details.
We are very much targeting candidates with business experience with APIs.
Documentation excellence is key.
Strong planning and organizational skills, with the ability to multi-task.
Solid working knowledge of MS Office Suite.
Solid working knowledge of Workday.
Solid Knowledge on JIRA Cloud.
Other factors that will get our attention:
Experience in working with Insurance company or related financial institution and understand its business processes.
Knowledge of API documentation methods
Knowledge of API protocols (e.g. REST)
We will provide the support, but we are looking for an independent self-starter with strong time management skills. We need you to meet objectives and deadlines without heavy supervision.
It’s a plus if you’ve previously worked in the SAFe/Agile Methodology.
You need to love to learn.
Do you like finding solutions? This person will need to be an excellent problem-solver with strong investigation skills and the ability to provide solutions.
Able to recognize when to apply traditional BA techniques and when to use ‘lite’ methodology to achieve the project objectives. Able to recognize when to apply traditional BA techniques and when to use ‘lite’ methodology to achieve the project objectives.

Do you see yourself in this role even if you haven’t checked all the boxes above? We welcome all talented candidates and are committed to a culture that represents diversity in all forms. If you think you might thrive in this setting, we would love to hear from you.

The Senior Business Analyst is expected to perform at Capable level in the following:

Business Needs Identification - Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals, proposing potential solutions through research.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints and dependencies. Analysis and Design Definition

Work is performed with limited direction. Exercises increasing latitude in determining technical objectives of each assignment.
Investigates complex data related issues and synthesizes quantitative and qualitative information using past, current, and future trending information
Complete assignments on time and within budget
Review and comply with the Code of Business Conduct and all applicable company policies and procedures, local, state and federal laws and regulations.
Assist with various projects as assigned by a direct supervisor.
Other duties as assigned.


Additional responsibilities may include focus on one or more departments or locations. See applicable addendum for department or location specific functions.

3-4 years' related work experience

Job Title: Sr. Business Data Analyst, State Street Global Advisors, Officer
Job Description:
Job Description:
The Sr. Business & Data Analyst will execute data operations and business analysis functions supporting information publishing & data operations initiatives. This includes managing data operations responsibilities such as data monitoring and issue resolution and also defining scope, business requirements, and success criteria for data monitoring projects. This role will be involved in supporting day-to-day data operations activities and also will contribute to project execution, implementation, and testing activities. The individual will collaborate with program stakeholders as well as distributed functional team leaders across data service providers, project management, marketing, business systems analysis, user experience, technical development, and quality assurance.
The Sr. Business & Data Analyst must demonstrate effective communication, problem solving & decision making skills and be proficient in the analysis, definition, communication, assessment, and validation of data and business requirements used for software development. Previous experience working with mutual funds, ETFs, and/or Institutional funds across a range of data domains such as performance, holdings, accounting, pricing, and analytics is required.
Responsibilities:
Perform daily data operations tasks and activities
Analyze, assess, and solicit data and business requirements.
Explore external and internal data sources covering all domains of investment product periodic and reference data
Develop and maintain detailed requirements with considerations for scope, success factors/measures, assumptions, constraints, and dependencies.
Document data sourcing, delivery, and extraction solutions
Write, communicate, and explain Epics & Stories for Agile Sprints.
Contribute to development and execution of data quality monitoring program supporting global investment web sites.
Partner with program sponsors.
Partner with 3rd Party Software Vendors and Data Vendors as needed.
Collaborate with functional areas of project teams including Project Management, Product Management, Development, Data Integration, Business Systems Analysis, Quality Assurance, and User Experience.
Participate in test-plan reviews & execution.
Document supporting project deliverables including process and training guides.
Perform other job duties as required.
Qualifications:
8+ years working experience in the Investment Industry with 5+ years hands on data operations experience. Experience working on data related technology projects a plus.
Proven ability to effectively manage time and balance priorities across multiple assignments
Proven analytical skills to interpret business and functional requirements
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
Experience with technology projects.
BS/BA or equivalent required.
Experience working with globally distributed project teams required.
Strong Microsoft Excel skills and working knowledge of Visio, Powerpoint, and Word
Proven track record of successfully delivering and executing on data driven projects through all aspects of data operations, business requirements analysis, solicitation, definition, communication, assessment, and validation.
Familiarity with ETF and/or Mutual Funds product information and data required.
Experience in following areas is a huge plus –
o Data development/operations in finance institutions
o Performance and Accounting System knowledge and experience
o FactSet
About State Street Global Advisors
What We Do. As the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, State Street Global Advisors has served the world’s governments, institutions and financial advisors for over four decades. With a rigorous, risk-aware approach built on research, analysis and market-tested experience, we build from a breadth of active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. As stewards, we help portfolio companies see that what is fair for people and sustainable for the planet can deliver long-term performance. And, as pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest. As a result, we have become one of the world’s largest asset managers with trillions of dollars under our care.
Our Mission. At State Street Global Advisors our mission is to invest responsibly to enable economic prosperity and social progress. We are driven by a desire to help our clients, and those who rely on them, achieve a better future. We have a long history of developing innovative investment strategies to provide our clients with reliable and transparent returns, cost-effectively, and without excessive risk.
Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to Flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.
Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.
State Street Global Advisors State Street is an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability.
Salary Range:
$65,000 - $102,500 Annual
The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Who we are
At CarGurus (NASDAQ: CARG), our mission is to give people the power to reach their destination. We started as a small team of developers determined to bring trust and transparency to car shopping. Since then, our history of innovation and go-to-market acceleration has driven industry-leading growth. In fact, we're the largest and fastest-growing automotive marketplace, and we've been profitable for over 15 years.

What we do
The market is evolving, and we are too, moving the entire automotive journey online and guiding our customers through every step. That includes everything from the sale of an old car to the financing, purchase, and delivery of a new one. Today, tens of millions of consumers visit CarGurus.com each month, and ~30,000 dealerships use our products. But they're not the only ones who love CarGurus—our employees do, too. We have a people-first culture that fosters kindness, collaboration, and innovation, and empowers our Gurus with tools to fuel their career growth. Disrupting a trillion-dollar industry requires fresh and diverse perspectives. Come join us for the ride!

Role overview

As a core member of the Enterprise Application Architecture and Design team, the Business Systems Analyst II will play a pivotal role in optimizing and enhancing our lead-to-cash SaaS systems, Business Systems Analyst II serves as the crucial link between our business objectives and the technical capabilities of our systems. With a strong focus on architectural design, requirement design & analysis, and quality assurance, the ideal candidate will work collaboratively with various stakeholders to shape the future of our business processes and ensure they are efficiently supported by our systems.

What you'll do

Requirements Design: Engage with stakeholders to collect and document business requirements, translating them into specifications in user stories with clear acceptance criteria. Collaborate with Technical Product Managers to build out user guides and training materials for end-users.
Documentation: Create essential technical and business documentation, including application, data flow, sequence diagrams, entity relationship, and integration diagrams. Present system designs to both internal and external stakeholders for approval.
System Analysis: Demonstrate a strong understanding of lead-to-cash processes, identify areas for improvement, and recommend solutions to enhance operational efficiency.
Implementation: Collaborate with engineers as a member of the scrum team to implement technical solutions to meet business requirements and compliance regulations.
Quality Assurance: Partner with QA to ensure thorough code testing and design test cases by applying test planning strategies.
User Acceptance Testing: Collaborate with business stakeholders to document user acceptance testing scenarios and obtain sign-off prior to deployment. Assist with testing coordination and documenting defects in partnership with stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up do date on industry best practices, proactively identifying opportunities for system optimization.

What you'll bring

2+ years of business analyst experience.
Self-starter with proactive qualities.
Problem Solver: With a keen analytical mindset, you're adept at identifying challenges and crafting effective solutions.
Ability to navigate an ambiguous environment.
Independent and capable of taking ownership and driving assignments, leading initiatives.
Active listener.
Business value-oriented.
Effective communicator, both in written and verbal communication.
Comfortable asking questions to understand business processes.
Collaborative: You excel in a team setting, working seamlessly with various departments to ensure business requirements are accurately translated into system capabilities.
Experience with Lead-to-Cash systems. Preferred experience with CRM, CPQ and ERP systems.

Working at CarGurus
We reward our Gurus' curiosity and passion with best-in-class benefits and compensation, including equity for all employees, both when they start and as they continue to grow with us. Our career development and corporate giving programs, as well as our employee resource groups (ERGs) and communities, help people build connections while making an impact in personally meaningful ways. A flexible hybrid model and robust time off policies encourage work-life balance and individual well-being. Thoughtful perks like daily free lunch, a new car discount, meditation and fitness apps, commuting cost coverage, and more help our people create space for what matters most in their personal and professional lives.

We welcome all
CarGurus strives to be a place to which people can bring the ultimate expression of themselves and their potential—starting with our hiring process. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. We foster an inclusive environment that values people for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. That's why we hope you'll apply even if you don't check every box listed in the job description. We want to know what only you can bring to CarGurus. #LI-Hybrid

Job Title: Business Analyst – Service Operations (Onsite in Cambridge, MA)
Job Description:
Job Title
Business Analyst – Service Operations (Onsite in Cambridge, MA)

Job Description

This Cambridge, MA based role is focused on performing various activities to enable service delivery as part of the Hospital Patient Monitoring Solutions business. This role is critical to ensure the installation and servicing process activities are executed in compliance with our quality system throughout the lifecycle of our products.

Your role:

Provide quality system process support for New Product Introductions (NPI) and Lifecycle activities to enable service delivery:
Process SAP Workflows to update material data elements required for service delivery.
Manage Field Change Order implementation including its activities and tasks in SAP and SMAX so that all associated Cases and Work Orders are updated and ready for implementation by the Markets.
Perform knowledge management activities to provide installation and servicing information and software to the Global Field, Partners, and Customers.
Pre-review Engineering Changes prior to release
Publish released documentation or software per Engineering Change in a timely manner.
Ensuring improvements to our current work instructions as systems and requirements mature.
Partnering with Business Process Experts to ensure reporting and visibility is possible to support daily management and improvement activities.
Facilitate quality system process reviews and updates annually.
Generate and manage Engineering Changes to release revisions to quality system processes.

You're the right fit if:

Ability to be onsite in Cambridge, MA
Bachelors degree (equivalent industry experience may be considered)
Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience
SAP experience
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks.
You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this position.

Wayfair is seeking analytical, entrepreneurial, and action-oriented candidates for Business Analyst opportunities. Analysts will play a critical role in Wayfair’s growth strategy and competitive positioning by leveraging data-driven analyses and innovative approaches to drive results for internal and external business partners. Successful Analysts are quantitatively-oriented, endlessly curious, and thrive in fast-paced and collaborative environments. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are interested in entering the technology and e-commerce space, developing hands-on analytical and technical skills, and working closely with core business functions to drive real impact and results.

Wayfair places Business Analysts into several core business functions. Function placement is determined through the application and interview process and is dependent on a combination of interest, skills, and experience. When applying, please indicate your top two choices for functional areas of interest. If we notice a stronger alignment for a team other than those indicated in the application, we will also consider you for that opportunity.

Functional areas and potential team placements include:
Profit Management, Competitive Intelligence & Business Trends

The Profit Management, Competitive Intelligence & Business Trends teams are focused on steering growth strategy, optimization of Wayfair’s competitive positioning and billion-dollar P&L management across Wayfair’s product verticals, by leveraging highly quantitative business analytics. This tight-knit, entrepreneurial team has a big appetite for bold ideas, a strong bias for action, and provides a distinct opportunity to drive decisions that have significant impact across every major business function at the company. Analysts directly control Wayfair’s dynamic pricing and product sorting capabilities to manage the delicate tradeoff between short and long term profitability, while working cross-functionally to affect product selection, merchandising, operations, and marketing initiatives. Analysts play a key role in building cutting edge ‘Big Data’ and leveraging these unique, proprietary, and massive datasets, coupled with a constant flow of experimentation on consumer response, to answer thorny questions that guide our go-to-market strategy.

Marketing Strategy & Analytics

Our Marketing team drives growth for Wayfair on every major advertising platform. We aren’t your standard marketers: we own the strategy, P&L, and roadmaps for our portfolio of cutting-edge and in-house-built marketing and AdTech products. We utilize data to acquire high-potential customers and engage them to come back again and again. We drive profitable top line revenue by investing marketing dollars where they will provide the greatest return for the business and leverage our understanding of the customer to impact the overall business strategy. As an Analyst, you will own a specific channel (e.g. Search, Display, Email, Social Media, TV/Online Video, etc.) end-to-end. You’ll be tasked with managing a multi-million dollar budget, helping to drive ad tech development, and devising new testing strategies to grow the business.

Talent Analytics and Compensation

Wayfair believes that our people are our greatest asset and biggest differentiator - and these teams focus on actualizing that potential through data and analytics. As a team member, you will work closely with Wayfair’s senior leadership to influence compensation strategy and improve the candidate and employee experience. You will test hypotheses, build and improve models, present to business leaders, upgrade data systems, and conduct market analyses aimed at optimizing the employee experience at Wayfair.

Operations

Wayfair’s Operations organization is revolutionizing the customer experience through the development of a proprietary logistics network and optimization platform that manages inventory from overseas factories to customer’s front door. This team works directly with suppliers, vendors, and customers to provide new levels of efficiency and performance. They also interact internally with Product, Engineering and Business Intelligence teams to generate the core analytical insights that enable Wayfair to tackle transportation, warehousing, and delivery challenges. As an Analyst, you’ll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantage for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the day-to-day efficiency of a complex and sophisticated global supply chain.

What You’ll Need:

Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings
Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills: ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with any programming language is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set (Google BigQuery/SQL, R, Python)
Bachelor's degree earned by Winter 2023 or Summer 2024
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and work remotely the other 1 day of the week.

At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.

Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our .

Need Assistance?

For more information about applying for a career at Wayfair, visit our .

Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Here at Siemens, we take pride in enabling sustainable progress through technology. We do this through empowering customers by combining the real and digital worlds. Improving how we live, work, and move today and for the next generation! We know that the only way a business thrive is if our people are thriving. That’s why we always put our people first. Our global, diverse team would be happy to support you and challenge you to grow in new ways. Who knows where our shared journey will take you?

We are hiring a Demand and Process Analyst. The position will be based in Hingham, MA and will be a Hybrid Role allowing for a few days a week to work remotely!

In this role you will report to the head of Project Management and will facilitate the communication of critical demand information to key stakeholders, working closely with our teams of sales, application engineering, project management, order management, engineering, and manufacturing operations.

Main responsibilities:
Tie input from all departments together into a singular view of the demand that can be filtered by product, plant, etc
Build and maintain databases, workflows and dashboards with supporting data
Drive discussions with all departments around capacity needs and actions to achieve the business revenue and margin targets. Identify and monitor lists of actions coming from these discussions
Manage the production schedule shadow loading process and provide input to the sales teams on lead time forecast per product line
Lead internal projects to improve processes that drive business target results
Present and escalate issues to executive management on a regular basis
You’ll win us over by having the following qualifications:
BS/BA in engineering, business, computer science or related field is helpful
Work experience of minimum 5 years
Competence with Microsoft Office Applications, with a strong proficiency in Excel
Experience with sophisticated ERP systems, preferably SAP
Experience in managing databases
Experience with data wrangling tools and dashboarding tools such as Tableau and Knime is preferred. The selected candidate will have access to a group of peers & management that understand the data the candidate is working with and can assist in learning Tableau and Knime as needed
Good Communications Skills, both written and oral
Proven organizational skills including attention to detail, time management, and problem-solving skills
Proactive, responsible, driven, team player
Ability to travel 10%
You’ll benefit from:

Who we are
At CarGurus (NASDAQ: CARG), our mission is to give people the power to reach their destination. We started as a small team of developers determined to bring trust and transparency to car shopping. Since then, our history of innovation and go-to-market acceleration has driven industry-leading growth. In fact, we're the largest and fastest-growing automotive marketplace, and we've been profitable for over 15 years.

What we do
The market is evolving, and we are too, moving the entire automotive journey online and guiding our customers through every step. That includes everything from the sale of an old car to the financing, purchase, and delivery of a new one. Today, tens of millions of consumers visit CarGurus.com each month, and ~30,000 dealerships use our products. But they're not the only ones who love CarGurus—our employees do, too. We have a people-first culture that fosters kindness, collaboration, and innovation, and empowers our Gurus with tools to fuel their career growth. Disrupting a trillion-dollar industry requires fresh and diverse perspectives. Come join us for the ride!




Role overview

CarGurus is seeking a Senior Analyst to join our Business Analytics & Reporting team. This team leads the analytical processes behind reporting, forecasting, and financial modeling, enabling day-to-day and strategic decisions. The Senior Analyst demonstrates an innate curiosity in uncovering how subtle nuances or decisions can significantly impact our data storytelling. They are a logical thinker excelling in complex problem-solving and are proficient in synthesizing insights from various data sources into clear, logical, and actionable proposals. This role offers opportunities for significant positive impact through a high level of autonomy. You will collaborate with multiple departments, gaining exposure to various dimensions of the business, and serve as a thought leader for a diverse range of stakeholders, including our senior leadership team. You will also contribute to fostering technical and professional mentorship among the team, supporting the growth of all members.




What you'll do

Conduct exploratory data analysis across diverse data sources to comprehend the performance of our business strategy and identify potential business opportunities/risks for mitigation.

Serve as an advisor to decision-makers, translating business questions into hypothesis-driven data analysis, and communicating tresults through visualizations and presentations.

Collaborater, share, and present data findings with stakeholders and our teams.

Work collaboratively across departments, using data to identify, validate, and recommend ideas for improving growth performance; define metrics to evaluate business performance and experiments; build reports and dashboards to monitor and comprehend them.

Advocate for and champion the use of data to enhance the quality of decision-making processes.

Mentor other analysts in their technical and professional development.




What you'll bring

A bachelor's degree (BS or BA) in computer science, mathematics, statistics, analytics, economics, or equivalent demonstrated analytical work experience.

Minimum of 4 years of experience in analysis and reporting, including proficiency in data visualization and related tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, PowerBI), influencing business decisions.

Ability to influence multiple partners towards adopting new data-driven approaches and achieving shared business goals.

Capability to use hypothesis-driven analysis to directly address business questions.

Expertise in SQL and Excel.

Proficiency in data modeling and data movement/ETL concepts.

Thrives in ambiguous data scenarios, deriving the best possible insights.

Prior experience in SAAS/B2B related businesses is valued.




Working at CarGurus
We reward our Gurus' curiosity and passion with best-in-class benefits and compensation, including equity for all employees, both when they start and as they continue to grow with us. Our career development and corporate giving programs, as well as our employee resource groups (ERGs) and communities, help people build connections while making an impact in personally meaningful ways. A flexible hybrid model and robust time off policies encourage work-life balance and individual well-being. Thoughtful perks like daily free lunch, a new car discount, meditation and fitness apps, commuting cost coverage, and more help our people create space for what matters most in their personal and professional lives.

We welcome all
CarGurus strives to be a place to which people can bring the ultimate expression of themselves and their potential—starting with our hiring process. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. We foster an inclusive environment that values people for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. That's why we hope you'll apply even if you don't check every box listed in the job description. We want to know what only you can bring to CarGurus. #LI-Hybrid

Be part of something BIG here at Gorton’s. With the iconic yellow slicker and a catchy little jingle, Gorton’s is now reaching more households than ever. And while technologies change and innovation abounds, one thing has stayed the same: the simple idea of spreading the goodness of the sea.

Since 1849, America has trusted the Gorton’s fisherman. And for over 170 years, Gorton’s has trusted our employees to work with integrity, pursue their curiosity, respond with agility, work collaboratively, and be passionate about our mission. We provide an ocean of opportunity supported by our development and training programs, our generous benefits, work life balance, and the ability to make a difference. We invite you to join our national brand based in the local waters of Gloucester, Massachusetts.

The goal of the Financial Management Associate program is to develop Gorton’s future Finance leaders by offering a variety of experiences within our Corporate Finance and Accounting areas. Initially, you will be placed into a specific assignment that may include Customer Finance, General Accounting, Supply Chain Financial Analysis, or Marketing and Sales Financial Analysis. Over time, you will move to other assignments within the Finance activity to build on your experience. You will have the opportunity to develop your financial and accounting expertise while also learning our business. You will work closely with peers and senior managers in other disciplines, including Marketing, Sales, Manufacturing, Logistics, and Information Technology. You will have the opportunity to make a significant difference in the success of our business.

Qualifications include:

Desire for a career in Corporate Finance/Accounting
Bachelor’s Degree with a concentration in Finance, Accounting, or related field
Strong business analysis skills (prefer some relevant work experience)
Well-developed PC skills
Ability to leverage information to develop insightful business judgment
Initiative - a self starter
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Potential for advancement

Gorton’s offers excellent growth potential along with an attractive benefits and compensation package.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States.

Gorton’s is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Title: State Street Global Advisors-Sr. Business Analyst
Job Description:
Job Description
The Application Technology Services team is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst who will be responsible for working with clients and development to create solutions to improve the client experience, the product feature set, and the strategic position of the Portfolio Construction Tools. The Senior Business Analyst will become a product expert and help to ensure that our software products effectively aid our Portfolio Managers with their workflow for multi-asset class positioning and trading. The Senior Business Analyst will participate in the full software development lifecycle and contribute as a member of a feature-focused product development team. They must be familiar with both financial and technical concepts, with a strong ability to deliver against specific requirement in a timely fashion on a project-by-project basis. The successful candidate will have strong technology and business acumen, build partnerships, foster close collaboration and work hand in hand with the business and technology teams.

As the Portfolio Construction Tools Senior Business Analyst, you will:
Establish relationships with all stakeholders and development leads globally to ensure the right engagement and alignment is achieved for each initiative
Apply detailed knowledge of business requirements and workflows to assist in product development
Research and produce business and technical requirement documents
Work directly with customers and the product management team to gather product requirements and develop feature specifications; involvement in all aspects of the software product life cycle
Partner with development to help develop, implement, and refine features
Provide feedback on product performance
Provide technical application level guidance and clarity to other technology leads and teams within the organization
Collaborate with the documentation team to ensure accurate and complete product documentation
Provide client beta testing support and train personnel on capabilities of new product releases
Assist implementation and support to resolve escalated client issues
Actively participate in the Agile software development process by adhering to Scrum Methodology including attending all daily standups, sprint planning, backlog grooming, and retrospectives.
Participate and lead team scrum meetings
These skills will help you succeed in this role:
Proven track record leading technology teams (development, business analysis, QA, support)
People management experience
Detailed knowledge of the Asset Management or Investment Management industry with a focus on multi-asset class investing
Experience with trading and reporting for funds, ETFs, futures, currency, bonds and TBAs.
Excellent communication skills and confidence in dealing with all levels of the organization, both internal and external
Senior level presentation skills and project management responsibilities
Must be able to work independently with limited supervision
Solid interpersonal skills and ability to effectively organize and communicate across functional and technical lines
Highly organized, and ability to manage multiple tasks and projects
Solid understanding Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and development platforms
Leadership qualities in managing complex projects to deliver business results and positive outcomes
Education & Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree is a requirement; Computer Science or Information Technology preferred.
Financial Services background, including investment or asset management (preferred)
Information technology expertise
Should be an excellent communicator, experience on communicating with global users (both written and verbal), will be preferred.
Are you the right candidate? Yes!
We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don’t necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.
About State Street Global Advisors
What we do. As the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, State Street Global Advisors has served the world’s governments, institutions and financial advisors for over four decades. With a rigorous, risk-aware approach built on research, analysis and market-tested experience, we build from a breadth of active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. As stewards, we help portfolio companies see that what is fair for people and sustainable for the planet can deliver long-term performance. And, as pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest. As a result, we have become one of the world’s largest asset managers with trillions of dollars under our care.
Our Mission. At State Street Global Advisors our mission is to invest responsibly to enable economic prosperity and social progress. We are driven by a desire to help our clients, and those who rely on them, achieve a better future. We have a long history of developing innovative investment strategies to provide our clients with reliable and transparent returns, cost-effectively, and without excessive risk.
Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to Flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.
Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.
State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
Company: State Street Global Advisors
Salary Range:
$120,000 - $202,500 Annual
The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Be a part of the team building the future of healthcare!

Firefly Health is building a revolutionary new type of comprehensive health "care and coverage,” powered by a relationship-driven care team, a trusted virtual and in-person clinical network, and our proprietary technology platform.

Founded by experienced clinicians and technology leaders, Firefly Health is on a mission to deliver half-priced health care that's twice as good, clinically and emotionally. We are flipping the script on what it means to be a health plan and actually providing a true health benefit to members.

We are intensely focused on optimizing the physical + mental + financial wellbeing of those who want (and deserve) something better than the status quo. If you are ready to roll up your sleeves and take on our audacious mission, then we would love to hear from you.

You will:

Use SQL and other data tools to create, maintain, and manipulate databases to track business performance.
Develop and analyze business performance reports (eg. for claims data, provider data, utilization data) and provide notations of performance deviations and anomalies
Create and publish periodic reports, as well as any necessary ad hoc reports and assist in identifying potential areas for medical cost improvement and alternative healthcare cost containment and population health strategies
Be responsible for creating reports and analyzing and developing recommendations on data and systems related to value-based payment model performance
Work directly with the CFO to identify solution to optimize value based care performance
Collaborate with functional partners to analyze and optimize initiatives designed to improve medical cost performance delivering actionable data and insights to internal and external partners

You’d be a good fit if:

You have 3-5 years of experience with healthcare data analysis or related experience
Strong written and oral presentation skills and interpersonal skills
Experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools (SQL) required and statistical software (SAS, R, Python, etc.) is preferred
Ability to manipulate large sets of data linking them from different sources
Strong analytical, organization, presentation, and problem-solving skills
You have knowledge of billing systems and healthcare coding and experience working with healthcare claim data

It’d be nice if:

You have experience working in a health plan finance, actuarial or medical economics functional area
You have experience working in a healthcare provider administering services in a Value Based arrangement or other full risk construct


Our office is located in Watertown, Massachusetts but we’ve developed a robust remote working structure to give us more flexibility geographically while hiring for many positions.

This role can be done largely remotely, there are several times a year when staff come together onsite for planning and team building.

We are always looking for valuable talent to add to our growing team. Even if you’re not sure this role is the one for you, don’t let that stop you. We’d love to have a conversation to see where you could fit.

Firefly is an equal opportunity employer. We value diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to building and sustaining an inclusive workplace culture where individuals are treated with dignity and respect. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

JOB TITLE: Lead Business Analyst
POSITION SUMMARY:
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!
What You Can Expect At BBH:
If you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately, we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others
Change Management Lead Business Analyst
As a Lead Business Analyst in our Service Delivery Change Management team, you will initiate, organize, and drive small/medium-sized projects or segments of large projects that address business goals and deliver business value. Under the direction of a project or program manager, you will participate in all phases of the project life cycle and be responsible for execution of project tasks in accordance with standards and best practices. You will lead effective meetings to gather, validate and document business requirements, as well as current and future state workflows. You will analyze data, research issues, and design solutions to meet business needs. In addition, you may lead user acceptance testing, training, and implementation of new and existing applications as defined in a project or product roll-out plan.
Your knowledge of financial services and SDLC, as well as strong organizational skills, will enable you to multi-task in a fast-paced environment driven to deliver on the strategic investments of the Firm. To be successful, you’ll need to be results-oriented and understand the impact of the project on the business as a whole. Your creativity and intellectual curiosity will enable you to manage through obstacles and drive resolution of issues. You will need strong communication and negotiation skills to successfully liase between business managers and systems analysts and developers to understand and articulate business requirements, and assist in the design, development and implementation of technology enhancements.
If you are looking to push your career to the next level, introduce yourself by submitting your resume.
Key responsibilities include:
Lead small/medium sized projects or workstreams/segments of large projects or programs
Plan meetings, prepare materials, and lead or participate in meetings with business users and sponsors, systems groups, vendors and clients
Document and/or review business requirements gathered from business users, sponsors and clients, and obtain user signoff on the requirements
Conduct business analysis to determine how changing business needs will affect the system or product; clearly articulate the business need and potential solutions with support of insightful analysis and documented evidence
Design creative solutions that meet the goals and objectives of the project and align with product/ discipline strategy. Lead design sessions, driving to creative, thoughtful, viable solutions.
Prepare project status reporting and other project communications for internal and external stakeholders
Track and organize open items; understand the time sensitivities of open issues and drive to resolution
Provide guidance for Business Analysts through coaching, resolving conflicts, coordinating activity, and assigning work.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, COMPETENCIES: (Completed by Manager)
Education Level
BA or Equivalent
Relevant Professional Experience
Up to 5 Yrs
Technical Capabilities
(include linguistic competencies)
Knowledge-Skills
Understanding of project management principles
Familiarity with project management software (e.g., CA PPM, MS Project) to build/manage schedules and produce dashboard reporting.
Experience with MS Office applications including: Word, Excel, and Outlook
Knowledge of project methodologies including theoretical aspects of project management
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Other Requirements
Demonstrated planning, organization, critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ability to learn, adapt, and apply new concepts and technologies
Customer-focused perspective, team work, negotiation, conflict management and adaptability.
Demonstrated influencing and leadership skills, including negotiation and conflict management
Demonstrated understanding in areas of application programming, database and system design or with business-side knowledge of custodian, administrator, transfer agent roles.
Demonstrated decision-making skills, including delegation, team work
Effective interpersonal and negotiation skills and is able to communicate effectively with project team and department/group managers.

UBEO Business Services, the premier provider of business technology products and services, is seeking to hire a Business Analyst/Sales Support to join our team in Quincy, Massachusetts.
UBEO is a distributor/servicer of document equipment and software solutions. Primary products include Xerox, Ricoh, Canon and Konica Minolta multi-functional equipment and Kyocera printers. UBEO specializes in electronic document management software and integrations.

Department: Sales
Reports To: Vice President of Sales
FLSA Status: Full Time / Exempt

Purpose
The primary responsibility of this position is to support sales by providing both pre and post sales analysis. Pre-sales support involves conducting business technology assessments (BTA's) and workflow analysis at potential and existing customer sites. This is a team selling position that will have you working with all sales reps at your respective marketplace. Post-sales support involves helping the sales representatives with BTA findings, deliverables, proposal and presentations.

Key Words: Office Technology, Document Management, Document Workflow, Office Equipment, Office Supplies, Print Fleet Management, MPS, Ricoh/Zebra/Xerox/Canon/Laserfische, ECM

Responsibilities

Daily sales and office support
Meeting with decision makers/managers and employees of potential and existing customers
Compiling all data needed for analysis
Creating spreadsheets, drawings and cost analysis
Printing and binding presentations
Additional duties as assigned

Supervision
Supervised - VPGM & Manager of BA’s

Contacts
Internal: Exempt, Non-Exempt
External: Prospective Customers, Current Customers, Vendors

Job Related Dimensions

Proficiency in all MS Office products
Proficiency in Visio
Adobe Suite
Sales support

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree preferred or equivalent experience in a related field.
2-4 years industry experience preferred.
5+ yrs in an analyst type of role or equivalent experience preferred
Strong sales support experience
Strong customer service skills.
Excellent communication skills – both written and verbal.
Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Must be a self motivated individual with a high level of professionalism.
Must have an acceptable driving record and reliable form of transportation.

Physical Demands & Work Environment

Ability to sit at desk or stand/walk at customer sites for prolonged periods at times.
Ability to talk on the phone and work with various computer tools and applications.
Ability to type and compose written communication in various forms.
Ability to operate a motor vehicle for travel to client sites.
Ability to lift 20+lbs on occasion.

UBEO offers a competitive compensation package. UBEO also offers an excellent benefits package which is a significant part of our employee's total compensation. We strive to provide a broad range of competitive benefits designed to meet your personal needs and priorities. Our comprehensive benefits package includes:

Choice of medical, dental and vision plans that provide our employees and their families with high-quality healthcare, including orthodontia for both adults and child(ren)
Generous Company Paid Health Reimbursement Account Options to defray deductible expenses
Company paid life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance for you, your spouse and child(ren)
Flexible Spending and Health Savings Account Options - Set aside pre-tax dollars to cover out-of-pocket expenses related to health or dependent care

A generous wealth accumulation program will help you achieve financial security for retirement. We offer a 401(K) Plan w/ Match upon eligibility and Free Financial Counseling
Generous vacation, holiday, and sick leave programs - as we believe that taking advantage of time away from work is essential for a well-balanced life

Job Title: Praktikum IT Business Analyst Produktionssteuerung / Logistik (m/w/d)
Job Description:
We run so life can leap forward.


Mit rund 3.000 Beschäftigten ist das Werk Mannheim Deutschlands größter Hersteller und Exporteur landwirtschaftlicher Traktoren. Das Produktionsprogramm für den weltweiten Markt umfasst 27 verschiedene Grundmodelle (von 66 bis 184 kW (90 bis 250 PS)) in unterschiedlichen Versionen und zahlreichen Ausrüstungsvarianten.


Unsere Abteilung Produktionssteuerung / Logistik IT sucht zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt wissbegierige Unterstützung.


Praktikum IT Business Analyst Produktionssteuerung / Logistik (m/w/d)


Du bist ein wichtiger Teil eines schlagfertigen Teams und arbeitest in einem spannenden und internationalen Umfeld. Mit Deiner Arbeit trägst Du persönlich zur Produktionsplanung und -steuerung der Getriebe und Traktorenmontage im Werk Mannheim bei.


Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen:

Einblick in die Tätigkeit einer global agierenden Organisation sowie ein internationales Arbeitsumfeld
attraktives Vergütungspaket
flexibles und modernes Arbeiten sowie Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
35 Stunden/ Woche
kreative Freiräume bei der Durchführung von Projekten und eine gute Betreuung
Vergünstigtes Mittagsessen in der Cafeteria




Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich:

Unterstützung unserer Produktionsplaner und Montagesteuerer im Tagesgeschäft
Möglichkeit des Kenntnisaufbaus im gesamten Auftragsabwicklungsbereich und den Abläufen am Shopfloor
Analyse bestehender Reports hinsichtlich Realisierbarkeit mit Power BI und Tableau
Analyse hinsichtlich potenzieller Anwendungsfälle in der Werkslogistik mit Hilfe von MS Power Platform/Applikationen
Die Möglichkeit zur Erstellung einer Abschlussarbeit im Anschluss an das Praktikum ist gegeben


Das bringst Du mit:

Immatrikulation (Bachelor/Master) aus dem Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbarem Studiengang
Sicherer Umgang mit MS-Office 365 Tools, insbesondere Excel
Erste Erfahrungen mit dem Umgang der MS Power Platform sind von Vorteil
Fähigkeit sich schnell in datenbankgestütze System einzuarbeiten
Die Bereitschaft sich in neue IT Tools einzuarbeiten
Sehr gute Kenntnisse der deutschen Sprache in Wort und Schrift (C1-Level)
Kenntnisse der englischen Sprache in Wort und Schrift
Persönliche Kompetenzen: Bereitschaft in Projektteams zu arbeiten, selbständige und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise, Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie hohe Einsatzbereitschaft und sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten


Nicht jeder kann von sich behaupten, dass die eigene Arbeit zur Grundversorgung der wachsenden Weltbevölkerung beiträgt. Bei John Deere kannst Du das!


Als führender Landtechnikhersteller fertigen wir moderne Landmaschinen, mit denen die Landwirtschaft Lebensmittel und Rohstoffe produziert. In den letzten Jahren haben wir das Unternehmen zu einem Technologiekonzern entwickelt. Teile mit uns, unsere Vision einer Farm der Zukunft, basierend auf künstlicher Intelligenz, Automatisierung und Konnektivität, um unsere wachsende Welt nachhaltig zu ernähren.


Egal wer Du bist – bei John Deere bist Du herzlich willkommen! Wir sind der festen Überzeugung, dass Vielfalt und Einbeziehung uns noch stärker machen.

inkl. Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben, aktueller Notenauszug und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Auszug der Praktikumsrichtlinien der Hochschule).




John Deere Werk Mannheim

Personalabteilung

Katharina Ott

Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS) has the fastest, lowest cost path to commercial fusion energy.

CFS collaborates with MIT to leverage decades of research combined with groundbreaking new high-temperature superconducting (HTS) magnet technology. HTS magnets will enable compact fusion power plants that can be constructed faster and at lower cost. Our mission is to deploy these power plants to meet global decarbonization goals as fast as possible. To that end, CFS has assembled a team of leaders in tough tech, fusion science, and manufacturing with a track record of rapid execution. Supported by the world’s leading investors, CFS is uniquely positioned to deliver limitless, clean, fusion power to combat climate change. To implement this plan, we are looking to add dedicated people to the team who treat people well, improve our work by adding multifaceted perspectives and new ways of solving problems, have achieved outstanding results through a range of pursuits, and have skills and experience related to this role.

You will be the strategic interface between various teams across the organization and responsible for identifying and documenting opportunities and creating solutions to improve the business process through technology – primarily using Odoo – our ERP System. You will belong to a collaborative culture and exhibit transparent communication and teamwork.
This team member will:
Act as a liaison with cross-functional business teams in the areas of Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Finance and work with all levels of management to implement business processes using Odoo
Collaborate with teams across the organization to ideate and implement solutions to resolve business inefficiencies and pain points
Map requirements, design, improve, train and document business process solutions within project scope
Help teams achieve a smooth business process flow by leveraging the capabilities of the ERP System
Have a robust understanding of business processes across the organization and use that knowledge to develop streamlined procedures and eliminate waste
Proactively mitigates issues and suggests opportunities to enhance functionality for continuous improvement
Coordinate with the development team on the creation of new solutions
Create Test Plans and perform testing of new features and bug fixes
Develop, document and maintain best-practice solutions and methodologies
The ideal candidate will have most, if not all, of these requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in the field of Computer Science, Supply Chain, Engineering, Business, or Finance
3+ Years in Manufacturing, Planning, Supply Chain or Finance
Ability to prioritize competing requirements and negotiate satisfactory solutions
Experience implementing new or troubleshooting existing functionality in ERP system
Experience proposing and presenting a business case and creating a viable product roadmap
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Proven ability to align cross-functional teams on business processes supported by ERP or equivalent tools
Strong understanding of processes in the areas of Manufacturing/Supply Chain/Finance in a manufacturing or construction industry
Additional experience and/or qualifications:
Start-up or high growth environment
Programming knowledge with Python and PostgresSQL is a Plus
Ability to lift up to 50lbs occasionally
Perform activities such as stooping, typing, standing, and sitting, for extended periods of time
Work in a facility that contains industrial hazards including heat, cold, noise, fumes, strong magnets, lead (Pb), high voltage, high current, pressure systems, and cryogenics
Willingness to travel occasionally

The Executive Office of Labor and Workforce Development (EOLWD) is responsible for seven agencies and departments under this organization. EOLWD and its agencies are committed to developing a world-class, highly skilled labor force to support business growth and innovation in the Commonwealth.

EOLWD is seeking to hire a Data and Reporting Business Analyst who will be responsible for providing business architecture oversight and ensure technical solutions align with EOL business operational and strategic goals. This position will work closely with the Executive Office of Labor (EOL) Director, Reporting and Data Analytics to identify and prioritize all technical changes to the Enterprise Data Management (EDM) project. The Business Architect will act as a high level business lead to determine design choices and standards for technical changes that impact EOL.

This role will actively document and maintain business process models to serve as the foundation for developing business solutions. The Data and Reporting Business Analyst will work with EOL IT, business owners and vendors to manage resource allocations to ensure timely delivery of EDM development efforts. The Data and Reporting Business Analyst will collaborate with business and technical units to develop current and long-range plans to deliver innovative solutions and excellent customer service to the citizens of the Commonwealth. They will adhere to all EOL and Executive Office of Technology Service and Security (EOTSS) security standards and directives. This position may occasionally require working extra hours and being on standby status.

The primary work location for this role will be at 100 Cambridge St., Boston, Massachusetts 02114. The work schedule for this position is Monday thru Friday, 9:00AM to 5:00PM. This position would be expected to follow a hybrid model of reporting to work that combines in-office workdays and work from home days as needed.




Responsibilities:

Document business architecture models and business service definitions for EOL Business Owners, Subject Matter Experts, internal and external business partners as well as cross-functional and cross-organizational governance teams to provide enterprise assessments and recommendations
Plan and manage the daily business operations of the EDM Support Team by defining priority and resource allocation plans.
Serve as the business lead and perform project analysis to develop cost and time estimates, develop problem resolutions and assist with creating system and User Acceptance test plans for complex applications.
Develop and prioritize a list of EDM changes to align with EOL goals, objectives and key performance indicators. Adjust priorities as needed to meet legislative and policy mandates.
Document constraints within EOL business practices and workflows to identify business process re-engineering opportunities to align these business practices to the EOL strategies and business plans
Lead EDM operational business process and service definition sessions to support application design and software development efforts including:
Create comprehensive business process models and prototypes
Evaluate potential benefits and risks in proposed solutions
Analyze requirements/specifications and application configuration
Develop Six Sigma SIPOC diagrams to summarize inputs and outputs of proposed business services
Hold/ensure cross-department business process reviews for new business solutions
Improve business operational efficiencies by working with Operations Management, business users, Business Support Unit, EOL IT and vendors to design and implement changes, enhancements, and corrections to EOL computer applications.
Define testing objectives, approach, and timelines for EDM system changes and updates.
Create and document test scenarios for manual and automated testing
Assign and define testing roles and responsibilities
Document and execute test scenarios for EOL business areas
Identify key milestones
Adhere to issue reporting and resolution process
Test and analyze interfaces, functionality, systems, business requirements, and ad hoc testing to ensure the full and correct linkage and integrity of data and functionality between EDM and external systems.
Serve as a point lead for Business Analysts, Subject Matter Experts and IT Architects to provide clear guidance around business process and service definitions and principles.
Ensure quality assurance procedures and processes are understood and followed by the EDM Support Team.
Ensure that all projects conform to PCI, PII, ADA, records retention and security policies by working closely with various groups, e.g. Security and IT Operations.
Collaborate with the EOL Training department to prepare training programs and materials to support the necessary education of internal and external business application users.
Assign resources for the definition, configuration, development, testing and implementation of new business services
Train and mentor team members on business architecture practices and standards.
Ensures that employees understand and follow applicable policies
Manages personnel activities of staff such as EPRS, supervision, and professional development
Facilitate communication upward and across project teams including project status, cost information, justification for variances and business architecture implications.
Support the ongoing effort of data cleansing to ensure a high level of data integrity for EOL business applications, including:
Provide guidance in the merge process of duplicate records
Participate in data stewardship to govern data management issues
Design business solutions for EDM data requests using ad hoc reporting and data cubes
Participate in internal and external audit compliance efforts such as the Social Security Administration, Internal Revenue Service, and other Compliance Reviews.
Stays informed of EOL and EOTSS security policies and ongoing changes and updates.
Evaluate vendor software solutions and alternatives for Request for Response (RFR) and Request for Quote (RFQ) initiatives and respond to vendor questions related to business services.
Conduct research on emerging technologies and best practices in support of business operations.



Required Experience:

Two (2) to four (4) plus years of experience in a similar business analyst role.
Two (2) to four (4) plus years of experience writing and carrying out user acceptance testing.
Two (2) to four (4) plus years of experience documenting business processes and interfacing with various business units.
Two (2) plus years of change control management.
Business Intelligence (BI) knowledge; ideally one (1) to two (2) years of exposure to BI from an ETL perspective.
Ability to observe steps and ascertain success of step or failure and root cause of step(s).
Experience in Data Management.
Experience in Application Lifestyle Management.
Proven track record of self-starting and growth in related field(s).

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Experience with Informatica SSIS, CDATA, other ETL tools is a plus.
Experience with interactive reporting platforms (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Experience with source control, continuous integration experience is a plus.
Proven success with documentation of processes, distributing to end-users and supporting those users.

Education and Certifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field, or equivalent work experience.
