Job Description


When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.


Reporting to the Sr. Director Strategy and Market Development this role is part of the
Single-Use Technologies Division. The successful candidate will demonstrate critical thinking skills, ability to analyze and provide recommendations based on disparate data sources, self-drive and effective communication.


Location/Division: Logan, UT, South Jordan, UT, Saint Louis, MO, Carlsbad, CA, Waltham, MA

What will you do?
The Bioproduction Data Analyst role will deliver critical insights to inform the strategy and economic quantification of business value propositions. The data analyst will work in close collaboration with product management, marketing, R&D, Biological Collaboration Center and commercial teams to develop hypothesis, refine scope and implement analysis

Using analytics and insights, continuously develop and refine modeling programs to assess economic impact of value propositions
Support product marketing and sales with case studies and facility fit analysis for new and existing products
Aid product development and process development with well informed decisions via process simulation and economic analysis
Understand and articulate the impact to existing and new products with respect to product optimization and the impact of new technologies to the customer
Deliver insight which will save time and resources during the exploration and development of new products intended for the external market
Work independently, and in coordination with functional teams to drive analysis and synthesize insights for executive review
Create data visualization tools help to identify conclusions and clearly share those analyses as presentations, reports or communications with customers (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, white papers, and email)
Other related responsibilities as assigned


How will you get here?

Bachelors degree in life science preferred, finance, economics (Masters degree preferred)
Experience in or a good understanding of bioprocessing upstream and downstream processes preferred
2-5 years of experience as a market, strategy, or economic analyst in life sciences industry
Strong experience using data, qualitative and quantitative inputs to refine business strategies
Self-starter with the ability to take projects from concept through to execution with a high attention for detail and proficiency in managing complexity
Innovative problem solver who is creative, curious, and continuously looking at opportunities for improvement
Ability to function in a complex, matrix business environment is essential
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation experience to large and diverse audiences
Strong organizational skills with the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
Proficient in Excel (advanced user), Power BI, (BioSolve experience preferred)

Please this role is onsite only in either Waltham, MA, Logan, UT, or St. Louis, MO sites.

This is an onsite role, which must be at one of the 3 locations listed. Relocation assistance is not offered at his time."

Job Title: State Street Global Advisors, ESG Business Data Analyst, Assistant Vice President
Job Description:
The Business & Data Analyst will support ESG reporting services and business analysis. The role will execute data operations and business analysis functions supporting ESG Client, Product, and Regulatory Reporting. This includes daily operations responsibilities, data monitoring and issue resolution while supporting new projects by defining scope, business and data requirements, and success criteria. This role will contribute to project execution, implementation, and testing activities. The Candidate must be proficient in analysis, definition, communication, assessment, and validation of data and business requirements used for software development. Previous experience working with mutual funds, ETFs, and Institutional funds across a range of data domains such as performance, holdings, accounting, pricing, and analytics is required.

About State Street Global Advisors
What We Do. As the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, State Street Global Advisors has served the world’s governments, institutions and financial advisors for over four decades. With a rigorous, risk-aware approach built on research, analysis and market-tested experience, we build from a breadth of active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. As stewards, we help portfolio companies see that what is fair for people and sustainable for the planet can deliver long-term performance. And, as pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest. As a result, we have become one of the world’s largest asset managers with trillions of dollars under our care.
Our Mission. At State Street Global Advisors our mission is to invest responsibly to enable economic prosperity and social progress. About This Opportunity

Reporting to the Director of Supply Chain Systems (SCS), the Systems Analyst III is responsible for the analysis, design, development, documentation, testing, training, implementation, and support of both existing and new operations and information systems at an advanced/specialized level.

Additionally, the incumbent acts as a liaison between technical representatives (hospital, suppliers, and consulting agencies) and end user personnel to ensure and maintain accurate communication and understanding. Incumbent may be required to perform some technical tasks and may work as part of a project team or independently.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Requires a strong functional understanding of business processes and data structures for core PeopleSoft modules, specifically Inventory. Expect the employee to stay current on existing and future technologies with PeopleSoft and other third-party applications interfacing with PeopleSoft.
Supports mobile inventory functionality including managing and maintaining fleet of mobile hand-held devices
Researches data requirements, data flow and data control points from various departments within the hospital by meeting with department heads and administrative personnel to identify, define and record functionality and problems which exist within current applications. Identifies and translates business requirements into functional design specifications to enhance current performance, functionality and data control.
Performs business analysis and applies PeopleSoft and healthcare industry knowledge to develop functional solutions to business problems or identify and recommend process improvement opportunities to meet the needs of Mass General Brigham (MGB) and the Supply Chain Management department.
Works jointly with MGB Digital personnel to assess, scope and design any changes to the PeopleSoft system or other third party applications.
Creates test scripts, perform test scenarios and document results in accordance with pre-established standards. Performs and coordinates functional testing, unit testing, integration testing and end user acceptance testing.
Performs system upgrades on a scheduled basis and validate system is working as developed and designed, before rolling out to users.
Develops, enhances, tests and implements PeopleSoft queries to support business processes and metrics.
In conjunction with users, defines organizational impacts and develops end user training materials, schedule and conduct training sessions to all MGB entities and/or internal SCM employees as needed.
Provides implementation support as well as on-going production support by troubleshooting, resolving and communicating issues, related to the respective PeopleSoft modules, in a professional and timely manner.
Assumes complete responsibility for minor projects or significant tasks within a major project including delegation of tasks and written and oral presentations to hospital community. Monitors task assignments to ensure they are performed on schedule, within intended scope, and to a defined level of quality.
Communicates project status to management to include but not limited to written status reports, emails, detailed specification of design development, training, test plans and updates to work plan. Additionally, responsible for communicating project status to functional owner.
Performs data maintenance and security setup, following pre-defined standards, audit processes and protocols.
Executes PeopleSoft queries and performs basic data analysis using Microsoft Excel and/or Access.
Coordinates with other team members to assure consistency and optimization of overall work product.
Contributing to the creation of standard approaches and techniques
Performs other duties as assigned.


This role is remote with 20% travel to sites across MA and NH. Reliable transportation is required.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree or 4 years of Supply Chain/Accounts Payable experience.
Prior experience in a large hospital or healthcare system is preferred
Experience working with PeopleSoft Financials/Supply Chain 9.2 or higher; with knowledge of PeopleSoft supply chain modules: Inventory, Purchasing, eProcurement
Strong understanding of supply chain procure-to-pay processes is preferred
Proficient working knowledge of computers with application experience in MS Office 365 suite; specifically, Teams, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Familiarity with Microsoft Access is a plus

Skills/Abilities/Competencies

Excellent interpersonal skills for effective communication across cross-functional teams and organization levels
Excellent problem solving and analytical abilities, including independent research for solutions
Self-motivated with the capability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team
Efficient time management skills for multitasking
Must be adaptable and flexible to changes in priority and direction
Superior customer service skills
Quick learner with the ability to grasp and operate new applications and systems
Strong communication and presentation skills
Skillful in explaining technical details to a non-technical audience
Proficient in conducting interviews, gathering business process details and identifying solution requirements
Must have a strong attention to detail
Ability to successfully negotiate and collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds an levels within and external to the organization
Proficiency in leading meetings, formal and informal

Working Conditions

The working conditions are consistent with a fast-paced work environment, where the management of multiple tasks and priorities is constant.
Position is 80% remote, 20% travel to MGB’s corporate office and supported materials management locations across Massachusetts and southern New Hampshire.
Work in a team environment with minimal supervision.
Off-hours and weekend support may be occasionally required.

Agency Overview

The Division of Capital Asset Management and Maintenance (DCAMM), which oversees over $2 billion in capital programs and projects, is responsible for capital planning, project delivery, property management, and real estate services for the Commonwealth. We are stewards of the Commonwealth’s assets, which include 61 million square feet of state buildings. As an agency, we care for the people of our state and the future of our planet.
We work with state agencies to create and manage forward-thinking, sustainable buildings to meet the needs of the Commonwealth’s citizens and help achieve a zero-carbon future.
We are partners with fellow agencies to help them meet their strategic needs with fiscally responsible building and real estate solutions.
We support the growth of the Commonwealth’s economy and actively engage with private sector partners to make it easier to do business with the Commonwealth.
We work to expand access, opportunity, and equity to create more inclusive services, planning and outcomes for all the citizens of the Commonwealth.
General Statement of Duties and Responsibilities



The DCAMM Operations and Policy Analyst reports to the Chief of Staff and serves as an important member of the Executive Office team, helping DCAMM contribute to the Administration’s decarbonization and housing goals in addition to supporting the core mission of the agency in real estate, planning, design and construction.

The Operations and Policy Analyst’s overall responsibility is to support the Commissioner, Chief of Staff and Director of External Affairs in ensuring efficient operation of the executive office and prioritizing and advancing DCAMM’s mission.

Due to the nature of this role, the Operations and Policy Analyst will periodically be required to be available for extended hours, including nights and weekends.

Duties for this role include:

Oversee the development of the Commissioner and Chief of Staff’s calendars and daily agendas.
Responsible for meeting preparation materials for the Commissioner and Chief of Staff to ensure that they are fully briefed and prepared with supporting materials for all internal and external events and meetings.
Perform administrative duties in support of the executive team, overseeing the clerical and administrative portions of the executive office.
Coordinate and follow-up with senior staff to manage high-priority projects to support the agency’s mission and strategic vision.
Build and maintain successful working relationships and coordinate with a wide range of state government offices, staff and stakeholders.
Work with the Director of External Affairs to facilitate internal and external communications, including communications with state and local government officials.
Manage special assignments to support the mission of the agency.
Develop knowledge and understanding of DCAMM’s programs, policies and procedures.
Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.

Preferred Qualifications

Excellent communications skills, including writing and proofreading.
Excellent interpersonal skills and customer-service orientation with the ability to develop positive working relationships with agency clients and stakeholders.
Excellent organizational skills and follow-up.
Ability to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, holidays, and extended hours when needed.
Demonstrated experience in effectively managing multiple projects in a fast-paced, demanding environment and managing competing priorities and demands.
Ability to exercise discretion and sound judgment.
Working understanding of the structure and functions of Massachusetts Government.
Proficiency in use of Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams and Zoom.
Experience working in a local, state or federal government office.

Salary will be commensurate with candidate’s experience. Please include a resume and cover letter with your submission for this position.

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Student Affairs
Job Description:
Job Description Summary
The Office of the Vice President for Student Affairs (OVPSA) is responsible for creating frameworks, policies, and processes that are used by all departments in the division to deliver an innovative and transformative experience for our undergraduate students. In addition, OVPSA staff ensures that divisional initiatives continue to extend learning outside-of-the-classroom and create a sense of connection and belonging for every undergraduate student.

Reporting to the Director of Strategic Projects and Communication, the Business Systems position is responsible for nine enterprise applications and several non-enterprise applications. These enterprise systems provide cross-functional coordination and integration of data to support critical business decisions and functions that would represent high transition costs and/or contain sensitive information. In addition, these systems store or transmit Level 1 Data. The Business Systems position will utilize Information Technology systems to help achieve strategic business goals. Design and develop new systems by configuring new hardware and software or use existing systems in new ways to accomplish additional or different outcomes.
Essential Duties
Responsible to support Information Technology applications managed by Student Affairs including Enterprise and Data Level 1 Applications including but not limited to StarRez (Housing), ARMS (Police), ARMS (Athletics), Campus Groups, ISSM, iModules (with Advancement) Medicat, RAVE and Titanium
System knowledge and configuration, vendor engagement, contract renewal in conjunction with procurement, vendor upgrades, trouble shooting, reporting assistance, documentation, business continuity planning and SA staff training as needed
Student Affairs Point person for Workday reporting
Serves as point person for Student Affairs to liaison with Information Technology on system integrations, maintenance and upgrades; represents Student Affairs on several Information Technology related committees
Consulting with management and users to determine the needs of the system
Designing a system to meet the business goals; Specifying inputs and formatting outputs to meet users’ needs
Developing specifications, diagrams and flowcharts for implementers to follow
Overseeing implementation, coordinating tests, and observing initiation of the system to validate performance
Facilitate interface and data flow between primary SIS (Workday) and software programs mentioned above
Serve as key user for report creation and data maintenance for Division of Student Affairs
Identify areas of efficiency and streamline technological processes to result in smoother functionality for users
Follow alerts for upgrades to software and proactively schedule periodic required maintenance
Liaise with project managers in Information Technology to advocate for Student Affairs needs in the broader context of Information Technology projects
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree with 5 years of related work experience
Master’s Degree and experience in higher education systems preferred
Attention to detail, ability to manage ongoing and multiple responsibilities, and strong work-ethic
Passion for working in a fast-paced and dynamic department as an active and engaged team member.
Experience in multicultural settings, diversity training programs, second language fluency, or coursework in multicultural perspectives is desirable.
Work Environment
Ability to work in an open flexible office space, which allows for increased collaboration among colleagues and students.
The position requires an ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS) has the fastest, lowest cost path to commercial fusion energy.

CFS collaborates with MIT to leverage decades of research combined with groundbreaking new high-temperature superconducting (HTS) magnet technology. HTS magnets will enable compact fusion power plants that can be constructed faster and at lower cost. Our mission is to deploy these power plants to meet global decarbonization goals as fast as possible. To that end, CFS has assembled a team of leaders in tough tech, fusion science, and manufacturing with a track record of rapid execution. Supported by the world’s leading investors, CFS is uniquely positioned to deliver limitless, clean, fusion power to combat climate change. To implement this plan, we are looking to add dedicated people to the team who treat people well, improve our work by adding multifaceted perspectives and new ways of solving problems, have achieved outstanding results through a range of pursuits, and have skills and experience related to this role.

You will ensure accuracy and completeness of the critical data needed for Material Resource Planning (MRP) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) workflows for the Supply Chain team. You will also manage the overall workflow cross-functionally to ensure that all part master data meets company requirements.
This team member will:
Process Product Master Workflow validation and accuracy checks
Create and Improve data entry workflows to minimize data maintenance requirements.
Ensure timely data input and completeness
Participate in data migration process between databases
Identify and clearly communicate data gaps in MRP and ERP systems
Identify and correct data inconsistencies between databases
Work with data systems personnel to retire technical debt between functional teams
Be the link between Supply Chain, Finance/Accounting, Manufacturing and Design teams for Product and Vendor Master Workflows
The ideal candidate will have most, if not all, of these requirements:
High School/GED Equivalent
Bachelor’s degree in the field of Supply Chain, Engineering, Business, or Finance is a plus
Demonstrable experience with Enterprise Resource Planning Systems
Clear understanding of data that drives Material Resource Planning Systems and how data is related
Strong understanding of ERP and MRP systems
Strong computer skills with MS office or G-Suite applications
Exceptional problem solving skills
Ability to create and improve processes and streamline workflows
Have strong relationship building skills, and the ability to interact and work effectively with many levels of personnel and suppliers
Additional experience and/or qualifications:
Start-up or high growth environment
Experience with resource allocation
Perform activities such as typing, standing, and sitting, for extended periods of time
Dedication to safety to mitigate hazards that may include heat, cold, noise, fumes, strong magnets, lead, high voltage, and cryogenics
Willingness to occasionally travel or work required nights/weekends/on-call
#LI-Onsite
CFS team members thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and have demonstrated exceptional results through a range of different pursuits. We all tightly align with our company values of integrity, execution, impact and self-critique. As we grow, we are looking to add talented people who are mission driven and bring diverse perspectives and new ways of solving problems.

Job Title: Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience
Job Description:
314 Main Street (21020), United States of America, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience

Capital One is a high-tech company, a scientific laboratory, and a nationally recognized brand all in one reaching tens of millions of consumers. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers.

Machine learning is at the heart of our approach. Our teams provide millions of customers with individualized, real-time experiences, protection, and decisions driven by machine learning and advanced analytic capabilities. In order to further scale our efforts in this space, we are building a world class machine learning platform. This platform will enable our data scientists and machine learning engineers to take models from conception to production faster and safer than ever before. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Manager, Product Manager on the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) Product team, you will be part of the Enterprise Model Platform (EMP) team to define, design, and deliver model and data monitoring tooling and corresponding user experiences for Capital One’s model developer and data science community. This team is focused on building centralized, managed capabilities that standardize monitoring for model inputs and outputs.

We are looking for someone with industry-leading machine learning skill sets and product acumen to improve the model monitoring experience for Capital One model developers and data scientists. This role represents the needs of the customer to inform our product roadmap, ensuring we deliver tools aligned with the intended business outcomes. You will be responsible for building the roadmap, determining product requirements, and partnering with tech teams to deliver machine learning tools. The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology and deeply empathizes with customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and communicate the product vision and strategy for key components of the platform.

Deeply understand the needs of model developers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers across Capital One.

Prioritize the Product Backlog to maximize business and customer outcomes.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Maintain a healthy backlog of work and play a critical role in many agile ceremonies.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


We want you if you are:

Passionate about building impactful products.

You enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

You have expertise in, or are excited about, machine learning model development, data science, and ML Ops

You are a learner who is able to quickly get up to speed in a highly technical environment.

You are experienced working in an Agile environment.

You are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

You have excellent oral and written communication skills.

You are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of experience in product management or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

3+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Title: Associate Manager, Global Market Analytics & Insights
Job Description:
Workplace Flexibility: Field

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.


Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.

Our Purpose is to make people’s lives healthier, safer, and more fulfilling.


Our Core Values are reflected in all we do: Integrity – Empathy – Agility – Unity – Long-Term View


We deliver on our purpose and our core values by staying True to Life.

Job Description

The Associate Manager, Global Market Analytics & Insights will reside within the Global Market Analytics & Center of Excellence function, part of the overall Global Market Intelligence & Customer Insights & Analytics (GMCI&A) team. The candidate will collaborate with stakeholders both within GMCI&A and across Olympus businesses to define data and analytical needs, establish standardized process and plan, and provide analytics and actionable insights to support Therapeutic Solution Division (TSD), Endoscopic Solution Division (ESD), regional and Corporate functions. This position is highly visible to different levels of management. The candidate should possess strong expertise in data analysis including advanced level of analytical techniques, with the ability to not only synthesize complex data but also articulate critical analysis and actionable insights to help stakeholders to answer the most challenging business questions. It is expected that this role will develop strategic partnership with leaders within GMCI&A and across the entire enterprise including Business Units, Marketing, Business Development, Sales, Health Economics, Finance, and other areas. The candidate will also be a self-starter and comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced matrix working environment.

Job Duties
Engage with GMCI&A team leaders and global business stakeholders to identify strategic needs where data and analytics can drive business value and transform business problems into analytical solutions.
Lead the development and implementation of analytical projects to support both GMCI&A and cross functional strategic initiatives and business goals.
Develop global market models, conduct analysis on market drivers and mix, and carry out benchmarking, forecasting, and other business analysis.
Develop assessments and analytical insights on global market and competitive landscape, social and economic trends, provider trends, global and regional dynamics.
Support IR, business planning, business development, marketing and other strategic initiatives with market sizing development, opportunity identification, and market and competitive assessments.
Conduct analytics on customer segmentation, journey mapping, value proposition, persona to support product and marketing initiatives.
Carry out economic research and financial analysis on cost, revenue, margin, value and outcomes.
Translate data and analytics into actionable insights and effectively communicate key findings and strategic recommendations to different levels of stakeholders globally.
Partner with data analyst, Health Economics, Finance, IT and other resources to support integrated global data initiatives including needs identification, database development, standardization, governance, and management.
Collaborate with data analysts and other analytical resources on the team to standardize analytical models, KPIs, metrics, and foundational and strategic analytical reporting.
Oversee the development and implementation of dashboard, self-service reporting, and portal to support both GMCI&A and business stakeholders.
Lead the definition and implementation of standard processes and advanced analytical and visualization tools including automation and optimization.
Build strategic partnerships across global Olympus business units and functions with the Global Market, Competitive & Customer Intelligence (MCCI) team in GMCI&A to uncover synergies, drive efficiencies, and standardize best practices.
Performs all other duties as assigned.
Job Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in data science, analytics, mathematics, engineering, finance, economics, or related disciplines; Advanced degree a plus.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis, business intelligence, market/customer intelligence, consulting, strategy, or equivalent area; preferably in the healthcare, medical device, or life sciences
Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in advanced analytics including working knowledge on SQL, Python or R, statistical analysis, and data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Minimum of 2 years project management experience in leading analytical projects across multiple teams
Advanced Excel and financial analysis skills
Primary market research experience preferred.
Travel <10% (domestic and international).

Our Medical business uses innovative capabilities in medical technology, therapeutic intervention, and precision manufacturing to help healthcare professionals deliver diagnostic, therapeutic, and minimally invasive procedures to improve clinical outcomes, reduce costs, and enhance the quality of life for patients and their safety.


Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, Olympus employs more than 31,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries and regions. Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

Work Shift:

Day (United States of America)

The Senior Operations Improvement Analyst preforms duties related to utilization, interpretation and analytics of data from a variety of systems in support of the Chief Value Officer, dedicated to high-priority initiatives at the system, hospital and practice levels. This role is responsible for supporting and initiating analyses of small to large-scale projects, or work streams, focused on enhancing performance across multiple domains and departments. This entails providing accurate reporting and reports creation in guidance to leadership, providers and Clinic colleagues regarding the utilization of healthcare clinical and financial resources and supporting education to end users on utilization and development of implementation action plans and tracking plan progress. This position supports interdisciplinary teams in a variety of settings and will be expected to assist in measuring, reporting and driving quantifiable, sustainable improvement. In collaboration with IT colleagues, the position is responsible for maintaining data integrity, providing quality oversight for external reporting and insuring LHMC is making effective use of the tools and technology to support analytics.

Job Description:

Essential Duties & Responsibilities including but not limited to:

1) Prepares, maintains and monitors activities in support of the various designed project work streams.


2) Develops, maintains and publishes monthly reports as appropriate and defined to include key statistical indicators, budgets, actuals, and ratios. The report will be concise and serve an audience, which includes executive and senior leadership.


3) Performs data analysis and design ad hoc reporting, as requested by the Chief Value Officer and other members of executive and senior leadership and providers.


4) Working with the Chief Value Officer, develops reports to meet the informational needs of providers. These will include, but are not limited to executive summaries, exception reporting and trend analysis.


5) Provides routine reporting in support of financial statement preparation and statistical indicators.


6) Records budget activities organizes financial data related to research finances and implements or supports automation of reports that monitor, track and project financial research activity.

7) Assists in writing quarterly reports as necessary.


8) Audits database integrity. Reviewing field values, unit cost calculations, accuracy of medical record data contained within the system and reconciling the system to the monthly financial statements.


9) Interviews, selects, orients, trains and supervises assigns personnel.

10) Provides research and communication of recommended corrective action related to system integrity.


11) Reviews all performance information on a timely basis for accuracy. Reviews all performance information for significant variances and inform management in a timely manner.


12) Provides supervision of department analysts in the absence of the department manager.


13) Provides training, personal and telephone support as a high level end user to all internal and external colleagues related to the utilization of produced data, information and reports.


14) Assists in the presentation of information to providers and managers.


15) Functions as a resource to the users of the information provided in explaining its meaning, its derivation and obtaining further information.


16) Coordinates and perform system testing related to the application of new version releases.


17) Prepares ad hoc reports as needed. Attends meetings as a department representative as requested by operational management and as a representative for the department manager if necessary.


18) Participates on continuous quality improvement committees as a department representative as requested. Manages several projects and resources concurrently, understanding key milestones, dependencies and prioritization.


19) Assists in the production of monthly, quarterly and annual statistical reporting to financial, operational and clinical leadership as required. Assists in the preparation of annual operating budgets as required.


20) Completes special projects as assigned in an accurate and timely fashion, as required. Maintains the confidentiality information.


21) Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

1) Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent education and experience.

2) Usage of personal computers, effective demonstration of verbal and written communication.


3) Minimum of 3 years of healthcare accounting, analytics, finance or operations.

FLSA Status:

Exempt

Title: Business Analyst/ Cloud BA (Locals Only)

Location: Quincy, MA (Hybrid)

Duration: 12+ Months Contract

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The client seeks a Senior Business Analyst (BA) to support our Cloud Migration initiative. Responsibilities will include gap analysis, gathering and documenting business requirements, and systems documentation through the project life cycle, including discovery, design, development, testing, and implementation of projects and any enhancements to meet the project objectives. The BA should be well-versed in the systems development lifecycle and testing cycles. Previous Cloud Migration experience desired.

Preference will be given to candidates with Medicaid systems, testing, and prior government experience. The BA must have sufficient knowledge of working in an Information Technology (IT) environment. Ensure the entire scope of work aligns with standard operational procedures and standard practices. The BA primary responsibility is to support the Cloud PM to oversee delegated areas of responsibility, project vetting of documentation, validation of implemented coding through self-testing or coordination with testing team meets the requirements and conforms to all applicable Federal and state laws.

DETAILED LIST OF JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Lead Cloud migration activities to support design, documentation, and validation.

•Lead and participate in joint application discovery, design, test sessions with stakeholders.

•Conduct and document data analysis and query, as well as gap analysis. Develop test strategies, test scenarios and test cases based on written requirements.

•Execute and review test runs and sign off on testing components.

•Document business, functional and systems requirements and participate in their development and testing.

•Provide oversight role, as required, during the stabilization phase of each migration including monitoring of system change execution, the development of system “fix” strategies and the close monitoring of the implementation of those strategies.

•Communicate updates and changes to impacted stakeholders and project teams.

•Collaborate with technical and vendor teams to capture, track and vet requirements and create traceability from requirements to implementation.

•Collaborate, where required, to capture and change activities.

•Provide back up to support PM where required.

•Other responsibilities as required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, IT or Healthcare administration with minimum 3 years’ experience, or equivalent in healthcare administration setting
Strong business/systems analysis ability and problem-solving skills
Strong data analysis skills
Excellent communication skills; written and verbal; as well as presentation skills.
Great follow through skills
Can work independently and as a team player.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $60.00 per hour

Experience level:

7 years

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Quincy, MA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

Cloud migration: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

We’re saving lives, building careers, and reimagining healthcare. We can’t wait to grow alongside you.


Job Profile Summary

This role focuses on the design, development, and implementation of information technology (IT) solutions in order to meet the organization's needs through new and existing applications, systems architecture, network systems and applications infrastructure and the management of the IT infrastructure. In addition, this role focuses on performing the following Client Applications Support duties: Designs, develops, implements, and updates internal IT applications in accordance with specifications and business needs., designs, codes, tests, and debugs computer programs, and prepares systems documentation and training. A professional individual contributor role that may direct the work of other lower level professionals or manage processes and programs. The majority of time is spent overseeing the design, implementation or delivery of processes, programs and policies using specialized knowledge and skills typically acquired through advanced education. A senior level role that requires advanced knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education and work experience. Typically responsible for: managing projects / processes, working independently with limited supervision, coaching and reviewing the work of lower level professionals, resolving difficult and sometimes complex problems.


Job Overview

This position supports the design, build, testing, implementation, education, and daily maintenance/use of client applications as well as, other third-party vendor solutions that are more complex, more technical, and/or more critical to Tufts Medicine operations. This position requires regular engagement with teams, departments, and key stakeholders to gain context and an understanding of pertinent business processes and workflows. This role provides guidance to less experienced team members and assists them with resoling issues or problem-solving assistance using critical thinking, experience, knowledge, or understanding.


Job Description

Minimum Qualifications:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field.

2. One or more of the following certifications :

Certified by Epic in: Cogito Fundamentals and Revenue Data Model
Certified by Epic in: Cogito Fundamentals and Caboodle Data Model
Certified by Epic in: Cogito Fundamentals and Clarity Data Mode

3. Proficiency with SQL and relational database concepts

4. Four (4) years of healthcare business analyst/IT experience.


Preferred Qualifications:

1. Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field.

2. Six (6) years of healthcare business analyst/IT experience.

3. Experience with software development and software testing/QA.


Duties and Responsibilities: The duties and responsibilities listed below are intended to describe the general nature of work and are not intended to be an all-inclusive list. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.


1. Create content to display Epic data from Chronicles, Clarity, and Caboodle

2. Write SQL and configure Radar settings for custom SQL metrics

3. Modify existing reports as necessary

4. Distribute analytics content to data consumers

5. Review peer reports for validity

6. Work with subject matter experts to understand the needs of data consumers

7. Serves as an experienced business specialist and technology generalist responsible for aligning technology solutions with business needs per the strategic direction set forth by leadership and key stakeholders.

8. Develops detailed understanding of application functionality by attending training and/or reading documentation.

9. Serves as an intermediary between internal groups and third-party solutions or vendors to ensure the integrity and optimization of the technical build or solution is optimal.

10. Determines best approaches to tailoring system to meet individual requirements.

11. Creates documentation of custom builds as appropriate.

12. Provides both local service area team support as well as, direct user support by correlating user needs with process design and improvement.

13. Develops test scenarios based on requirements. Executes testing and identify issues. Researches and resolves issues.

14. Provides input to LIVE plans. Provide support during LIVE events, including occasional off-hours support.

15. Builds enhancements to current functionality using application tools.

16. Develops and maintains standard technical and operational documentation for all implemented efforts to support sustainability and end-user education/ experience/ results.

17. Supports small and medium sized projects.

18. Actively seeks on-going education and understanding of current/ available system functionality, benefits, and implementation requirements to ensure competence as a subject matter expert (“SME”) in areas of assigned focus.

19. Engages continuously with operational teams to gain context and an understanding of pertinent business processes and workflows.

20. Promotes and champions a technology enabled, data-driven operations across the health system; aims to establish formal measures of performance for all initiatives, implemented workflow, and as determine fitting to quantify other efforts/ output.

21. As assigned, conducts research and analyses sufficient to vet the application of technologies with potential to enhance business processes/ performance. Presents findings aligned with measurable optimization to leaders/ applicable decision makers for consideration.

22. Seeks technical and professional guidance from experienced team members to promote strong team dynamics and ensure the quality of the work output.

23. Promotes a culture of continuous learning and knowledge share across the team, workgroup, department, and other key stakeholder groups.

24. Collaborates with others to support the continuous alignment of systems, process, analytics, and education to promote technical adoption and utilization.

25. Collaborates with teammates to support the monitoring, and adjustment of work plans through successful completion.


Physical Requirements:

1. Mental requirements will be intense at times with involvement in many concurrent multi-faceted projects.

2. Requires manual dexterity using fine hand manipulation to operate a computer keyboard or related equipment.

3. Requires ability to see computer screen, monitoring equipment and reports.


Skills & Abilities:

1. Ability to use Microsoft Office Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio.

2. Ability to gain additional competence using Microsoft Access, Project Management software.

3. Strong technical, analytical, problem-solving, project management skills.

4. Knowledge of organization and project management methodologies.

5. Ability to influence others to prioritize and complete tasks, through completion by established deliverable dates.

6. Ability and willingness to learn new technical applications and information quickly and utilize application tools and information to meet end-user/ operational requirement.

7. High degree of professionalism and integrity is required.

8. Effective team player.

9. Strong written and verbal communication with excellent customer service orientation.

10. Ability to understand and explain complex, technical information to a non-technical user.

11. Ability to be agile and navigate through uncertainty; support team members ability to do the same.

12. Ability to interpret data and identify meaningful patterns.

13. Ability to be resourceful in gathering pertinent information to inform decision-making.

14. Ability to manage and balance multiple priorities simultaneously. Organize work effectively; seek timely guidance as requires in order to complete all assigned work by established deliverable date.




Tufts Medicine is a leading integrated health system bringing together the best of academic and community healthcare to deliver exceptional, connected and accessible care experiences to consumers across Massachusetts. Comprised of Tufts Medical Center, Lowell General Hospital, MelroseWakefield Hospital, Lawrence Memorial Hospital of Medford, Care at Home - an expansive home care network, and large integrated physician network. Job Title: Chief Operating Officer, Latin America and US Offshore
Job Description:
Overview:
Reporting to the region’s Business Development Unit (BDU) Head, the Chief Operating Officer will have overall strategic and operational responsibility for all aspects of the business aside from direct sales management. The BDU’s chief operating officer will provide leadership to the region’s strategy planning processes and will implement new initiatives. In addition, the COO will provide coordination for the BDU’s senior management team and serve as International liaison to business partners in Natixis Investment Manager's US Distribution organization, working to keep them informed of business strategies, progress, and challenges. This position is located in our Boston, MA office.

The COO will partner with and support the BDU Head in all aspects of strategic plan development and operational management for the region, including marketplace research and analysis and new market/channel plan development, business partnership strategy, budgeting and financial analysis, product planning, team recruiting and staffing, marketing/advertising, and legal & compliance infrastructure. A key aspect of the role will be to drive the coordination of functional teams in NIM’s US and International organizations to reconcile the BDU’s operational requirements across multiple jurisdictions including the US. The COO will manage a team of operations managers dedicated to sales support, client service, business analysis, and operational functions.


What you will do:
Strategic Development

Develop the region’s strategy and business plan, taking into account marketplace dynamics, competitor profiles and regulatory environment impacts while ensuring alignment with NIM’s corporate strategic vision and priorities
Assess the viability of potential strategic partnerships, through local market due diligence, plan development, and target profile definition in collaboration with NIM Corporate Strategy
Own the implementation of strategic business development initiatives, leading globally diverse project support teams to achieve deliverables against target timelines
Develop and implement a system for tracking and reporting on the progress of the strategic plan implementations
Operational Leadership

Provide effective and inspiring leadership by being actively involved in marketplaces and business functions, developing a broad and deep knowledge of the business.
Conceptualize operational frameworks and business infrastructures to support businesses across the region, emphasizing operational efficiency to reconcile sophisticated regulatory and commercial requirements in the US and Latin American countries
Establish productive relationships with support functions across NIM’s international and US organizations. Provide cross-organizational leadership and drive the successful collaboration among global teams to achieve BDU goals
Client Service Operations

Lead all operational aspects of client support, including distribution agreements, trailer fee payments, and client onboarding operations
Monitor and address with internal teams servicing issues that may put BDU client relationships at risk
Finance & Business Analysis

Lead all aspects of the preparation and analysis of the BDU’s sales and departmental budgets & forecasts. Monitor and manage effectively within budgets
Ensure the financial viability and profitable growth of the BDU through sound business analysis and fiscal management
Marketing & Advertising

Lead development of the business’ marketing communications and advertising strategy including creative content generation
Monitor agency performance, contractual obligations, and placement analytics

Oversee event strategy, cross-functional support, and expense management
Product

Oversee the BDU’s product suite maintenance and development; championing the needs with affiliates and with internal investment and product approval committees
Ensure product marketing collateral and reporting documentation is in good order and is in compliance with regulatory requirements in all regional jurisdictions
Business Infrastructure

Oversee and handle operational & administrative matters across the region including resourcing, IT infrastructure, office space, website development, etc.
Ensure appropriate documentation and team compliance with business continuity plans.
Partner with legal and compliance staff across jurisdictions to problem-solve regulatory challenges that impact business infrastructure and staffing models
Staffing and Professional Development

Recruit, coach, develop and retain a diverse business operations staff
Plan and implement professional development training programs. Maintain relationships with executive training consultants, and formulate BDU team training goals and programs.
Organize offsites and workshops to build and enhance the team's strategic planning capacity

What you will bring:
The COO role requires an individual with extensive and diverse experience in asset management distribution who can balance high-level strategic thinking with a nimble grasp of diverse operational detail. The COO partners with the BDU Head and works collaboratively with a high-performance business team.

Minimum BS/BA degree with at least 15 years of experience in the asset management industry. Experience should be with a leading global asset manager distributing through multiple international business channels.
Excellence in organizational management within a global context and the ability to influence
Track record of effectively leading sophisticated project implementations with globally diverse teams, using strengths across varied functional areas
Analytic and decisive decision maker; able to synthesize, prioritize and communicate concisely the key objectives and tactics vital to achieving organizational goals
Experience in budgeting, fiscal management and business analysis
Strong written and verbal communication skills; a persuasive and passionate communicator
Willing to take action, entrepreneurial, flexible, with an innovative approach to operational management
Passion, integrity, positive attitude, mission-driven, and self-directed
Fluency in Spanish a plus

Who we are:
At Natixis Investment Managers, we partner with clients to understand their unique investment objectives. We offer them a single point of access to a wide range of investment strategies that are diversified by asset class, investment style and approach. We complement this by designing, developing, and executing multi-asset solutions to meet their specific portfolio requirements and achieve their desired outcomes.

We offer a robust benefits package designed to integrate life and work and to support our employees and their families. Benefits include, but are not limited to; comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance, paid time off, 401k plan, tuition reimbursement, student loan repayment program, commuter and wellness benefits and volunteer programs*.

Benefits eligibility is for permanent employees of Natixis Investment Managers. Interns, contractors and temporary workers are not eligible for benefits.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Private Operations - Liberty Mutual Investments
Job Description:
Pay Philosophy

The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.


Description

Job Summary:


Liberty Mutual Investments (LMI) is a seeking a Senior Analyst to join its Investment Operations team supporting LMI’s private assets. The Private Operations team supports various alternative investment products including but not limited to Private Equity/Real Estate LPs, Private Credit, Co-Investments, and Natural Resources. The Senior Analyst will work with the Director and Process Lead of the Investment Accounting function and is responsible for supporting team deliverables/mandates. The Senior Analyst will have ownership and provide support for existing private investment strategies to ensure timely/accurate processing of all investor level transactions and valuations that inform LMI’s performance as well as financial reporting. The individual hired will be expected to foster an environment of continuous improvement and participate in initiatives that enhance operational efficiency and control.


Job Responsibilities:

Process and review of capital contributions, distributions, and valuation requests from General Partners and counterparties, ensuring the proper accounting treatment of each transaction.
Oversee maintenance and controls of financial systems and provide input to help continuously improve operational procedures.
Prepare and review complex standard and ad hoc reports (monthly, quarterly, and annual book close, which includes account reconciliations and control checks) utilizing a broad knowledge of accounting principles. Presents findings and recommendations to management.
Participate in projects of moderate to high scope and complexity. Communicate project opportunities and constraints to management while monitoring project status. May also actively participate in cross-functional strategic initiatives of moderate to complex scope.
Review work, serve as a technical resource, and provide feedback, training and guidance to other Analysts and business partners.
Collaborates cross functionally to enhance upstream/downstream workflows that impact Investment Operations and various stakeholders (Financial Reporting, Performance, Transaction Services, Treasury etc.)
Able to identify risk and ensures appropriate escalation of issues and engagement of stakeholders to ensure timely resolution.
Adhere to all Operational policies and practices, in addition to established processing controls and procedures.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, business or related field is required.
Requires a minimum of 5-7 years of relevant work experience in Investment Operations or Fund Accounting.
Strong working knowledge across alternative investment strategies specifically related to Private Equity, Real Estate, and Private credit.
Strong business attitude, including written/verbal communication and time management skills.
Proven ability to multi-task across projects/requests, work well under time demands, and drive deadlines.
Proficient with Microsoft Office, especially excel, and propensity to quickly learn new applications, processes, and areas of business.
Detail-oriented, with strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively independently and within a team.
Familiarity with eFront and/or SimCorp Dimension is preferred but not required.
Ability to work with management and key stakeholders in various SBU’s/ departments.
About Us

**This position may have in-office requirements depending on candidate location.**


At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession. We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more, please visit https://www.libertymutualgroup.com/about-lm/careers/benefits


Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG’s Insider Pro and Computerworld’s 2020 list. We have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion


Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law

About Finch

Finch Therapeutics is a clinical-stage microbiome therapeutics company leveraging its Human-First Discovery® platform to develop a novel class of orally administered biological drugs. With the capabilities to develop both complete and targeted microbiome therapeutics, Finch has a rich pipeline of candidates designed to address a wide range of unmet medical needs. Finch’s lead candidate, CP101, is in late-stage clinical development for the prevention of recurrent C. difficile infection and has received Breakthrough Therapy and Fast Track designations from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration. Finch’s pipeline also includes FIN-211 for children with autism spectrum disorder and significant gastrointestinal symptoms, FIN-524 for the treatment of ulcerative colitis, and FIN-525 for the treatment of Crohn’s disease.




Position Summary

As a member of the IT team at Finch Therapeutics, you will partner with the organization and be a key contributor in a variety of IT projects with a focus on delivering new GxP applications and systems. This is an opportunity to provide support and leadership on key strategic business initiatives at a time of growth.


Responsibilities

Participate in cross-functional teams to plan, design, and implement new GxP systems, acting as a business partner and sometimes as a leader or project manager.
May contribute to implementation of G&A systems (accounting, procure-to-pay, HR, etc.)
Work with stakeholders to ensure that the stakeholder needs are accurately captured and clear to create a best fit solution.
Define data flow and business process diagrams and research the potential use of existing tools.
Responsible for deliverables per the system development life cycle such as business requirements, traceability matrices, etc.
Interface effectively with system business owners, Quality and associated vendors.
Engage appropriate SMEs, as needed, to drive resolution to incidents and problems.
Resolve GxP computer system issues in coordination with Quality and business users.
Make recommendations to improve and optimize existing GxP systems.
Act as SME to process within SDLC process.
System administrator for user account management & security for GxP systems.



Qualifications

5+ years of experience in the life sciences industry and working knowledge of FDA and/or EU regulated environments. Other industry compliances may be a possible substitute for this qualification
Experience with Biotech functions (Manufacturing, Quality, etc.) preferred
Experience with G&A functions (accounting, procure-to-pay, HR, etc.) is useful
Well-developed business partnering & collaboration skills, adept at establishing & sustaining effective working relationships, both within & between departments
Strong Business Analyst ability to document business processes and use cases
Experience with cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) delivery models
Experience with Change Control, incident response and release management
Previous experience working with Quality stakeholders to validate GxP solutions for intended use
Ability to explain technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to work creatively and analytically to solve business problems
Comfortable under high-stress and exhibits poise and focus
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Skilled in project management and general troubleshooting



More About Finch

Here at Finch, we are determined to create the best work environment and experience for you through our formal benefits programs and fringe perks. Together, we hope it is a fun & supportive environment in and out of the workplace as we strive to develop a new class of therapeutics together.

Our formal benefits include medical, dental, and vision coverage through Harvard Pilgrim Healthcare in addition to life insurance and long-term & short-term disability policies. We offer discretionary and flexible paid time off policies. Should you choose to start or grow your family while working at Finch, we aspire to lead our peers by offering several months of paid parental leave. We also offer a generous 401(k) contribution to help teammates save for life beyond Finch, as well as other savings and investment opportunities.
We also try to keep the workplace an inspiring and motivating place to work with our fringe perks. Our facilities in Somerville, MA include an in-office gym with a shower and towel service (temporarily closed due to COVID), fully stocked kitchen with free snacks, iced coffee & flavored/sparkling waters on tap. We sponsor ride-sharing to and from the office from preset locations around Boston, Cambridge, and Somerville. We are always evaluating our fringe perks and hope to grow them alongside our team.



Equal Opportunity Employer

We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire or promote, will be based on aptitude, performance, and business need. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Finch will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

Overview:

Whether you’re looking for a high-energy, inclusive atmosphere and a company that understands the importance of work/life balance, Commonwealth is your match! From generous bonus and 401(k) programs to tuition reimbursement and flexible work schedules, Commonwealth is focused on helping its employees thrive in an environment suited to their needs. On top of all that, the Information Security department offers a hybrid work schedule, so you’ll be able to work from home for part of the week!


We’re looking for a security operations analyst III to join our ranks. In this role, you’ll be a key leader within our Information Security Operations (SOC) team, driving the enhancement of operational capabilities and delivering outstanding defense for Commonwealth’s infrastructure and users. Your responsibilities will extend beyond monitoring and response to encompass the realms of detection engineering, trend analysis, and serving as an escalation resource for the SOC team.




This role is ideal for those seeking a challenge in a growing business, providing indispensable services to our user communities and being part of its success. The ideal candidate will be proactive, analytical, and have a deep understanding of the cybersecurity landscape.


Key Responsibilities

Leverage your specialized skillset in either malware analysis, forensics, or threat hunting to contribute unique insights and capabilities to the team.
Develop and implement sophisticated detection and analytic rules, staying ahead of emerging security threats.
Utilize your analytical acumen to identify trends, patterns, and potential risks, and translate these insights into actionable recommendations.
Act as an incident owner, alongside the SOC incident manager as well as the user, to see incidents through the incident response lifecycle to ensure swift mitigation and recovery.
Drive the refinement of SOC standard operating procedures, analytic rules, playbooks, and other commonly consumed SOC resources.
Collaborate with the SOC team members to design and implement security automation workflows.
Provide mentorship to junior analysts, offer hands-on training, and guide them through complex security challenges, fostering their growth and expertise.
Act as a trusted advisor to internal teams, offering guidance and security requirements to ensure secure project execution and regulatory compliance.
Maintain meticulous documentation of incidents, analysis findings, and lessons learned. Provide relevant dashboards and metrics for continuous improvement.

Core Strengths and Skills

Bachelor’s degree in information systems, information security, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in security operations or security incident response
Profound understanding of common attack vectors, vulnerabilities, and effective mitigation strategies
Expertise in Azure public cloud services and associated security best practices
Proficiency with EDR/IDS/IPS solutions, such as SentinelOne and Microsoft Defender
Adeptness in working with Azure Sentinel and operationalizing Azure security solutions
Experience aligning defensive security capabilities with MITRE ATT&CK framework
Experience monitoring and enhancing detection capabilities in hybrid network architectures and complex topologies
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, coupled with a keen attention to detail and a proactive mindset

Additional Desirable Skills and Knowledge

Relevant certifications such as GCIH, GCIA, GCFA, GREM, OSCP, which underscore your expertise
Proficiency in scripting languages like Python, Bash, and PowerShell
Familiarity with common information security management frameworks, including NIST and CIS
Understanding of best practices, control frameworks, and applicable legal/regulatory requirements (e.g., SEC S-P Rule, FINRA recommendations, data privacy laws, ISO 27001, NIST CSF and SP 800-53, CIS, CSA CCM, PCI DSS)
Have we piqued your curiosity? Can you see yourself thriving in this opportunity? Let’s introduce ourselves.

Picture Yourself Here
At Commonwealth, we believe in a better world. We hold ourselves and each other to higher standards. We take care of one another. That’s why we invest in you—we encourage employee growth both in your career and education; we are building out a robust diversity, equity, and inclusion program; we offer incredible health care benefits; and we find plenty of occasions to celebrate. What’s not to love?

We are always striving to be better, and we are looking for employees who share that same mindset. Better people, better coworkers, better leaders, better creators. Bring your best work and your full self to the table, and we will do the same. Together, we can build a better future for our advisors, their clients, our company, and you.

About Commonwealth
Commonwealth Financial Network, Member FINRA/SIPC, a Registered Investment Adviser, provides a suite of business solutions that empowers more than 2,000 independent financial advisors nationwide. Privately held since 1979, the firm has headquarters in Waltham, Massachusetts, and San Diego, California.

Turning our advisors into raving fans starts by doing the same for our employees. We foster an environment of excellence, growth, rewards, and fun in equal measure, which has earned us 43 Best Place to Work awards.

The Fine Print
We care about your online safety as a prospective employee and encourage you to exercise caution when responding to job postings online. Commonwealth will never ask potential hiring candidates to pay or transfer funds as a precondition of interviews or employment, nor will we authorize recruiters or agents to do so on our behalf.

Commonwealth is an equal opportunity employer, making intentional efforts to source talent from all backgrounds.

Job Title: ERP Business Analyst – Contract Role, Remote
Job Description:
ERP Business Analyst Contract Role


United States
Remote
US Citizen or Permanent Resident
6-12 month Contract Assignment
Precision Talent Group is hiring an ERP Business Analyst to work as a contract employee. In this role, you will be working remotely from the United States, supporting a prestigious client for a large-scale ERP implementation project.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather and document business requirements, analyze existing processes, and identify areas for improvement. Translate business needs into clear and actionable requirements.
ERP implementation support: Act as a subject matter expert in enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, providing expertise and guidance throughout the implementation process. Assist in system configuration, testing, and deployment activities.
Data analysis and reporting: Analyze complex datasets, perform data mapping, and develop meaningful insights to support decision-making processes. Create and deliver comprehensive reports, presentations, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.
Change management: Support organizational change initiatives by facilitating communication, training, and user adoption activities. Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure smooth transition and successful implementation of new processes and systems.
Project coordination: Assist in project planning, scheduling, and monitoring activities. Track project milestones, deliverables, and dependencies to ensure timely completion and adherence to project scope.
Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in ERP implementation projects or related fields. Strong understanding of business analysis methodologies and best practices.
ERP expertise: In-depth knowledge of enterprise resource planning systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics) and their implementation lifecycle. Experience in configuring and customizing ERP modules is highly desirable.
Analytical skills: Demonstrated ability to analyze complex business problems, data sets, and processes to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities. Proficient in using data analysis tools and techniques.
Communication and collaboration: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Bachelor's degree: A bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred. Relevant certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMP) are a plus.
Join Precision Talent Group and make a significant impact on our client's ERP implementation project as a Senior Business Analyst. This contract position offers the flexibility of remote work, enabling you to contribute your expertise from anywhere in the United States. Apply now and be part of our dedicated team of professionals working on cutting-edge projects in the consulting industry. W2 Contract positions include immediate benefits and 401k opportunities.

Please note that this is a contract position with an estimated duration of 6-12 months.

Who we Are:
Incapsulate provides services from ideation to implementation. We are a team of developers, designers, and analysts who are committed to helping businesses solve problems using state-of-the-art technology. We believe that the best results are achieved by people who are passionate about what they do and continually strive to be better - those are the people we hire.

Who We Are Looking For:
Incapsulate is searching for a Sr. Business Systems Analyst to join our team. You would be part of a highly skilled group of passionate individuals working on a variety of interesting and challenging projects.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
