Conduct client demos, presentations and assist in business development initiatives.
Advise customers on the solutions that solve business problems and its successful adoption.
Develop reusable templates and processes that ensure delivery excellence.
Facilitate user workshop sessions, engage in conversations with technical and QA teams that ensure systems meet business needs.
Ensure developed solutions meet business needs.
Ensure client satisfaction.

Qualifications:

Minimum 8 years of experience with Business Systems Analysis and requirements gathering experience.
Excellent knowledge of requirements gathering techniques and ability to run client workshops.
5+ years experience working on SaaS related development projects.
4+ years working within all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle and an Agile driven development environment.
Minimum 3 years experience with the Salesforce platform configuring sales, service, community clouds, and custom Salesforce apps. Certifications are highly desired.
Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements to solutions and the ability to work with technical teams to deliver these solutions.
Excellent Interpersonal, listening, oral and written communication skills.
Excellent analytical skills, as well as accuracy and attention to details.
Experience in JIRA, Confluence, any project management tool: MS project, Smartsheet, etc.
Project Management experience is a plus.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar.
MBA preferred

This is a great opportunity for an individual who is looking for a fast paced, challenging environment, where one will experience something new each day. - We offer continued growth within the company and a collaborative environment where you can share your ideas with other like-minded and passionate people.
Flexible working environment.
Very strong compensation package.
We understand that this is a two-way relationship and as much as you must be a good fit for us; we also must be a good fit for you.

Job Title: Wealth Management Business and Systems Analyst
Job Description:
Summary: SEI Systems Expert!

Partners with Wealth Management team to enhance process improvements and leverage utilization of technologies. Evaluates new processes, procedures, systems, and vendors, makes recommendations, and facilitates implementations. Gains insights via data analysis to guide Wealth Management initiatives to improve performance of client-facing and back-office operations. Understands and supports processes that allow data to flow between Wealth systems. Provides consultative project management and implementation support for all Wealth Management technology systems.

Responsibilities:

Acts as liaison between Wealth Management business line and system vendors. Manages resolution of complicated processing problems, troubleshooting issues and escalation with vendor and internal management.
Ability to build reports using the platform and support the business line with all reports as needed.
Tracks outstanding issues, and escalates, as appropriate.
Analyzes impacts of vendor released software upgrades. Facilitates implementation of new feature/functionality that improves service, process, or product.
Works with vendor to develop in-depth training plans and procedural documentation to support implementation of new system releases, enhancements, or modifications. Documents all development according to Bank's standard policies and procedures.
Formulates proposals for new or enhanced systems and information needs by analyzing existing systems and procedures and defining technical and procedural improvements. Defines and documents functional requirements and specifications with Wealth Management staff and other business lines.
Become a subject matter expert in terms of where data resides within the various wealth management systems and how information flows between different systems.
Develop and execute on approaches to improve data integrity and data quality across wealth management systems.
Participates in vendor user groups with intention of influencing vendor product and process direction and to develop network of similar vendor users.
Develops test plans and performs testing of new enhancements, vendor releases and other modifications to existing systems.
Facilitates completion of corporate Project and Process governance requirements
Keeps abreast of technology in wealth management and strives to improve the digital capabilities

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related discipline
At least 5 years of business/systems analysis experience
At least 2 years of experience with financial information systems, with emphasis on wealth management and/or asset management related systems
SEI experience is an absolute MUST
Knowledge of wealth management, products, and financial applications preferred.
Excellent understanding of data and process workflow
Solid understanding of SQL database structures and management preferred but not required
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Report writing system skills.
Business, managerial, and technical skills to support business needs.
Ability to function independently in collaborative environment.
Ability to generate trust and build alliances with peers

Working Conditions/Physical Demands:

Hybrid work
Normal office environment.
Frequent sitting and standing at a desk.
Heavy keyboard use.

SUMMARY: KAGR is seeking an experienced product & product management leader who is self-driven, resourceful, and has successfully developed a vision and strategy that brought data-oriented products that drive business decisions to life. The Director of Product & Operations will lead the continued definition, execution, and day-to-day operations of our Product & Product Management function. As KAGR grows, coordinating and managing the execution and delivery of our product across our customers is critical to the success of our platform and business. Working with the VP of Product and Technology and cross functionally, this role will drive the KAGR product vision and strategy, translate the product strategy to a roadmap and ensure execution from concept to delivery. As a seasoned Director, possess a proven track record of growing team capabilities. A critical cross-functional role responsible for inspiring the product development team to build the best product, help resolve prioritization conflicts, and create alignment around the KAGR Product Roadmap cross-functionally and at the executive level.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Product Strategy
Ensure KAGR platform continues to be a first-class data and analytics platform in the Sports and Entertainment industry
Partner with sales and executive leadership to ensure that the KAGR platform is aligned with current and future customer needs
Ensure short-term and long-term roadmap align with our customers’ needs
Communicate product strategy across the organization to ensure alignment
Understand competitive landscape through ongoing research and analysis to define KAGR’s strategic differentiation strategy
Product Definition: Data-Informed Strategy and Tactically Implemented
Work with the Head of Product to define and execute product vision to the work being performed
Build and maintain product roadmap
Ensure KAGR’s product seamlessly allows customers to apply data easily to drive their business

Responsible for the on-time delivery of all product workstreams
Own product agile development process collaborating with engineering to effectively deliver the best product

Manage product release cycles and rollouts, partner with engineering and client teams to develop documentation
Collaborate with Enterprise Solutions (client delivery) team to deploy features to customers
Product Operations
Define metrics to measure product adoption across KAGR products leveraging existing and creating new data points to measure customer usage and identify new use cases and opportunities within clients
Ensure standards and compliance are adhered to through documentation standards, definition of new support needs, and identify/develop cross-functional processes needed
Synthesize input/ feedback from customer teams, sales, our vendors’ new offerings, and overall industry ecosystem to support defining product priorities
Maximize full capabilities of existing vendors and partners to drive understanding of new offerings
Help identify key technologies to incorporate into our product as strategy dictates
Collaborate with Internal Operations to define and measure product economics
Collaborate with account leadership to measure impact of KAGR product to clients’ business
Continuously evolve the product management & operations function and capabilities as KAGR grows

At EF World Journeys, we believe that the best way to learn about the world is to experience it, and we strive to help as many people as possible share that experience. EF Go Ahead Tours and EF Ultimate Break are divisions of EF World Journeys, and we make world travel easy. We want to empower travelers of all ages to get out there and experience something new on our guided tours. If you share this passion for opening the world, come work with us!

On the Engineering team you’ll join a group of engineers, product professionals, analysts, and UX/UI designers that build the applications and systems that make travel happen. We power every step of our customer’s journey – the e-commerce experience on the web, the platforms with which personalized itineraries are created, the mobile app that enhances the travel experience, and so much more.

What you’ll do:

As the Director of Business Intelligence Engineering, you handle building and supporting the data systems that power our analytics and applications. In this role you will:

Represent Business Intelligence on the Engineering Leadership team
Work with leadership and your team to represent BI In our Objectives and Key Results (OKRs)
Develop a vision and roadmap for the future of your team
Leverage technologies such as Snowflake, Fivetran, Rivery, Tableau/Power BI and more to deliver a modern data operations platform
Work across engineering teams to advocate data best practices in our digital product development processes
Work across departments such as marketing, sales, finance, and analytics to help enable data driven strategic decisions
Build and support a core set of analytical models to power department analyst workflows
Grow and develop a highly skilled team of BI and Data Engineers

Who you are:

Passionate about team building and collaboration across distinct functions of the business
Strong aptitude and desire to learn modern technologies, give and receive feedback, and grow outside your comfort zone
Willing to travel to up to 3 times per year for team events, sometimes internationally
Looking to grow, evolve, and improve on a fledgling data operations practice
5+ years of related professional work experience in data operations or analytics
3+ years of experience managing a high performing team

What you’ll be doing on the EF World Journeys team:

Your first week you will...

Onboard as an EF employee and World Journeys team member and finish some paperwork
Meet with your manager, the VP of Engineering, and get your accounts setup, meeting invites, and a contact list for relationships you’ll need to build to be successful
Meet with your peers in the director group including our directors of product and director of engineering
Meet your team, explore our systems, and start thinking about how you can contribute

Your first month you will...

Learn about our travel products and the business context of our projects, through trainings, guidance from your manager, and your own exploration
Acquaint yourself with team processes, technical standards, and how we measure success
Have met with key partners across the business in other departments
Begin discussing and shaping your professional development plan with your manager and the development plan for your team

Your first three months you will...

Help define team goals to realize business opportunities, contribute to the strategy for achieving those goals, and own BI projects related to that work
Collaborate across engineering to set up data operations best practices and better integrate those practices into the development process
Begin proving new processes with department stakeholders and setting up a roadmap to review with business leadership
Meet with your manager to reflect on progress and sustain professional development

Why you’ll love working here

Work in our beautiful Cambridge office, hybrid, or remote, where you'll enjoy comprehensive professional development, frequent social programming, and employee-run DEIB Resource Groups and clubs. You can expect:

The opportunity to travel on one of our tours every year with no cost and no impact on your paid vacation.
Four weeks paid vacation, ten paid holidays & two floating holidays.
Robust professional growth opportunities including monthly trainings, workshops, and inspiring talks with global leaders and experts.
25% company match on your 401(k) contribution.
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage, along with life and disability insurance.
Paid international business travel.
Wellness benefits and a yearly fitness reimbursement.
EF program discounts include travel, language schools, childcare, and more.
Dependent care, healthcare, and commuter flexible spending accounts (FSAs).
Discounts at local venues and businesses.

About EF Education First

At EF, we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs, focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics, turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about, we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, experience, and everything else that makes you unique.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://ef.com.

This team identifies the areas with the highest potential long-term impact and creates powerful infrastructure that drives insights, accountability, visibility, and collaboration for the teams we work with to function at their best.

Experience in managing large volumes of data – migration, cleansing and import/export

Can clearly break down problems then contribute to and engage stakeholders in building out relevant documentation.

Analytical – you love to mine data, unlocking key insights that drive strategic decision-making.

Always on offense - Proactive, actionably curious. With clients, we are pushing the tempo, not just taking orders.

Optimistic - Optimistic; fun to work with; let's get it done and not focus on the negative.

Python

JOB #N170701 - PROJECT MANAGER/BUSINESS ANALYST

Location: Boston and Metro West

Job Description:

Spantech is searching for an experienced Project Manager and Business Analyst to join our team to help one of our largest clients manage an IT project to implement payment processing initiatives both digital and non-digital.

If you are a dynamic and diligent project manager with BA skills and enjoy working with customers on site, this could be the right opportunity for you.

Candidate should have a Bachelor’s degree with technical project management experience. PMP certification is preferred but not necessary. Exposure to payment processing technologies and security is a great plus.

Your job will be to work at our customer’s offices in a team environment with both our experienced Staff Consultants and those of our client. You will manage project timelines, delivery, and budgets. You'll be building a career with us as a full-time employee with a full slate of benefits.

Company Overview

Cohere Health is illuminating healthcare for patients, their doctors, and all those who are important in a patient's healthcare experience, both in and out of the doctor's office. Founded in August, 2019, we are obsessed with eliminating wasteful friction patients and doctors experience in areas that have nothing to do with health and treatment, particularly for diagnoses that require expensive procedures or medications. To that end, we build software that is expressly designed to ensure the appropriate plan of care is understood and expeditiously approved, so that patients and doctors can focus on health, rather than payment or administrative hassles.

Opportunity overview

We are seeking a Senior Manager of Business Intelligence to lead the development, maintenance, and expansion of our centralized reporting products, empowering stakeholders to harness insights for data-informed decision-making. In this role, you will oversee a team of BI developers, instilling best practices and standards to support our rapidly growing environment. Reporting to the Senior Director of Business Intelligence, you will join a highly skilled team at Cohere, driven by a shared passion for aiding providers and patients. This position presents an opportunity to make a significant impact on the company, with rapid career growth potential in a high-visibility setting.

What you will do:

Lead and mentor a team of BI analysts and report developers to achieve departmental goals and optimize their performance.
Contribute to the development and execution of the BI strategy, aligning it with company goals and ensuring data and analytics support decision-making.
Oversee creation of standardized reporting warehouses to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security.
Supervise the delivery of external client reports, ensuring they meet quality standards, client expectations, and contractual obligations.
Collaborate with other departments to understand their data needs and provide insights and analytics support.
Monitor and report on the performance of BI solutions, ensuring scalability, responsiveness, and reliability.
Work cross-functionally to design appropriate data use capabilities across a wide breadth of business needs.
Engage with internal and external stakeholders to collect data requirements.

Your background & requirements:

6+ years professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or related roles.
3+ years of leadership and team management experience
Proven experience with business intelligence platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker etc.
Proficiency in SQL and in-depth knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes.
Experience with Amazon AWS cloud platform
Experience working in the healthcare domain with payers or providers.
Previous working experience with EMR data, Claims and SDOH data is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business or a related field; a Master's degree is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.

We're looking for a Senior or Staff level Analyst to join our team with a culture rooted in kindness, empathy, and product-mindedness. This role will be a member of the growing Analytics team but will work closely with the Chief Customer & Engagement Officer.

Some of the exciting projects that this role will get to work on include optimizing marketing spend based on performance and clinic capacity, developing insights based on "closed loop" marketing reporting to focus Engagement efforts on revenue-driving outcomes, and communicating data recommendations to key stakeholders on the marketing team.

We use a variety of technologies at Eleanor Health including Google Cloud Platform, Mode, dbt, Salesforce, Callrail, Rudderstack, and Google Analytics.

Candidate Responsibilities

Are keen on staying up to date on current technology trends and continuously improving team and company performance by incorporating modern engineering and best practices.

Compensation & Benefits:

The total target compensation for the position is $125,000 - $150,000. The actual compensation offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the applicant's qualifications for the position; years of relevant experience; specific and unique skills; level of education attained; certifications or other professional licenses held; other legitimate, non-discriminatory business factors specific to the position; and the geographic location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will perform the job.

Eleanor Health offers a generous benefits package to full-time employees, which includes:

Flexible PTO policy and a remote work environment- unplug, relax, and recharge!
9 observed company holidays + 3 floating holidays- We encourage you to use the additional 3 floating holidays to accommodate personal beliefs/practices
Wellness Days - In lieu of "Sick Time" which typically applies only when you are ill, we encourage you to proactively manage your overall wellbeing, both physical and mental, as well as the wellbeing of those who play important roles in your life.
Fully covered medical and dental insurance plan, with affordable vision coverage.- We are a health first company, and we strive to make our plans affordable and accessible
401(k) plan with 3% match. We are excited to be able to support the long-term financial well-being of our team in a way that reinforces Eleanor's commitment to equity.
Short-term disability- We understand that things happen, we want you to feel comfortable to take the time to get better.
Long Term Disability - Picks up where Short Term Disability leaves off.
Life Insurance - Both Eleanor and employee-paid options are available.
Family Medical Leave- Eleanor Health's Paid Family & Medical Leave ("PFML") is designed to provide flexibility and financial peace of mind for approved family and medical reasons such as the birth, adoption, or fostering of a child, and for serious health conditions that they or a family member/significant other might be facing.
Wellness Perks & Benefits- Mental Health is important to us and we want our employees to have the accessibility they deserve to talk things through, zen with a mindfulness app, or seek assistance from health advocates
Mindfulness App Reimbursement
1 year subscription to TalkSpace
Paid Membership to Health Advocate, One Medical, and Teladoc

About Eleanor Health

Eleanor Health is the first outpatient addiction and mental health provider delivering convenient and comprehensive care through a value-based payment structure. Committed to health and wellbeing without judgment, Eleanor Health is focused on delivering whole-person, comprehensive care to transform the quality, delivery, and accessibility of care for people affected by addiction.

To date, Eleanor Health operates multiple clinics and a fully virtual model statewide across Louisiana, Massachusetts, New Jersey, North Carolina, Ohio, Texas, Florida, and Washington, delivering care through population and value-based partnerships with Medicare, Medicaid, and employers.

If you are passionate about providing high quality, evidence based care for individuals with substance use disorder through an innovative practice and about building a great business that makes a difference, Eleanor Health is an ideal opportunity for you. We seek highly skilled, motivated and compassionate individuals who take responsibility and adapt quickly to change to join our deeply committed and collaborative team.

Job Title: IT Business Intelligence & Process Control Specialist
Job Description:
IT Business Intelligence & Process Control Specialist

We are looking for an IT Business Intelligence & Process Control Specialist to join our team and help us leverage data to drive business decisions and outcomes. You will be responsible for turning tested development code into production for Power BI apps and workspaces, Cognos reports, cubes, frameworks, and dashboards, and leveraging MOTIO tools. You will also be involved with designing, developing, maintaining, and administering business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI and IBM Cognos tools. The candidate will perform a leadership role to coordinate and guide an expanding team of functional data scientists and citizen developers to align these resources with our IT architecture and change control processes.

Responsibilities:



Expert level experience with the design and development of Power BI reports and dashboards that meet business requirements and provide actionable insights.
Ability to write PowerShell scripts to import Power BI activity log, export active directory content etc.
Collaborate with business users, analysts, data scientists and IT teams to understand data and reporting needs and provide solutions.
Administer and manage Power BI service, including data Gateways, datasets, workspaces, Apps, securing data and content etc.
Plan, coordinate, and execute production release activities for Power BI apps and workspaces, Cognos reports, cubes, frameworks, and dashboards using MOTIO tools using production release procedures.
Experience in SQL scripts.
Designs and develops framework models by importing meta data from various data sources and creating packages.
Create and enhance Cognos Reports as per the business requirements using report studio, analysis studio etc.
Hands-on experience on Cognos Dashboards, Data modules and Datasets.
Experience in Cognos admin tasks such as scheduling reports, deploying reports to production, securing data and objects etc.
Provide technical support and training to end-users of Power BI and Cognos tools.
Ensure that the production code is consistent with the development code and meets quality standards.
Monitor the performance of production code and troubleshoot any issues or errors.
Provide technical support and training to end-users of Power BI and Cognos tools.
Document and maintain business intelligence standards, best practices, and procedures.
Communicate with development teams, business users, and stakeholders about production release status, issues, and resolutions.

Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
At least 3 years of experience in production control or release management using Power BI apps and workspaces, Cognos reports, cubes, frameworks, and dashboards.
Proficient in Power BI apps and workspaces administration using MOTIO tools.
Proficient in Cognos reports, cubes, frameworks, and dashboards administration using MOTIO tools.
Knowledge of production control best practices and methodologies
Knowledge of Power BI apps and workspaces development using DAX language
Knowledge of Cognos reports development using Report Studio or Query Studio
Excellent communication, organizational, and time-management skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Proficient in SQL and data modeling techniques
Experience in Power BI administration, including data gateway, service principal, capacity, and premium features.
Experience in Cognos administration, including installation, configuration, tuning, troubleshooting, and migration.
Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and architectures
Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
3+ years of experience in Power BI and IBM Cognos report development (version 11.0 or above) for report development and administration.

Job Title: Strategic Finance Operations Associate - Financial Analyst - Consulting background highly preferred
Job Description:
At Shields, we pride ourselves on our culture of inclusion and kindness and the difference we make in patients' lives every day. We are tremendously proud to be certified as a 'Great Place to Work' two years in a row. In 2022, we were awarded US Fortune Best Workplaces in Health Care™, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials™ & Fortune Best Workplaces for Women™.

Improving lives and elevating performance are at the heart of everything we do. That's why more health system leaders trust Shields to elevate access, outcomes and growth within specialty pharmacy — delivering value throughout the entire health system. Leveraging our proven Shields Performance Platform – we deliver the financial results that health systems demand and the superior outcomes patients deserve. With the foremost leaders in specialty pharmacy on our team; proven success partnering with more than 70 health systems; and a vested interest in delivering measurable results – we are the partner health systems trust to transform their specialty pharmacy into a powerful growth engine and elevate performance where it matters most.


Business Overview:

As the first and largest specialty pharmacy integrator and accelerator, Shields Health Solutions (SHS) is the industry leader in providing innovative and comprehensive care for the nation's chronically ill patient population. Shields creates and manages hospital-owned specialty pharmacy programs for hospitals and health systems who want to offer coordinated care services for patients with chronic illnesses. Using an integrated approach to patient care through our purpose-built software platform, TelemetryRx, our Patient Liaison model, and our centralized clinical support team, Shields is redefining what it means to provide superior, fully integrated patient care from clinic to pharmacy to patient's homes. Our innovative model and proven results in such a unique industry have led us to be one of the fastest growing healthcare companies in the nation with an immense impact on patients' lives.

Position Overview:

Shields Health Solutions is looking to hire a Strategic Business Performance Associate, reporting to the Director of Strategic Business Performance, to further enhance the capabilities of the newly established function. This team is leading the latest addition of value creation capabilities to our operating model; the role is high impact, visibility, and responsibility to create shared ROI for all stakeholders. The role will primarily focus on improving demand forecasting, employee utilization and related actions, and assisting in the deployment of new resources. Along with this, the Associate will partner directly with senior leaders and department heads to identify additional process improvements for the organization and lead multi-functional projects to execution. They will proactively recommend reporting, process, and infrastructure improvements. They will automate business and reporting processes and partner with internal teams to improve workflow. This role will have high visibility across the corporate team and will interact with key business leaders and executives to support critical business processes, information generation, and insights.

The ideal candidate will have ample healthcare services operations experience, is a capable communicator, will have worked with large and complex data sets, is a self-starter, and is experienced with Excel and PowerPoint.

Representative Job Responsibilities and Duties:

Partner with functional leaders to uncover opportunity and executed improvement in organizational efficiency
Develop & maintain Demand Forecasting using inputs from disparate and large data sources
Utilize data landscape to identify top performing areas of the company and recognize key contributors to the success of the operating model
Proactively identify and make recommendations for enhancements / modifications to business processes, reporting and how the business leverages information
Develop cross-platform and automated reporting to drive more insightful and automated analysis
Proactively identify and communicate new or enhancements to existing reports, metrics, and analyses to measure and track business performance
Develop and maintain documentation to describe and memorialize information with respect to forecasting and business processes
Troubleshoot reporting and process issues, test and work with business to resolve any issues
Support team & organizational goals as needed

Skills and Position Requirements:

3+ years of experience as data or business intelligence analyst, consultant, financial analyst, or healthcare operations analyst
Entrepreneurial attitude - willingness to roll up his/her sleeves and work alongside staff to make things happen quickly.
Must be highly motivated, results-driven professional who can thrive in a team-oriented environment
Highly Proficient Excel and PowerPoint skills, preferably experienced in complex data modeling
Growth-oriented and positive and problem-solving mindset
Highly analytical with strong attention to detail; methodical thinker, able to deduce and communicate relevant information from data
Effective at multi-tasking; someone who enjoys and thrives wearing multiple hats at once, seeks exposure to different perspectives, and learning new skills
Customer service oriented, flexible and adaptable with proven ability to solve problems in a collaborative manner with strong ability to influence
Basic understanding of applied statistics and probability
Experience with Services Resource Planning, or other similar field is a plus

Education:

Bachelor's Degree in STEM, finance, business administration, statistics, or computer science
Advanced degree a plus

Location:

Chicago or Boston based
Hybrid Office (2-3 Days a week)

Compensation:

Competitive Base Salary
Annual Performance Bonus
Employee Benefits

Position Overview:

The Financial Systems Analyst will be an integral part of the Financial Systems team and will work with stakeholders and subject matter experts to analyze business processes and workflows to gather and validate business requirements to create project plans and system design documents.


What you'll be doing:

Elicit, validate and document business requirements to support process improvement projects.
Use metrics to identify opportunities for automation within the finance department.
Work closely with the finance department to create efficiencies and process improvements.
Research and analyze available solutions to meet the changing needs of the business.
Testing and validation of solutions.
Liaison with engineering and product departments to ensure finance needs are met.


What you must have:

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business administration or applicable technical degree
2-4 Years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, or accounting
Knowledge of GAAP
Basic understanding of project management methodologies
Experience with ERP (Oracle eBusiness preferred)
A curious mind that looks for ways to innovate
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness and aptitude to learn new technologies
Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
Strong MS Excel and Word skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously


Success Competencies:

Nimble learner - Readily learns and adopts new technologies; is resourceful and curious
Communicates effectively - Relates comfortably with people across levels, functions and cultures
Consistently demonstrates innovation and sound judgment when making decisions
Uses knowledge of business insights and strategies to guide actions
Considers all relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles
Is highly organized and comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously, demonstrating excellent time management skills with attention to details
Demonstrates self-awareness - Recognizes and acknowledges the emotions of others and instils a positive outlook and constructive attitude during complex times


A bit about us:

CCC advances copyright, accelerates knowledge, and powers innovation.

Our employees partner with customers to create solutions together, removing friction from the market and making complicated things simple. We help organizations integrate, access, and share information through licensing, content, software, and professional services.

CCC received the 2023 Top Workplaces USA National award, where we were recognized for the second year in a row as an organization that has built a great workplace culture. CCC was also named a Top Place to Work AND a Top Women-Led Business in Massachusetts by the Boston Globe. We also earned national recognition with several Top Workplaces Cultural Excellence awards for employee appreciation, employee well-being, professional development, being women-led, compensation & benefits, leadership, and work-life flexibility.

CCC is committed to a diverse, inclusive, equitable, and vibrant ecosystem that cultivates opportunity for our team and attracts talented people. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and/or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and/or veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. CCC understands that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company.

Position Purpose
Responsible for leading wine category analytics initiatives with internal and external partners to strengthen Delicato’s position of category leadership. Using data analytics, consumer/shopper insights, and category expertise, this position will identify opportunities and make recommendations to drive growth. Key to the role will be the development of strong business relationships with assigned customers in an advisor role to recommend actions to grow category sales.


***THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION, BASED IN THE EAST**
Essential Duties
Leads wine category analytic projects to support the CSI and Strategic Accounts teams in the areas of product assortment, shelf sets, promotions, pricing, and other opportunities
Utilizes all available data sources, including store level data, shopper insights, and category expertise to develop analyses and make shelf/adjacency/assortment recommendations to maximize wine category sales
Establishes a leadership position and builds collaborative relationships with key customers, and influences through the development and presentation of compelling category strategies and insights
Contributes to the development of category leadership strategy in partnership with internal stakeholders
Consults with and trains internal team on assortment and space analytics, software/tools, and best practices
Advises internal and external partners on new items, deletes, and planner recommendations
Collaborates with the CSI and Strategic Accounts teams on key customer insights and opportunities
Communicates insights in a clear and concise manner that allow key stakeholders to quickly grasp the actions and set appropriate strategies
Assists Strategic Analytics team on custom projects supporting our brand strategies and key sales objectives including making actionable recommendations
Remains aware of inventory levels to ensure product availability to support current programming
Increases level of wine knowledge through continuous education

Non-Essential Duties
Other duties may be assigned
Minimum Requirements
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business with a Sales, Marketing or Statistics concentration
Minimum 8+ years of relevant business analysis experience required, with a focus on category management
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Must be able to travel to attend retailer/distributor meetings, sales meetings, and/or market visits
Fluent in Nielsen/IRI scan data analytics, and other syndicated and custom data, developing analytic solutions to solve business issues and capitalize on growth opportunities
Familiarity with wine industry depletion, scan, and consumer/shopper data and reporting
Strong understanding of the CPG industry, retail channels and strategies, including expertise in category management
A high degree of experience with space management tools (e.g. JDA)
Expert skills in various tools and platforms required; strength in Excel, PowerPoint, multi-dimensional tables, statistical software, and the ability to report, graph and present complex information
Excellent analytical and data management skills with the ability to deliver solutions based on objectives
Demonstrated ability to develop internal and external business relationships, working collaboratively to define needs and objectives
Ability to distill complex statistical concepts and methodology, and communicate insights to cross-functional teams with varying levels of understanding in this area
Ability to effectively work and collaborate within a team structure
Strong project management skills and ability to plan and prioritize work effectively in a fast-paced environment
Solid business acumen and problem-solving skills. Commitment to quality, accuracy, and continuous improvement
Certificates and Licenses
Relevant Space Management or Category Management certifications highly desirable
Working Conditions
Must be able to travel to attend sales meeting and market visits
Requires ability to travel frequently and flexibility in schedule to work evenings and weekends as needed
This is a remote position that requires working out of a home office
Work Standards
Acts in a manner reflective of the Company culture of High Moral Standards, Innovation and Continuous Evolution, Trust in Team, Continuous Improvement, and Sustainable Relationships
Communicates, interacts, and works effectively with others; receptive to feedback and coaching; voices concerns in a constructive manner
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with other employees, clients, and with external organizations
Demonstrates commitment to safety first; communicates safety concerns; promotes a safe work environment based on established safety standards and training
Follows all Company policies and procedures
Additional Comments
“Management retains the discretion to add to or change the duties of the position at any time.”
California Pay Transparency Disclaimer: This is a Exempt position. The pay range for this position is $100,157.20 to $156,787.40.


Actual placement within range will be contingent upon a number of factors, including but not limited to the candidate's qualifications, education, experience, internal equity and alignment with market data.


Delicato Family Wines offers its employees a generous and comprehensive benefits package. The core health insurance components include medical, dental and vision, where Delicato covers nearly the entire cost for employees and a large percentage for dependents. Additional health benefits include life, disability and flexible spending accounts. Other benefits include 401(k) with generous company match, discretionary profit sharing, paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, wine & merchandise discounts, tuition reimbursement, gym discounts & many more.


Delicato Family Wines is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - R & D
Job Description:
Lantheus is headquartered in Bedford, Massachusetts with offices in New Jersey, Canada and Sweden. For more than 60 years, Lantheus has been instrumental in pioneering the field of medical imaging and have helped physicians enhance patient care with our broad product portfolio.

Lantheus is an entrepreneurial, agile, growing organization that provides innovative diagnostics, targeted therapeutics and artificial intelligence (AI) solutions that empower clinicians to find, fight and follow disease. Our purpose and values guide our behaviors in all interactions and play a vital role in creating a dynamic environment that contributes to our success. Every employee is crucial to our success, we respect one another and act as one knowing that someone’s health is in our hands. We believe in helping people be their best and are seeking to bring together a diverse group of individuals with different viewpoints and skills sets to be a part of a productive and inclusive team.

Purpose

The Senior R&D Business Analyst (BA) acts as an intermediary between the R&D business and technical community. The BA will work with IT project teams and business clients within R&D, Clinical and Regulatory functions to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design from which applications and solutions are developed. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to build relationships with business partners. This role will also provide support for manufacturing systems.

Essential Functions

Support and maintain existing systems supporting departments, specific to R&D, Clinical and Regulatory
Interact with cross functional teams to ensure business processes and rules are documented to ultimately determine areas for improved efficiencies
Learn business processes and relevant software technologies participating in implementation of new systems and solutions following the Lantheus validation process and procedures.
Participate on multiple project teams
Research and recommend new technology solutions aligned with IoT and Industry 4.0
Ensure functional work activities are conducted in compliance with technology and regulatory requirements, related policies and procedures, and corporate objectives
Actively promotes safety rules and awareness. Demonstrates good safety practices at all times including the appropriate use of protective equipment. Reports and takes initiative to correct safety & environmental hazards
Actively demonstrates the Lantheus values of accountability, communication, customer commitment, entrepreneurial spirit, integrity, safety and teamwork

Typical Minimum Skills and Experience and Education

BA/BS degree in Information Technology or Computer Science with up to 5 years progressive experience in analytical roles of increasing responsibility, or equivalent
Demonstrated analytical, troubleshooting, and problem solving skills
Demonstrated ability to communicate in both verbal and written communication
Experience with R&D Product Life Cycle a strong plus
Experience working in a GMP Validated environment a strong plus
Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work in a team dynamic across multiple functional organizations
Basic understanding of information technology and business concepts
Ability to work and perform in a fun, agile and fast paced business environment

Other Requirements

After hours and/or weekend work periodically required

Job Title: Data Analyst – Business Intelligence & Reporting Specialist (Power BI & Tableau)
Job Description:
Opportunity:

Olmstead drives business success by helping clients build and leverage a strong data foundation. The right data strategy can reduce risk, increase productivity, improve decision making, and fuel innovation. We are seeking a hands-on detail-oriented data analyst with investment management industry experience and expertise with business intelligence and reporting.

Candidates will have mastery in business intelligence and experience with SQL, data modeling, and data governance. They are not afraid to roll up their sleeves, challenge the status quo, leverage best practices, and grow beyond their comfort zone. They are an excellent communicator that uses precise language and frames messaging in business terms.

As a valued member of our expert data management consulting team, you will engage clients to document and analyze their data landscape. The Analyst will help the client grow, develop new capabilities, and optimize data management. You will deliver solutions across a wide range of data-oriented engagements, such as investment management reporting, data governance, data migrations, and data warehousing.

Responsibilities:

Aid current state assessments by collecting information on data sources, data flows, information consumption, and information production
Produce reports and data mashups to answer business related questions
Trace data requirements, data sources, and data flows for processes and reports
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
Produce project deliverables that itemize and summarize to aid comprehension and decision making
Collaborate with client stakeholders and team members to understand analytic needs and deliver actionable insights
Maintain a point of view on leading data management solutions available from the market, such as business intelligence, data governance, data catalog, and data quality solutions
Qualifications:
Possess strong business knowledge of the investment management industry and common data management operations
Mastery creating Business Intelligence reports using Power BI and Tableau
Proficient in design and implementation of both online dashboards and printed page reports
Expertise organizing and managing reporting services (Power BI Service, Tableau Online)
Skilled with version control and life cycle management of report artifacts
Data modeling expertise for investment data domains, such as security master, accounts, holdings, transactions, etc.
Strong hands-on SQL and Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Familiarity with data management conventions and best practices
If you are interested in joining Olmstead, please send an email to recruiting@olmst.com

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Job Description:

The Role

Do you want to make a difference and be part of a highly collaborative product area committed to increasing adoption of Salesforce for Institutional Wealth Management Services (IWMS) and Fidelity Institutional (FI) users? IWMS uses the Salesforce platform as its Client Relationship Management (CRM) tool and as a key driver of the associate experience for sales, relationship management, consulting & client service teams. IWMS considers Salesforce a key strategic asset & capability.

The Team

The CRM Enablement product area sits in the Fund and Brokerage Operations and Technology (FBOT) organization. The CRM Segment Enablement role reports into the business enablement team and is a shared resource across all CRM squads. This role partners closely with IWMS segment management leaders and their teams, business architects, learning and development team and squad leaders to drive consistent and effective adoption of Salesforce.

The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Bachelor’s degree required
5+ years business analysis / product management, ideally working in an Agile Scrum environment, with ability to work across multiple multi-functional teams.
Salesforce experience preferred
Jira and Jira Align experience preferred
Experience with Digital Adoption Tools (e.g. Pendo) a plus
Experience connecting business processes and needs to technology capabilities
Experience coaching and educating end users on how best to use technology to better do their jobs and make data driven decisions
Ability to facilitate diverse groups of people to move towards solutions while influencing key decision makers based on analysis findings
Exceptional communication & Influence skills
The Value You Deliver
You will be a valued CRM thought partner to segment management and segment leaders on how best to use CRM to help run their business
You will partner with Sales and Relationship Management groups to drive a minimum standard of CRM adoption that aligns with scorecards
You will deliver feedback to the squad leaders based on actual use of Salesforce and influence the longer-term strategic development roadmap
You will actively track and manage Salesforce adoption to recommend opportunities for formal training, development or business process redesign

Certifications:

Company Overview

Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients' money.


Join Us

At Fidelity, you'll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples' lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees' Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. And you don't need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you've always imagined.

At Fidelity, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we’re calling “Dynamic Working”. Most associates will have a hybrid schedule with a requirement to work onsite at a Fidelity work location for at least one week, 5 consecutive days, every four weeks. These requirements are subject to change.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.


Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst- Revenue Operations and Bookings
Job Description:
Company Overview

Here at UKG, our purpose is people™. Our HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions help organizations unlock happier outcomes for all. And our U Krewers, who build those solutions and support our business, are talented, collaborative, and innovative problem-solvers. Description

As part of the Revenue Operations & Analysis team, this position will report into the Sr. Manager, Finance and partner closely with the Principal Analyst on the team to support UKG’s quality of SaaS bookings.

Key responsibilities include the following:

Support Lead-to-Nurture (L2N) initiatives around data governance, definitions, system enhancements, primary testing lead, business requirements development, etc.
Develop relationships across FP&A teams and the business to support knowledge development with L2N.
SME on the working of the UKG consolidated bookings Alteryx Model and Power BI to ensure accuracy of data transformation and enrichment required to synthesize the story of Bookings.
o Responsible for data integrity in the model, including checks to ensure historical
data hasn’t changed, adjustments are made according to our policies and
procedures, etc.
o Working closely with Noida team members to make changes to the model that align
with the needs to the business and IT.
o Work with IT to resolve EDW issues that cause incorrect booking metrics and
recommend corrective actions to enable quality bookings data.
o Ensure deliverables across the teams support the closing timeline needs and are
monitored through the closing process and communicated to key stakeholders.
o Develop dashboards in the BI for other functions to self-service, including how and
when to use certain data, etc. (Teams such as Product Management, Business
Development, etc.)

Develop and recommend new metrics and insight-driven reporting that help drive business success.
Supporting the review of deals >$250K to evaluate potential revenue leakage areas.
Create dashboard reporting to provide visibility into the impact UKG’s Sales Empowerments have on “bookings to revenue” and “bookings to cash” metrics.
Prepare reporting and detailed analysis to understand financial performance and communicate results to Executive Leadership, highlighting trends and identifying drivers.
Respond to inquiries which may include conducting research, working with cross functional teams, and preparing related adjustments.
Complete special projects, as requested.

Qualifications

About You
Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance required, MBA a plus
3+ years of experience in financial analysis

Preferred Qualifications:

Ability to embrace technology & change.
Understanding and working knowledge of Alteryx and Power BI.
Ability to summarize large volumes of complex data into clear actionable information.
Strong self-starter with the ability to think creatively, well-organized, solution unexpected issues and meeting deadlines.
Well-organized and attention to detail.
Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced team environment.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

Job Summary:

The Senior Business Analyst with a focus on facilities and management is responsible for performing business analysis and design to support small and large-scale business change initiatives. This role requires excellent communication, stakeholder management, and the ability to ensure that proposed solutions align with quality, compliance standards, and business needs

Key Responsibilities:

Business Needs Identification:

Assess and define business needs and areas for improvement.
Proactively identify opportunities to enhance processes in line with strategic goals.
Propose potential solutions through thorough research.

Business Analysis Planning:

Select appropriate analysis approaches based on complexity, risk, and constraints.
Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate methods.
Plan and manage activities to meet deliverables and deadlines.

Identify stakeholders and build and maintain relationships according to their needs and influence.
Contribute to communication plans and change management for projects and stakeholders.

Analysis and Design Definition:

Develop requirements management plans, including elicitation, approvals, and scope impacts.
Maintain traceability, testing, and validation processes.
Work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements.
Translate requirements into design specifications, including Functional Design, User Interface Design, and Business Process Design.
Collaborate with the Architecture team to ensure technical solutions align with business goals.
Business Case and Benefits Management:
Support the development of business cases, capturing justification for investment, including ROI and benefits realization.

Solution Evaluation:

Analyze and assess solution proposals and provide reasoning.
Assess business readiness and maximize value versus spending.

Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, or a related field.
Proven experience in business analysis and design.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of facilities and management processes is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
Certification in business analysis is preferred.

pharmaceutical: 6 years (Required)

Infosys is seeking Senior consultant in Capital Markets Domain. As a Senior Consultant, you will be an expert contributing to different phases of the consulting lifecycle. You will also play an important role in the development, configuration and deployment of the overall solution. You will guide teams on project processes, deliverables and contribute to the proposal development, client training and internal capability building and help detail the project scope. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.

Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Boston, MA / Jersey City, NJ or be willing to relocate to the area.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
At least 4 years of experience with Information Technology.
Experience in Financial Domain skills in one of the areas Compliance/ AML/ AMR/ Capital Markets/ Risk/ Trade Surveillance/ Wealth Management

Preferred Qualifications

At least 6 years of experience in Systems analysis for banks and financial services organizations
At least 6 years of experience working as a Business Analyst and experience creating requirement specifications documents, BRDs, Functional Specifications documents and interfacing with Business.
At least 4 years of experience working as Data Analyst/Technology Business Analyst in Financial Services sector, with ability to work both with the business partners and the technology teams very closely on a daily basis to assist in defining the capability and being involved throughout the SDLC process.

At least 3 years of experience in gathering requirement for UI web-based or Datawarehouse based applications with experience in requirement elicitation and translation into functional specifications.
At least 3 years of experience with data quality and data analysis.
At least 4 years of experience in capturing requirements related to internal/external consulting, documenting, and mapping current business process.
Ability to understand complex data models and be able to perform Data Analysis and Data Mapping.
Ability to present meaningful data/gap analysis using Strong SQL skills coupled with good Financial Domain Knowledge.
Strong analytical ability to think strategically.
Ability to work independently
Strong Communication skills
Planning and Co-ordination skills, should be willing to work in onsite offshore model.
Experience and desire to work in a consulting environment that requires occasional travel

The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. The SAP FICO Analyst at New England Biolabs (NEB) role is responsible for the design, delivery, and maintenance of solutions within the global SAP finance functions. To perform well in this role, it is critical that the person establish a strong partnership with the business process owners to maintain a clear understanding of priorities and how solutions fit into the business goals and objectives. This position is based at our Ipswich, MA headquarters.
Primary Responsibilities:
Responsible for ensuring NEB’s finance requirements are met during design and implementation of SAP, NEB’s core ERP platform.
Provide subject matter expertise for core financial processes, including cost accounting, GL, AP, AR, tax, and reporting.
Lead Finance Governance meetings where business/IT work collaboratively to maintain a clear list of issues/requests, establish priorities, and set realistic expectations.
As the ultimate owner of finance functional support, this role will need to operate as a solution architect and provide education/guidance to 3rd party consultants.

Participate on project teams to support upgrades and assist in continuous improvement efforts.

Stay current in related technologies and best practices.

BS in Information Systems or related field.
Minimum 7 years’ experience in performing SAP configuration with Finance (FI).
Minimum 3 years’ experience in blueprinting, as well as unit and regression test design and execution.
Excellent knowledge of FI business processes.
Strong technical knowledge and ability to communicate complex technical concepts in terms understandable to internal users.
Knowledge of SAP best practices and SAP Implementation Methodology.
Good understanding of the integration points across SAP modules.
Effective written, oral and interpersonal communication skills.

Technical development skills are a plus.
Experience with MM, IM, CO, SD, or other SAP modules strongly preferred.
Experience maintaining SAP within the life sciences industry strongly preferred.
SAP certification and/or course work preferred.

Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) is the world's largest telematics service provider. Its mission is to make the world's roads and drivers safer. The company's AI-driven platform, DriveWell®, gathers sensor data from millions of IoT devices — including smartphones, proprietary Tags, connected vehicles, dashcams, and third-party devices — and fuses them with contextual data to create a unified view of vehicle and driver behavior. Companies from personal and commercial auto insurance, automotive, rideshare, smart cities, wireless, financial services, and family safety industries use insights from CMT's platform to power their risk assessment, safety, claims, and driver improvement programs. Headquartered in Cambridge, MA, with offices in Budapest, Chennai, Seattle, Tokyo, and Zagreb, CMT serves millions of people through over 95 programs in 25 countries, including 21 of the top 25 US auto insurers.

As a Senior Data Analyst at CMT, you will develop a variety of analytic solutions that will report on car movements and driver behaviors derived from the sensors found in modern smartphones and other devices. You will oversee the creation and delivery of analytic offerings by partnering with internal stakeholders on data requirements and with the data science team to develop tools and services supporting their needs. You will help build and monitor CMT's data lake, including validating data prior to it being used by the organization and/or its clients. You will also construct and apply standard statistical analysis and financial models to verify data acceptability and accuracy, and ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices.

Responsibilities:

Perform advanced business analysis using various techniques, including statistical analysis and predictive modeling
Develop actionable insights with recommendations for the current business operations or issues
Partner with Product Owners, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and other stakeholders to develop models, reporting, dashboards, and presentations for internal and external clients
Work with CMT data scientists to develop algorithms and models for dashboards and analysis
Implement data strategies, develop implementation plans, and manage to plan with internal stakeholders to ensure compliance with deliverable reporting requirements
Handle special analytical projects as needed
Lead cross-functional internal and external meetings to present analysis and insights, and to propose recommendations
May oversee the work of less experienced analysts
Participate in A/B and other statistical testing designs, setting up control groups, and relaying outcomes of testing
Update and add new data in data lake including setting up data dictionaries, definitions, document reporting and their dependencies, and to relay internal department data and reporting requirements
Ensure data integrity by monitoring and performing data lake quality audits and analysis, and by identifying and defining new processes and procedures to mitigate data discrepancies
Develop data testing and monitoring algorithms that efficiently identify incongruences and changes in data and reporting
Complete any additional tasks that may arise

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred) in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience/certification
4+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Reporting, or Data Science
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Infogram, Plotly, and/or Visual.ly
Strong SQL coding skills with ability to update and retrieve data, highlight data changes, and identify data incongruencies
Experience coding in Python
Experience working with internal and external stakeholders
Strong communication skills with ability to raise questions, define needs, and relay outcomes
Ability to develop and present findings to small groups
Experience using MS Office including Excel and PowerPoint

Compensation and Benefits:

Fair and competitive salary based on skills and experience
Equity in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance, matching 401k, short-term & long-term disability, and parental leave
Unlimited Paid Time Off including vacation, sick days & public holidays
Flexible scheduling and work-from-home policy depending on role and responsibilities

Additional Perks:

Feel great working to improve road safety around the world!
Join one of our many employee resource groups including Black, AAPI, LGBTQIA+, Women, Book Club, and Health & Wellness
Extensive wellness, education, and employee assistance programs
CMT will do all that is possible to support our employees and create a positive and inclusive work environment for all!

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:

At CMT, we are intensifying our commitment to provide opportunities and career growth to the underrepresented. We are focused on creating an inclusive work environment that encourages a diversity of background and thought to produce the best products and services within our industry.

CMT is an equal-opportunity employer and strives to create an inclusive and diverse environment that enriches our employees' lives in and outside of work. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability state. CMT is headquartered in Cambridge MA. To learn more, visit www.cmtelematics.com and follow us on Twitter @cmtelematics.
