Reporting to the Epic Operations Manager – Professional, the Epic Operations Reporting Analyst serves as a member of the preeminent Epic Lead reporting resource tasked with developing operational transactional data and reporting requests for Patient Financial Services supporting all One BILH Epic Professional Billing Revenue Cycle entities. Engages with users to understand their business operations, processes, and user needs. Works through assigned ticket requests performing updates or edits to existing data extracts and reporting or developing new routine extracts and reports. Participates in guiding and educating end-users on the use and interpretation of data extracts and reporting. Due to its service focus, this position requires strong interpersonal and communication skills and well-developed analytic and organizational skills. This position is a resource to administrative staff of all levels, interfacing with other departments such as Information Systems, Professional and Hospital Administration, and all Ambulatory Departments and Divisions. Provides quality customer service and serves as an exemplary representative of the Patient Financial Services team.

Job Description:

Essential Duties & Responsibilities including but not limited to:

1. The Epic Operations Reporting Analyst Report is a developer with deep technical knowledge of the Epic Reporting Apparatus, including Reporting Workbench, Slicer Dicer, Cubes, and Ramsey reporting.
2. Engages with end-users to understand the specific data/reporting needs within the context of requests. Works directly with leadership and team members in identifying business requirements and defining Epic data or reporting solutions.
3. Has the ability to build, troubleshoot, and fix reporting content and supports ongoing operational reporting by building and editing basic to more complex hyperspace reports and dashboards.
4. Inform end users about the underlying data and guide them in the use of these reporting tools. Conducts unit tests of own work and engages team members in second-level QA testing.
5. Produces/Updates documentation for extracts and reporting. Keeps internal end-user documentation accurate and up to date. May assist in the testing/quality assurance of other team members' more routine solutions.
6. Responding to assigned routine support tickets involving new straightforward requests or edits to existing queries, reports, or extracts. Tracks patterns of issues to identify training needs, underlying data or reporting issues, or potential enhancement opportunities to address business operational needs.
7. Participate in special projects as necessary. Supports routine inquiries and editing of existing data and reports and performs routine data audits to ensure integrity.
8. Participate in presentations to Revenue Cycle Operational leaders and end users. Engages in ongoing communications with multiple teams related to supported application and operational processes.
9. Actively participates in recurring team meetings to discuss the status of deliverables, roadblocks, shared issues, end-user concerns, etc.
10. Participates in routine communications with IT Epic representatives, as necessary to review outstanding support, request assistance, etc.
11. Attends local conferences, additional Epic training, and/or internal BILH offerings. May attend external Epic forums.

Education:
Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Experience Required

Epic Revenue Cycle Certification/Proficiency: Professional Billing or Revenue Cycle


Experience:
5+ years of clinical, healthcare operations, healthcare information technology experience, direct system/application support/data analysis, and reporting experience involving operational analysis.

Works independently, ability to prioritize, and has organizational skills a must. Excellent communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

Role Profile

Sr Finance Manager, Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) - Global Ops

Job Summary

The Senior Finance Manager is responsible for the financial management and business partnership of the Global Ops functions including real estate, risk, and cybersecurity. This individual will be responsible for conducting various enterprise-wide financial activities including budgeting, modeling, forecasting, month-end accounting and reporting. S/he will provide analytical insight and financial consulting to senior management including financial presentations and reporting support to Senior leadership business partners. This role will be a key asset in the future growth and advancement of the FP&A function critical to providing insights and supporting ‘optimal’ business decision making.

Responsibilities

Lead monthly forecast and close financial cycles for assigned businesses including the tracking of expenses, accruals, and allocations
Create and manage bottom’s up forecast packages; reporting variance analysis, cost of sales, expense, capital and headcount projections
Analyze current and past trends in developing key performance indicators to drive strategy and good decision making
Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance
Improve performance by evaluating processes to drive efficiencies and challenge the way that the business thinks about financial performance and measurement
Support business decisions by tracking trends and metrics and delivering insights on financial performance to business partners
Oversee consolidation of Global Ops financials including real estate, risk, and cybersecurity
Manage 2 Sr Financial Analysts that also support real estate, risk, and cybersecurity
Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis

Skills and Competencies

Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized.
Ability to think creatively, highly-driven and self-motivated with a focus on fostering teamwork
Quick learner and problem solver who can deliver innovative ideas and approaches when faced with new issues or challenges
Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills
High degree of business acumen and ability to interface directly with executive management
Experience growing and developing a team
Ability to build partnerships, influence decisions, work in a collaborative style and become a sought-out financial business partner
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and financial modeling skills needed to synthesize large quantities of data, identify trends and drivers, and distill them into insightful analysis

Job Description:

TA Operations Manager


The Talent Operations Manager (Contract) will be responsible for supporting Talent Acquisition projects and programs, including ongoing TA tech stack enhancements, recruiting process optimization, and development of recruiter training and enablement materials. In addition, this role will collaborate with internal Communication partners and external agencies in recruitment marketing initiatives to enhance the company's reputation as an employer of choice. This role requires deep comprehension of TA tools and technology, including Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and Candidate Relationship Management (CRM), to support ongoing platform improvements. The TA Ops manager will manage relationships with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders and subject matter experts and leverages a variety of skills (including analysis, documentation, testing, reporting, and training) to lead, manage, and report on project activities.


Resumes will be reviewed in November and December. Potential start date will be February.
Hybrid Role - in office 3 days week (Boston)


Key Responsibilities:

Support cross-functional talent acquisition initiatives/programs, including support for recruitment marketing initiatives
Apply a deep understanding of TA and HR tools, including ATS, CRM, and sourcing platforms, to evaluate existing processes, discover gaps, propose efficiencies, and support feature updates through testing and training
Work with internal and external partners to coordinate and execute recruitment marketing initiatives; identify priorities, develop content calendars, keep project members on track, and measure ROI to assess the success of recruitment marketing strategies.
Utilize data-driven insights to identify areas for improvement and optimize the recruitment process; own regular reporting of key insights across project work
Develop project plans to execute defined outcomes while managing dependencies, risks, and action items
Work with subject matter experts in HR COE’s and business stakeholders to define, scope, and execute on key project deliverables
Create, maintain, and organize TA Knowledge Management materials by documenting best practices for tools and processes to build consistency across project and operational work
Create change management materials and deliver related training to the recruiting team
Provide regular project status updates and ongoing communications to recruiters and senior stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field
3+ years of experience working in a recruiting function
Experience in executing recruitment marketing strategies
Track record of successful business analysis and project management delivery
Demonstrated experience with technology adoption frameworks/methodologies
Experience implementing and using ATS and/or CRM, preferably Workday and Beamery
Advanced MS Excel skills


Pay Range:
$60 - $68/HR

Overview:
Whether you’re looking for a high-energy, inclusive atmosphere and a company that understands the importance of work/life balance, Commonwealth is your match! From generous bonus and 401(k) programs to tuition reimbursement and flexible work schedules, Commonwealth is focused on helping its employees thrive in an environment suited to their needs. On top of all that, the Technology department offers a hybrid work schedule, so you’ll be able to work from home for part of the week!

We’re looking for a product manager to join our ranks. As a member of the Advisor Technology Solutions group, the product manager will help to drive the success of our core product offering and focus on building out business capabilities. You will maximize the value of Commonwealth’s RIA core advisor platform, Orion, by identifying outcomes aligned to the business strategy and road map, and shape demand for platform consumption and adoption.



Key Responsibilities

Maintaining a deep understanding of the Orion platform offering and ecosystem
Owning the relationship to Orion and focusing on vendor management, which includes ensuring service delivery, contract negotiation, and reducing vendor-related risks
Defining, analyzing, and communicating the platform road map aligned with business objectives and supported by business cases, market research, data, and competitive analysis
Measuring ROI and developing KPIs to understand end-user behavior and adoption metrics and making data-driven decisions
Ensuring quality execution and on-time delivery of product enhancements by collaborating closely with internal stakeholders such as QA, IT Communications, HelpDesk, Information Security, Compliance, and Technology teams
Collaborating closely with the product owner to ensure that platform direction aligns with end-user requirements and overall Commonwealth strategy
Working with the Learning and Development team and product analysts to provide deliverables for optimal adoption and results-driven outcomes for our advisor community


Core Strengths and Skills

A combination of technology, market, and business savvy of the financial RIA and broker/dealer landscape and fintech industry
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a related role such as product management or business analysis
Working knowledge of Orion (or similar) platform, including third-party integrations such as Redtail
Technical knowledge on standard development processes and components such as APIs, integration components, and data concepts
Bachelor’s degree in finance, technology, or related field
Experience with Agile software development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban

Have we piqued your curiosity? Can you see yourself thriving in this opportunity? Let’s introduce ourselves.


Picture Yourself Here

At Commonwealth, we believe in a better world. We hold ourselves and each other to higher standards. We take care of one another. That’s why we invest in you—we encourage employee growth both in your career and education; we are building out a robust diversity, equity, and inclusion program; we offer incredible health care benefits; and we find plenty of occasions to celebrate. What’s not to love?


We are always striving to be better, and we are looking for employees who share that same mindset. Better people, better coworkers, better leaders, better creators. Bring your best work and your full self to the table, and we will do the same. Together, we can build a better future for our advisors, their clients, our company, and you.


About Commonwealth

Commonwealth Financial Network, Member FINRA/SIPC, a Registered Investment Adviser, provides a suite of business solutions that empowers more than 2,000 independent financial advisors nationwide. Privately held since 1979, the firm has headquarters in Waltham, Massachusetts, and San Diego, California.




Turning our advisors into raving fans starts by doing the same for our employees. We foster an environment of excellence, growth, rewards, and fun in equal measure, which has earned us 43 Best Place to Work awards.




The Fine Print

We care about your online safety as a prospective employee and encourage you to exercise caution when responding to job postings online. Commonwealth will never ask potential hiring candidates to pay or transfer funds as a precondition of interviews or employment, nor will we authorize recruiters or agents to do so on our behalf.




Commonwealth is an equal opportunity employer, making intentional efforts to source talent from all backgrounds.

Min: USD $120,500.00/Yr. Max: USD $140,000.00/Yr.

Job Title: Principal Business Systems Analyst, Data Security
Job Description:
MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/applying-and-interviewing.html#onboarding.

Working under the direction of the Manager or Senior Team Lead, will be responsible for planning and implementing security measures to support MathWorks’ sophisticated technology and complex data; supporting complex data and system analysis and process and solution design to advance the business; developing MathWorks’ data security program, working across the enterprise to understand the data security requirements, assessing existing system architectures, and assisting in the development of data architecture and process solutions; collaborating with stakeholders across different business units to understand the current state of business processes, analyze the data security gaps, and define target security policies, processes and procedures for data; and researching industry standards and best practices for data governance and data security, and playing a critical role in facilitating the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the company.

MathWorks nurtures growth, appreciates diversity, encourages initiative, values teamwork, shares success, and rewards excellence.




Minimum Qualifications:

Education and Experience:

Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field (or foreign education equivalent) and four (4) years of experience in job offered or four (4) years of experience in data architecture, data governance, and data modeling.

OR

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field (or foreign education equivalent) and six (6) years of experience in job offered or six (6) years of experience in data architecture, data governance, and data modeling.




Special Requirements:

Demonstrated expertise building data infrastructure and end-to-end ETL pipelines using ETL platforms - Informatica and DataStage, Information Builders iWay or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS); and designing data visualizations - reports, dashboards, and maps - to convert raw data into consumable formats to inform data trends and analytics using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).
Demonstrated expertise building conceptual data models for RDBMS and Data Lake, including creating entity relationship diagrams, logical data models and physical data models using Dbeaver, Visio, DeZign, or Erwin Data Modeler.
Demonstrated expertise in data warehouse and data lake design, implementation and data governance including using canonical data formats and industry standard naming conventions to create data models and create data dictionaries with definitions to the data attributes; extracting, manipulating, aggregating and analyzing data using SQL query scripts within a Oracle data warehouse/data marts environment or within an S3 based data lake; and tuning Presto DML SQL query scripts for optimal performance.
Demonstrated expertise in the full software development life cycle (SDLC) for ETL, data warehouse, data lake and data security-related capabilities, including requirements specification, functional and architectural design, design review, and testing according to Agile methodologies.

[Expertise may be gained during Graduate program.]

Job Description


The Business Analyst role is to fully understand the information and automation needs of the stakeholder community with whom they work. This understanding is the basis for their essential work which is to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, and document the functional and business needs of stakeholders in the context of delivering IT services and solutions.

As a key role in Pharmacovigilance IT team, the Business Analyst role will be responsible for gathering use cases and requirements to shape the initial concepts and projects. They will engage business stakeholders to ensure that the business needs are correctly captured and translated into IT solutions. They will outline business processes, define the dataflow, analyze options among existing and new tools, and facilitate prioritization and simplification in providing the feasible solutions to achieve short- and long-term business goals. They will also be responsible for deliverables per the system development life cycle such as business requirements, functional requirements, traceability matrices, etc.

Key Responsibilities

Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers and the project team.
Communicate to project managers, business partners, and other stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle and be the champion to ensure/communicate system changes/requirements are prioritized and met.
Identify gaps and inefficiencies in business processes and coordinate with business users in developing to-be processes from as-is processes.
Act as a single point of contact for, business users, Project Managers, and the development teams for all the communication throughout the project lifecycle.
Coordinating with project managers to help enforce Systems Development Life Cycle standards and required regulations to projects.
To have a unified global view, aligned with Global IT Strategy, ensuring the provision of architecturally aligned, well integrated business solutions.
Work closely with the development teams to discuss enhancements, system requirements and feedbacks on new releases. Ensuring the enhancements made is appropriate and acceptable to the end users.
Collaborate with IT/business owners to determine project vision and scope.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Develop necessary documents, e.g., statement of work, project objectives & metrics, business requirements, use cases, storyboards, functional specifications, systems & end-user documentation.
Conduct or support trainings for application users and IT application support team.

Preferred Skills

Enterprise Architecture
Solution Planning
Stakeholder Relationship Management
Design Thinking
Data Analysis

Education

Bachelor's degree. Master’s degree as a plus.
CBAP/ ECBA / CCBA / CBAP certification preferred.



Qualifications


Required Skills:

7 Years of Business/Process analysis experience in pharmaceutical environment focused on development sciences domain, including 4+ years of Pharmacovigilance experience.
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Proven ability to drive complex conceptual discussions and develop system requirements. This includes the ability to generate innovative ideas to resolve problems.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Work with minimal guidance; seek guidance on complex tasks.
Ability to handle multiple projects (including a mix of small to complex) at any given time, set priorities, schedule, and meet deadlines.
Experience of IT solutions in Pharmacovigilance, including areas like case processing, signal detection in life sciences companies and knowledge of regulatory guidance and compliance (GxP and 21 CFR Part 11 regulations).
Demand management and supporting User Acceptance Testing (UAT)

Preferred Skills

Enterprise Architecture
Solution Planning
Stakeholder Relationship Management
Design Thinking
Data Analysis

Education

Bachelor's degree. Master’s degree as a plus.
CBAP/ ECBA / CCBA / CBAP certification preferred.

Summary: The Strategy Analyst Titleist Golf Gear will support the creation and evolution of strategic planning through comprehensive market research, industry trend analysis, and a deep understanding of market dynamics to continue facilitating growth for our global Gear business. Assess the viability of potential future projects, business development opportunities, and M&A targets.

Responsibilities:

Strategic Business Planning: Responsible for Strategic Business Planning analysis for the Gear leadership team. Implements best practices, resources, and trendsetting strategy to deliver business planning accuracy across Revenues, Gross Margin, Units and Average Net Sell Price. Work with senior leadership team to analyze and assist collaborating relevant data across the various departments in attendance to assist business evaluation and planning on a 3 year, annual, quarterly and monthly basis.
Financial Planning & Reporting: Creates and enhances key management reports that support the business: i.e. Product Profitability, Channel Planning, Sales Program Analysis, Inventory positions and category/product profitability. Manage the process of creating and presenting key materials to Gear Leadership Team for monthly, quarterly, and annual Gear business and financial performance reviews.
Financial Modeling & Analysis: Develop financial models to assist Gear Leadership Team forecast future period financial performance â€“ specifically in the development of long-term strategic plans. Perform financial analyses to assess potential development opportunities (acquisition targets, partnerships, product expansions, etc.).
Worldwide Market Size Overview Reporting & Analysis: Support the creation & maintenance of global Gear market size analysis and opportunities. Lead the tracking of market size with global markets and present summary key findings to Gear Leadership. Work with each region to ensure the accurate and timely submission of data for the semi-annual WW Market Overview analysis.

Ad-Hoc reporting experience with the knowledge of the logic behind it is required.
Financial analysis and reporting experience a must.
Strong information and presentation skills that will enable timely, effective, and scalable insights that will influence Strategic Business Decision implementation and decision making.
Ability to write reports in Cognos a plus.
Knowledge of workflow analysis, flow charting, and info-mapping procedures.
Must have excellent organizational skills as well as verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to maintain knowledge of confidential information such as product launches, costing, and M&A activity.
Advanced skill set in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Experience in Cognos 10 Report Studio and Workplace Advanced considered a plus.
Demonstrated competency in the following areas:
Project Management - Communication for project changes and progress; Completes projects on time.
Innovation - Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner;; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
Makes self-available to staff.

Continually works to gain, or improve, leadership skills.

Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? We will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.

Key job responsibilities
The Amazon Robotics (AR) organization manufactures high-quality robotics and gets the right materials to the right place at the right time to enable our automated solutions. It’s fast-paced and works cross-functionally with teams across Amazon globally. We are seeking a talented and motivated Manufacturing Systems Development Engineer with a proven track record of implementing best in class Systematic and business processes within a complex manufacturing environment. This role will report to the manager of Business Application in the Robotics Software Services and technology team. This position will primarily focus on supporting applications in the manufacturing and supply chain area. This role will work closely with manufacturing, supply chain management, Finance, engineering and other IT organizations.
You will also Lead functional workshops educating customers on the product and develop process flows and requirements.

Senior Manager Business Intelligence

- (3265090)


About Us:

As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

The Senior Manager, Enterprise Business Intelligence (EBI) is responsible for the direct management of 8-12 full-time employees, as well as consulting resources where necessary for larger projects. The incumbent will manage team resources, and the execute on analytics projects which span multiple departments across our entire health systems.

The manager oversees our data and analytics dissemination to institutions and departments across the organization on our enterprise reporting platform and Tableau infrastructure. The manager will ensure accurate and quality reporting of hospital data through these platforms, and devise strategies to improve the dissemination of these data in a quality manner that meets the department’s standards.

The manager provides administrative leadership for the realization of our analytics strategy as it pertains to our broader organizational goals. This includes organizing projects, scrum teams, and workgroups, as needed, to achieve timely resolution to issues and to achieve goals; working closely with internal stakeholders, Digital leadership, as well as Mass General Brigham stakeholders. The senior manager will work toward moving forward the vision and strategy of data driven decision making disseminating business intelligence and end user visualizations throughout our complex, multi-campus organization.

The Senior Manager, (EBI) has the responsibility of expanding Tableau reporting from basic reporting and dashboarding to predictive and prescriptive analytics. The manager will onboard full-time and consulting resources to manage the development of data visualizations.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities

Uses the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration

Manages 6-12 full-time staff consisting of business intelligence developers. Oversees recruitment, training, professional development, and evaluation of staff.

Establishes, refines and implements a vision and strategy for disseminated performance metrics & analytics across the MGB organization.

Elicits data and reporting requirements from hospital administrators, clinicians, and other staff, using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, use cases, scenarios, data analysis, task, and workflow analysis

Performs analysis of existing data sources and reports within the electronic medical record, MGB Snowflake, Data Lake, and other internal and external data sources available in order to provide suggestions on strategy and tactical matters based on knowledge of available data and reports

Identify and implement improvements in analytics and data delivery to MGB staff by leveraging knowledge of business intelligence, data warehousing and healthcare analytics.

Manage the implementation of a multi-year project to roll out Tableau dashboards to staff at all levels, including provider/surgeon performance dashboards in order to drive improvement in transparency, cost, and quality for MGB as a whole

Responsible for managing project budgets, to deliver on analytics projects which require the deployment of temporary consultant resources

Facilitate with Digital senior leaders, which includes key analytics stakeholders across MGB to make decisions about the role, strategy, and further implementation of analytics across MGB

Manage project dependencies and timelines while reporting status and issues and risks to appropriate audiences

Collaborates with other MGB departments as needed, on an ongoing basis

Represents MGB Digital on internal and external committees or task forces as needed

Ensure comprehensive Quality Assurance, and adequate documentation of programs, applications, and operational procedures as part of a project rollout

As needed, lead team to perform data analysis against hospital systems such as Enterprise Data Warehouse, Azure data Lake, MS SQL Server databases, Epic tools, external websites, and Business Intelligence platforms in order to glean meaningful insights and produce actionable reports for DAO customers

Works with new and existing EBI developers to share knowledge in methods of data analysis, summarization and presentation. Trains other analysts and end-users on key analytic and reporting systems and databases


Qualifications

Master degree preferred with two plus years of healthcare management or related experience; or

Bachelor degree in Computer Science or comparable required with five plus years of healthcare management or related experience

Skills & Abilities

Possess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with cross functional teams including staff at all levels of the organization

Ability to successfully negotiate and collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds an levels within and external to the organization

Strong problem solving and negotiation skills

Ability to effectively conduct meetings, both formal and informal

Requires minimal direction from leadership and possesses the ability to learn quickly

Working Conditions

Currently, this position is 100% remote due to COVID-19. In the future, this position will have the opportunity for up to 80% remote work with some in office presence required.

Possible local travel to Mass General Brigham sites

Job Summary:

The Sr. Sales Enablement Analyst position is a critical role as it will enable Sales to be more efficient and effective, primarily through the transformation of data into meaningful insights and the development and maintenance of a centralized sales reporting channel. The main responsibility involves designing, building, and deploying reports and dashboards using Microsoft Business Intelligence Tools such as Power BI, that clearly communicate insights and trends in the data. This role provides an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and forward-thinking organization that values data-driven decision-making. Contributions made will be highly impactful, driving advancements in analytical and reporting capabilities for the organization.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Sales to understand their reporting needs and provide them with actionable, data-driven insights to support their decision-making processes
Use data analysis and visualization techniques to create reports, dashboards, & KPIs in Power BI in support of business goals
Conduct user interviews, translating business needs into report requirements
Participate in sprint and roadmap planning, prioritizing next steps and establishing timelines
Provide ongoing Power BI training to Sales team and internal stakeholders
Monitor usage and drive engagement with Power BI within the organization
Work collaboratively with IT to solve issues and strengthen dataset reporting capabilities
Optimize Sales Reporting channel in terms of design, relevant content and ease of use
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization techniques
Evolve predictive modeling capabilities and identify opportunities for continuous improvement
Provide ad-hoc reporting as needed in support of Sales team, and identify options for automation wherever possible

Education/Experience:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Business or Computer Science related fields
Academic plus equivalent business experience will be considered
MS Power BI suite (Power Query/DAX)
Excellent Power BI skills and other MS Office /software skills
2+ years conducting Sales or Marketing data analysis, preferably in CPG industry
Forecasting, category insights, revenue management experience a plus
2+ years of experience with Power BI development delivering complex reports and dashboards
Tableau or other BI experience will be considered
Analytical/business mind with problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication, collaboration and presentation skills
Knowledge of POS (point of sale) data such as Circana (IRI), Nielsen, SPINS, a plus

Job Title: Business Insights Analyst, Value Creation Office (US Remote)
Job Description:
Purpose

PerkinElmer is seeking a Business Analyst for the Value Creation Office (VCO) - AES Division established underneath the Chief Executive Officer - AES Division to drive operational improvements. This role will report directly to the Chief of Staff to CEO / Head of Value Creation Office within the AES division and be responsible for supporting major operational improvement initiatives in close partnership with business leaders and senior members of the VCO team.

Responsibilities:

Business Analyst, Value Creation Office - AES Division will support multiple workstreams in the VCO that encompass major operational improvement initiatives in a specific business or functional area* that enhance efficiency, increase revenue, and reduce costs. They will have a strong grasp of business fundamentals, a mindset of curiosity, and both desire and ability to play a versatile athlete role to support value creation activities across the full spectrum of business priorities. The role will require a high-performing, resilient and collaborative professional who is excited to roll up their sleeves, quickly get up to speed on new topics, and engage in solving the highest priority challenges for the business. It is expected that this role will provide a successful candidate with the option to fast-track into a business leadership role within several years. As a Business Analyst, this person will:

Work with the VCO team to identify, collect, and refine data required to understand root causes of business challenges; perform analyses, develop recommendations, summarize conclusions and takeaways into quality outputs and present them to the team to drive problem-solving
Further contribute to decision-making on key issues by framing next level questions arising from the analysis, formulating and validating hypotheses, and developing options and scenarios
Own a portfolio of initiatives from start to finish, working under supervision of senior VCO leaders and in partnership with business leaders to successfully implement the improvements
Support tracking and reporting mechanisms within VCO governance structure to monitor initiative value delivery and take corrective actions if required
Support identification, planning, and execution of new value creation opportunities across the business that may fit in the Value Creation Office framework
Support management of Transition Services Agreements (TSAs), including driving governance processes, tracking costing and invoicing, partnering with the business in TSA exit activities, and preparing and executing TSA roll-offs
Contribute to M&A strategy by supporting deal team and company leadership in due diligence, deal execution and post-merger integration of acquired companies
Partner with and provide direction to external advisors, including consulting firms, individual consultants, law firms and others

Examples of focus areas include pricing, salesforce effectiveness, manufacturing and service operations, R&D, supply chain and logistics, sourcing and procurement, real estate, corporate business functions, and other.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Economics or Finance (or a related field)
3+ years of work experience in a relevant business environment in an analytical role
Must be able to not only compile the data but also be able to make specific recommendations and present them to senior leadership.
Mastery of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint applications, command of common financial modeling and data analysis approaches and techniques

Preferred Characteristics:

1+ years of work experience at top-tier consulting firm strongly preferred, ideally with experience in enterprise-wide transformations or functional operational improvement programs
Strong growth mindset and commitment to learning, development and continuous improvement
Demonstrated aptitude for analytical and conceptual problem-solving; facility for quantitative analysis and summarizing complex concepts in easy-to-digest outputs
Experience in understanding issues, analyzing data, deriving conclusions, developing practical solutions and supporting their implementation
Experience with analytical and data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.) preferred
Strong work ethic and motivation, extremely high ownership, low ego (getting things right vs. being right), no-nonsense attitude and “work hard, play hard” mentality
Ability to balance multiple competing priorities and projects with different stakeholders; Excellent prioritization skills and “nose for value” that focuses efforts on the highest ROI work

COMPANY DESCRIPTION:

Are you ready to help improve the lives of millions of people and create a healthier world? When you work at PerkinElmer, that’s exactly what you’ll do. From our dedicated scientists and world-class operations employees to our innovative R&D professionals and committed sales and service groups, we’re a unique team of global colleagues who come to work every day knowing we’re making a difference. Through innovation, collaboration, and belief in our mission, we strive to create an inspiring and inclusive culture for our employees, so they can be their best and, together, create a better tomorrow.

PerkinElmer is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, or veteran status or any other characteristics protected by applicable law. PerkinElmer is committed to a culturally diverse workforce.

The annual compensation range for this full-time position is $64,000 to $96,000. The final base pay offered to the successful candidate will be determined by factors including internal equity, work location, as well as individual qualifications, such as job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Job Title: Senior Manager, Data Analytics and Insights (Regulatory Affairs) - Medical Device Business Services, Inc.
Job Description:
Medical Device Business Services, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, have been working to make surgery better for more than a century. With substantial breadth and depth in surgical technologies, orthopedic and interventional solutions, we aspire to improve and enhance medical care for people worldwide. Together, we are working to shape the future of health through differentiated products and services.

We are currently seeking a Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Insights to support our Regulatory Affairs team for DePuy Synthes. This role will work a hybrid/flex schedule with 3 days per week in office with the preferred location being Raynham, MA. The role may also be located within a commutable distance of DePuy Synthes offices in West Chester, PA, Warsaw, IN, Leeds, UK, Cork, IE, or Zuchwil or Oberdorf Switzerland.

The Sr Manager, Data Analytics & Insights will support the entire DePuy Synthes portfolio and be responsible for providing the development, design and utilization of appropriate databases and analytical reports and tools to establish data strategy, metrics and reporting. They will also be tasked with communicating trends, patterns and other insights that will enable Global Regulatory Affairs to accelerate product registrations, optimize resource capacity through forecast planning, and support the lifecycle management of MedTech products from across multiple business units globally. This role will establish and lead a culture of data-driven decision making across regulatory affairs.

Primary Responsibilities :

Governance & Strategic Assessments .

Establish databases and execute strategies across Regulatory Affairs in order to drive data-based decision making.
Establish consistent, streamlined processes based upon data and trending information, including interfacing with other departments to coordinate the development of regulatory procedures and controls to ensure consistency of regulatory data management.

KPI Tracking.

Develop expertise in various data sources in order to build queries or other automated, reusable, routines to extract, transform, load and aggregate data into digestible and actionable formats to build & monitor regulatory Key Performance Indicators.
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in processes and procedures that impact the regulatory organization.
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources to continually enhance the quality of analytics.
Troubleshoot data integrity issues, analyze data for its completeness and ability to meet business needs, and propose solutions or recommendations.

Organizational Planning .

Responsible for Global Demand Forecasting and Projections (Cross-Franchise/Region).
Partners with stakeholders to recommend and implement strategic planning initiatives throughout global organization.
Works with RALT on tracking initiatives and planning associated meetings.

Communication & Shaping

Leverage Microsoft Power BI and other tools to tell a compelling story that provides insight into data using key metrics and meaningful, interactive visualizations.
Recommends, develops, tracks and reports performance metrics
Create data models and measures used by Power BI and in self-service reporting.
Work with internal stakeholders to acquire business knowledge regarding appropriate use of data elements, establish and maintain common business rules, ensure a single source of truth, and align key metrics across the organization to ensure consistency.
Training Associates on regulatory data management processes and platforms.
Qualifications

Required Qualifications :

Bachelors’ Degree required , Advanced Degree strongly preferred ; desired fields of study include Data Sciences, Engineering, Technology, Statistics, or related fields.
Minimum 7+ years of relevant data analytics & insights experience in a highly regulated industry; Med Device experience preferred .
Minimum 5+ years project management experience; PMP Certification desired .
Six Sigma Green Belt certification strongly preferred .
Working knowledge of product data management systems and configuration management methodology preferred.
Familiarity with current data analytics applications (MDRIM, Tableau, PowerBI, Alteryx, Excel, SharePoint, ADAPTIV, Promapp).
Process excellence tools, methodologies, and software (e.g. Visio, ProMapp).
Working knowledge of regulatory requirements, processes and terminology.
Customer-service oriented self-starter with excellent analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills and a readiness to initiate and manage change.
Ability to work collaboratively in a matrix environment, building local and global partnerships.
Adept at translating business requirements into appropriate reporting, dashboard/scorecard, and self-service solutions.
Clear verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Overview:
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for establishing and maintaining standards for systems analysis, requirements gathering, project artifact development, standards for vendor management and responsible for the analysis of new business system development. The Senior Business Analyst will work towards the goal of maximizing business value delivery through application development lifecycle. In this role, you will collaborate with senior business and IT leadership groups to assist in the prioritization of projects.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Performing workflow analysis, creating workflow diagrams and making recommendations for procedural improvements – understanding and articulating “current state” and “future state” of various systems
Performing and preparing Impact Analysis documentation with the help of the project teams for new systems or enhancements to existing systems
Establishing and maintaining approaches, methods, procedures, and standards for the analysis of the broad range of operational and enterprise applications. Demonstrating by example the benefits of new approaches and methods that shorten development life cycles reduce rework, and improve the capability of purchased and developed solutions
Developing and guiding team members in requirements elicitation, analysis, and functional specification activities for complex projects or programs. Developing and maintaining training materials for business analysts and programmers for various system and functionalities.
The Senior Business Analyst will be involved in all aspects of the project lifecycle from initiation to closing, to ensure that the technical solution meets business needs. Advancing and broadening the business analysis competency, standards and processes to support the strategic and long term objectives for the organization acting as Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) for various eCommerce applications.
Working with various groups like Development, QA, UAT, Infrastructure support. etc., for a resource allocation plan for the IT Projects working with manager.
Ensuring compliance with standards and practices to establish higher quality deliverables
Collecting and analyzing metrics to enable and lead continuous improvement of the Business Analysis processes.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems or equivalent experience.
15 years of software development including Business Analysis experience on projects where Information Technology was a primary component
10 years of Business Analysis Experience in Property and Casualty Insurance domain.
Detailed understanding of Policy Admin, eCommerce, Billing, Claims and financial applications along with understanding of various third party integrations like LexisNexis Prefill, CREDIT, MRV, CLUE etc. is a must.
Experience with Web Analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager etc. is a must.
Excellent understanding of Web Service and APIs and familiarity with SQL, XML, HTML, XSLT, JSON etc. along with tools like Postman, REST API and SOAP UI etc. is highly desirable.
Demonstrated ability to apply disciplined and rigorous approaches to analysis that include object and entity-relationship modeling, state-transition diagramming, and related approaches to custom developed application.
Demonstrated ability to support digital capabilities (e.g., development of interactive web-based applications).
Excellent communication, presentation and, interpersonal skills
Strong analytical capability; ability to think strategically, solve problems and recommend approaches and solutions
Data Management experience, database knowledge preferred, and experience with MS SQL
Project Management or related certifications preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, and Project) strong emphasis on MS Visio (wireframes and workflows)
INS and CPCU certifications are highly desirable.
IIBA - CBAP and AAC Certification a plus.


About the Company

The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $1.8 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 2,000 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.

Job Title: Data Scientist/Senior Data Scientist, Insights & Analytics
Job Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description

Objectives:

Data Scientist/Senior Data Scientists within the Insights & Analytics team of the Applied Data Sciences & Learning organization will be accountable for driving the development of descriptive, predictive & prescriptive analytics to generate insights to solve challenging business problems. Data Scientists will work with multi-disciplinary teams to understand business needs and develop analytic & model outputs that are translatable into actionable business insights. This is a hands-on role, and the successful candidate must be comfortable working in an agile environment and capable of leading delivery at pace.

Accountabilities:

Collaborate with a diverse set of users and partners across multiple functions to translate unstructured, complex business problems into appropriate data, modelling and analytical solutions.

Lead data science projects through the data, analytics & machine learning lifecycle.

Clearly and objectively communicate results, as well as their associated limitations.

Apply and maintain methods, techniques and developments in analytics and data science.

Mentor and support other data scientists across multiple projects to drive the development of data science as a capability.

Develop & review working practices to ensure that data science work is delivered to robust quality standards.

Core Elements Related to this Role:

4-8 years of experience in data science in the Life Sciences sector (Pharmaceutical / biotech. / medical device companies, healthcare payers and providers etc.). Level flexibility available based on experience.

Experience in working with data from clinical trials and associated standards, vocabularies etc.(CDISC, MedDRA, LOINC etc.) and any of the following sources and types: RWD, digital devices, imaging, audio, operational data (finance, manufacturing, supply chain management etc.).

Expertise in data cleaning, & pre-processing methods to normalize data.

Extensive experience with database querying (SQL), manipulating and analyzing large, high dimensional, structured, & unstructured datasets.

Experience in code management, version control, cloud computing infrastructure (e.g., AWS).

Expertise with programming languages (Python, R, Julia etc.) and visualization tools.

Proficiency with unsupervised, supervised, & reinforcement machine learning methods.

Expertise in one or several areas of AI (natural language processing, graph theory etc.).

Familiarity with deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.

Understanding of algorithm design, development, optimization, scaling and application.

Experience working in Cloud Computing environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, etc.), using project management tools & technology, Agile development framework.

Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills.

Dimensions and Aspects:

Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise:

Comprehensive understanding of the Life Sciences sector (Pharmaceutical / biotech. / medical device companies, healthcare payers and providers etc.).

Leadership:

Demonstrated ability to work across functions, regions and cultures

Excellent communicator, able to persuasively convey both ideas and data, verbally and in writing

Proven skills as an effective team player who can engender credibility and confidence within and outside the company

Embraces and demonstrates a diversity and inclusion mindset and role models these behaviors for the organization

Invests time in helping others to enhance their skills and perform at a higher level

Decision-making and Autonomy:

Decision making responsibilities: Ability to seek diverse input from multiple constituents and stakeholders to drive innovative solutions

Interaction:

Cultivates a broad network of relationships throughout Takeda, with affiliates and external partners, in the industry and area of expertise.

Ability to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with other interfacing Takeda functions

Innovation:

Comfortable challenging the status quo and bringing forward innovative solutions

Identifies opportunities and anticipates changes in the business landscape through an understanding and ongoing assessment of the environment affecting the business.

Complexity:

Ability to work in a global ecosystem (internal and external)

Education, Behavioral Competencies and Skills:

Essential Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or other quantitative field.

Desirable: Masters/PhD in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or another quantitative field.

Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.

This position is eligible to be considered for remote hiring anywhere in the USA

Summary of This Role

We seek an energetic, motivated, and articulate team player to join the Product team as a Product Owner to manage the delivery of ERP integrations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the delivery of the ERP integration roadmap while working cross-functionally with internal teams to maintain product excellence and release new features to benefit customers. Qualified candidates should be self-starters with proven track records of success and have an interest in joining a fast-paced software organization.

What Part Will You Play?

Manage the delivery of ERP integrations (product development to product launch), ensuring execution is in line with a project plan, for small or moderately complex new product initiatives or existing product initiatives.

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, sales, and customer success to ensure the successful development, launch, and adoption of the product. Complies with the established methodology for managing product strategy.

Manages the details of product backlog and ensures continual enhancements to existing products.

Understand the ERP integration landscape and identify opportunities to improve product offerings and customer experience.

Collaborates with product marketing to develop product marketing strategies based on established product objectives, costs, and value propositions. Review research with product marketing to quantify value proposition for inputs and marketing collateral.

Develops business cases requiring minimal analytical skills for new product functionality to serve as inputs to decision-making, prioritization, pricing, and client value proposition.

Participates in product concept and requirements workshops with clients and internal development teams in pursuit of product requirements, objectives, and architecture decisions. Documents workshop results in a format suitable for consumption by all audiences, including interactive review and feedback from clients and internal parties.

Supports the collaboration with product delivery and technology architecture to validate detailed design, particularly to ensure that product objectives and key requirements are met and aligned with the market needs and the business unit strategy. Completes required documentation and provides design direction, testing support, and general assistance to the delivery team, as needed, during the execution phase of product development consisting of moderate complexities and scopes.

What Are We Looking For in This Role?

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree

Relevant Experience or Degree in Business or Computer Science; Combination of relevant training and/ or experience in lieu of degree

Minimum 2 Years of Relevant Exp

Experience in similar business product services and/or external customer/market experience

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

Prefer experience in a software development environment or in a professional services role. Prefer software or IT background (i.e., degree or experience). Prefer direct experience with doing software development, testing and/or business analysis. Prefer experience with Agile software products and delivery methodology.

Strong understanding of ERP systems, such as Oracle, Sage, SAP, or Microsoft Dynamics, and experience integrating financial software products with these systems.

Experience working in an “empowered product team” structure.

What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?

Skills / Knowledge - Having wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve moderately complex issues in creative and effective ways. Having ownership of the ERP integration sub-function and applying knowledge to meet goals, maintain relationships, and propose opportunities to expand the business.

Job Complexity - Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Networks with key contacts outside their own area of expertise.

This position is eligible to be considered for remote hiring anywhere in the USA

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst—Digital Health Sciences
Job Description:
Full time, remote or hybrid position in Cambridge, MA

About the Job

A tier 1 pharmaceutical company is seeking a business systems analyst to support a Digital Health Sciences effort intended to pilot and refine new patient-centric technologies.

Responsibilities

Your duties, responsibilities, and competencies would include:

· Participating in project teams activities and playing an active role in prioritizing tasks and timelines.

· Contributing to the team by identifying/analyzing systems or solutions according to the business case, user requirements and benefits.

· Identifying technical and support needs and trends, determining root cause and potential solutions.

· Collaborating with multiple stakeholders, including internal teams and vendor partners, to ensure completion of a set of pre-defined tasks.

· Participating in prototyping and demonstrations of systems or solutions, and where applicable, coordinating efforts and ensuring business and functional requirements are met to achieve the overall goals.

· Facilitating business and technical requirements discussions to obtain a core set of desired capabilities.

· Generating documentation for the business process(es) and related requirements in suitable formats required by business representatives and SDLC such as user stories, acceptance criteria.

· Participating in alpha, beta or user acceptance testing, as applicable to the assigned project.

· Participating in the development of life cycle management processes and making.

· Supporting vendor selection, coordination, documentation of use cases and requirements, ad-hoc testing, and user facilitation through the pilot process.

Qualifications

· Bachelor’s or master’s degree in health or life sciences, biotechnology, computer science or related field

· 2–3+ years of working experience as business analyst, working on digital products, gathering, analyzing and documenting software specifications is required with an emphasis on analysis of clinical trial data

· Experience with decentralized clinical trials is required

· Proficient in Software development Life cycle (SDLC)

· Proficient in computerized system validation and data integrity

· Working knowledge of Quality Assurance, Regulatory compliance

· Experience in Agile, Scrum, and Kanban

· Experience with wearables and data collection in clinical trials a plus

Job Title: Senior Business Consultant, Personalized Planning & Advice
Job Description:
Job Description:

Bring your passion for delivering new product capabilities for customers and helping improve a key Fidelity managed account product offering to the Portfolio Personalization squad in the Personalized Planning & Advice for Workplace (PP&A-W) product area. We are looking for a leader with experience in product development, business analysis, project management and the ability to understand and thrive in a complex business and systems environment.

As a Senior Business Consultant supporting Fidelity’s Workplace Investing (WI) business, you will be a member of an Agile squad responsible for critical enhancements to our managed accounts product to drive more highly personalized portfolios for participants. This squad works in the underlying technology layers of PP&A W and partners with technology teams in WI and Personal Investing (PI).

In this role, you'll work with dedicated, cross functional teammates and senior leaders in marketing, product, sales, technology to improve existing products or bring new products to life. You will work with your squad to provide effective collaboration through communication, risk mitigation, quality assurance, effective delivery and building strong working relationships across the organization. As a Senior Business Consultant, you must be a highly motivated self-starter with a sense of ownership, attention to detail, and be an effective liaison between partners and your team.

The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Identify and document business requirements, current and future states, and provide constructive feedback for future process improvements.
Ability to summarize and interpret your initiatives to peers and leadership.
Problem solving skills with the ability to take initiative, draw conclusions, and communicate ideas for the purposes of improving business processes or developing new products.
Proficient in various business analysis methodologies. For example, data analysis, use case development, product documentation and defining epics, user stories and acceptance criteria. Facilitate story refinement sessions, and demo sprint results.
Ability to lead and facilitate diverse groups of people to move towards solutions while influencing key decision makers based on analysis findings.
Facilitating and coordinating across multiple teams, and business partners.
Ability to balance multiple priorities with strong organization and time management skills.
Familiar with the Agile methodology concept and experience in agile tools such as Jira, Confluence, Mural or similar Agile backlog management tools.
Perform end to end Business Acceptance Testing and ensure the traceability of test cases.
5-7 years transferable experience.
Bachelor’s degree preferred; Business Analysis certifications desirable.

Certifications:

Company Overview

Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients' money.


Join Us

At Fidelity, you'll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples' lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees' Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. And you don't need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you've always imagined.

At Fidelity, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we’re calling “Dynamic Working”. Most associates will have a hybrid schedule with a requirement to work onsite at a Fidelity work location for at least one week, 5 consecutive days, every four weeks. These requirements are subject to change.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.


Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

Job Description

The Director of Upstream Marketing, Biopsy & Surgical Solutions has primary responsibility for determining product management, development and investment strategy across a growing product line of the Breast and Skeletal Health Biopsy & Surgical Solutions business. This role will be responsible for ensuring that the business maintains the right cadence of innovation and launches in order to maintain the impressive growth trajectory. This position will be responsible for building and leading a team of product managers.

Strategic Development

Creates multi-year strategic growth plans and a robust global product roadmap, drives alignment on strategy with Sr. Leadership and R&D peers
Translate the business goals to strategic plans that will drive revenues and exceed financial performance expectations worldwide.
Create global market overview maps of key applications and technologies
Identify and predict strategic competitive plays and market positioning.
Map out competitive strategy and develop / execute strategy to advance the business.
Bring a creative and innovative approach to one’s work to differentiate company products from competitors in the marketplace.
Develop a deep understanding of cancer biopsy & surgical solutions, customer needs, market trends, technology trends, identification and assessment of significant growth opportunities, and create strategies that deliver profitable market share. Identify and execute market research activities to drive business platform/portfolio decisions.
Identify and pursue incremental growth opportunities (new markets, new channels, regional opportunities, tech uses, etc.) outside and within the existing portfolio.
Conduct opportunity modeling of new technology platforms including cannibalization / obsolescence of existing products.
Identify immediate, midterm and long term product gaps within the portfolio and provide solutions to fill the gaps.
Identify Product Strategy
Determine / prioritize key unmet needs and opportunities
Lead team in defining market opportunities
Leads cross-functional team to ensure resource allocations and focus consistent with the needs of the business
Work with Downstream Marketing colleagues to develop pre-launch marketing conditioning plans and product launch plans.
Collaborate with the Global, U.S. and International regional leadership to ensure visibility and financial ownership for new products in development
Create a portfolio management process that allows the company to analyze and manage the total investment portfolio.
Partner with stakeholders to develop processes and tools to effectively manage the business needs for different classifications of investments and projects
Develop consistent approaches to project proposals, market models, metrics (ROIs, NPVs) and market assumptions to enable strategic discussions and informed decisions

Qualifications

General Qualifications

Must be able to communicate vision and win others over to a unified strategy
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Program Management or equivalent. MBA preferred.
Eight to ten (8-10) years of progressively more responsible business experience in a class III medical device company or equivalent, including product, market or program management experience.
A substantive knowledge of the medical device industry, health care delivery, and managed care/reimbursement markets and the factors that drive them.
A thorough understanding of marketing, strategy and M&A processes.
Strong device business acumen, strategic thinking, commercial focus and customer skills.
Exceptional project management skills.
Ability to foster collaboration, influence others outside of reporting structure and work collaboratively across a matrix structure.
Analytical skills enabling financial modeling, business analysis and progress tracking and visibility.
Ability to work with US and International internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to predict, prevent/identify and address obstacles impeding progress.
Seasoned judgment acquired through organizational experience and a demonstrated record of achievements in successfully building a business.
Demonstrated verbal and written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills; the ability to lead a cross-functional team.
Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment.
Strong leadership skills, including the ability to set goals and provide positive and constructive feedback respectfully to build positive relationships and improve business results.
Ability to travel approximately 30%, including internationally.
